loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, Vita, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional goods which she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Kabba

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Kabba. He is married and has four children, aged 13, 10, 7 and 1 years old. Three are going to school.

In 2010, Kabba established his business selling plastic shoes for men, women and children. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,300,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan for the amount of 5,000,000 SLL in order to buy bundles of plastic shoes, sandals and slippers. 

Kabba has bought a motorcycle, instead of a vehicle, and a piece of land. He has not yet been able to open a shop because of inadequate capital.  This loan will help to expand his business. He is a hard-working and committed businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bundles of plastic shoes, sandals and slippers.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Isata. She is married and has two children aged 3 and 16. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her. She is her younger sister and she is helping her with her education. In 2002, Isata established her hair and products, jeans, shirts, and t-shirts business. She began her business just to be self-reliant after graduating from school. Her business is located on the outskirts of town and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about SLL 2,313,310 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Isata has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy cosmetics. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve the stock and raise more profit. In the future, Isata plans to expand the business to the center of the town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for shoes, t-shirts, blouses, hair, hair products, body creams, perfumes, and jeans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cartons of toothpaste, tissue, bath soap, mineral water, and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Rwengyiri Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
Allen is a divorced woman with three children of which two are in school, and one who dropped out due to lack of tuition.

Allen operates a small bar in the trading centre. Allen also is a farmer and sells agricultural produce on a small scale because of limited capital. She requested for a loan through the group to add to her working capital so as to increase her cash flow. She will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children and buy them a few basic needs. Her customers are people around the centre who buy her items especially for home consumption. Her major challenge is competition and inadequate capital to run the business which affect her during her business operations. 

Despite all these challenges, Allen is a very hard working woman who is striving hard to provide a good education and a good standard of living for her children. And she thinks with support from her group members, Kiva lenders as well as UGAFODE, her dreams will come true.

loans.use: To buy beans and ground nuts to sell and pay for school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain and protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is a 25-year old high school graduate and lives in the rural village in Bago City. She is married to Esteban, who works as an employee of a forwarder company. They have 2 children aged 3 and 2 years old. Their total monthly income is only Php 10,000($222). Elsie  has long seen the need to help her spouse but didn't have the means until she learned about the 2-month training program of BagoSphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagospheres selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition. Once Elsie starts earning, she can help provide her family’s basic needs and save some money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny vive en la ciudad de Oropesa al sur del Cusco y continua con el negocio de la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, chanchos y gallinas, ella en sus horas libres se dedica ayudar a la demás panaderas en la elaboración del pan “Chuta”. En esta oportunidad Marleny requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales como por ejemplo gallinas.
texts.en:
Marleny lives in the city of Oropresa in the south of the Cusco province, and she is continuing her animal breeding business. She raises and breeds animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs. To supplement her income from the animal sales business, Marleny also bakes a traditional bread called "Chuta" bread in her spare time. 

With the support from this loan, Marleny plans to purchase animals, such as chickens, to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to purchase animals (such as chickens) for resale at her business.

loans.name: 11-04-03 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Ms. Sen has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase cloth for this business.This is Sen's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Sen is 64 years old and  is single with 2 children. She is the leader of the 11-04-02 Trường Thi solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, since her children are grown up.

Sen has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Sen faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Sen hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 37 years old and married. Lilit works very hard to provide for them.

Lilit runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Lilit has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, fabric conditioner, shampoo, diapers, sugar, coffee, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Lilit would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Idalina

texts.en:
Idalina is 30 years old, and she is now applying for a loan of $800.00 to improve her business.  She opened her motorcycle taxi business in 2000 with her own working capital of $200.00.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy such as gasoline and oil repairing cars and motorcycles. She is a very hard working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 14 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and oil for repairing cars and motorcycles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. 

She is running a rental house that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to repair the house by buying sand, cement and stone.

She opened her business  a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To repair the house by buying sand, cement and stone.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen vive en la ciudad de Oropesa al sur de Cusco y le va muy bien. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y responsable que sigue dedicándose ayudar a preparar pan. Ya son varios  años que trabaja en el horno y le va exclente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Carmen también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas  y cuyes. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes. 

Carmen pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in the city of Oropesa, south of Cusco, and it is going very well for her. She is an enterprising and responsible woman who continues to makes a living helping to prepare bread. It has already been many years that she has been working with the bakery and it is going excellently thanks to the determination she applies to her work. Carmen also makes a living raising small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. In this opportunity, she requires the loan to purchase guinea pigs.

Carmen belongs to the communal bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” from the Arariwa Association, and she is thankful for the opportunity provided by this means. She promises to complete her scheduled payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Telfilo

texts.en: Telfilo, age 38, is married and blessed with two children. He has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost nine years, earning a net income of about PHP 1,500 daily. His daily income is usually spent on the school allowances for their two children. Due to lack of capital to run his business, he's requesting a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase beverages to sell in his store. He's hoping that his business will continue to grow and earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase beverages to sell in his store.

loans.name: 08-02-02-Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase chickens and ducks to kill and sell chicken and duck meat. She is 41 years old and she is married with two children. Thủy is the group leader of the 08-02-02-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2012, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and ducks to kill and sell chicken and duck meat.

loans.name: Jeysel

texts.en:
Jeysel is married and she is operating a buy-and-sell business to make a living. She has been doing this for more than a year while her husband works as a baker in a bakery. 

To gain more profit, Jeysel wants to add capital to her business. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to gain access to microfinance services. 

She borrowed a loan to buy additional ready to wear clothes to sell. In the future, the couple plans to build their own bakery, to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional ready to wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Evan, 30 years old, is from the town of Panglao, Bohol. He has two children who are one and five years old. Evan has been raising hogs and also doing fishing for two years now. He is asking for a loan to further invest in his business. He will use the loan to buy piglets and sacks of feed. Evan hopes that he can always provide what his family needs. His income will be for his children's healthy meals.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy piglets and sacks of feed

loans.name: Darlene Rose

texts.en:
Darlene Rose is a 32-year-old woman from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She is married with four children ages two to nine. Her husband is a construction worker and is also engaged in fishing business. Darlene Rose on the other hand sell shrimp and fresh fish in the community. She is also making sure that she can help prepare the fishing tools from time to time. She is asking for a loan of 7000 PHP to buy kerosene lamp, fish net and styro box. 

In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business in order to provide better for her family.

loans.use: to buy kerosene lamp, fish net and styro box

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en: Anatalia has been operating a general store for many years. She earns well from this and with her profit, she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. Her husband helps her in running the business and it has become their main source of income. Her previous loan was used for purchasing inventory goods. Some of their children live with their own family and they had to sustain their living while they can manage. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She really wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 43 years old and with five children, three of whom are in school, Jessica works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell, like chips, eggs, milk, canned goods and cream, etc.

She has been in this business for 3 years. In the future Jessica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell, like chips, eggs, milk, canned goods and cream, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean, 49, is married. She lives with her family in a village of the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has five children. For the last 31 years, Hean and her husband have been working as construction workers. Together, they can earn about 50,000 KHR per day from the current business.

Hean is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is now applying for a loan to buy an electric generator ​​​​for supporting her business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Samin

texts.en: Samin, 53, is married with six children. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Memot district and the main sources of her family’s income are from cassava growing and rubber tree planting; it is the business that she has had for ages. Samin has been with VisionFund for two cycles with successful repayments. For this cycle, she wants to focus on her child's education instead. Therefore, she applied for an education loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to cover the tuition fee for her son who wants to continue a tertiary degree majoring in Nursing. She hopes that this financial aid will help her son to not worry about his school's cost and pay more attention in his study.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fee for her son

loans.name: Va Sin's Group

texts.en:
A widower father of three kids in early 40s, Va is a resident from Battambang province.  He runs an agribusiness and works for others for a fee to supplement his income. 

This is Va's seventh loan cycle and the second cycle for his group's co-borrowers.  They seek 1,200,000 KHR each with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  Va's living conditions are getting better, which is a result of his past loans. 

Va is the group's leader.  He will spend his loan portion to start up a pig-raising business.  Va will purchase feed for raising pigs.  He hopes to get a good income so he can keep improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica  has been operating an internet cafe' for years, earning well for her two children's needs. She sent them to school to gain a better education from the profit she earned and successfully repaid her previous loan, used for buying printers and accessories. Recently, she took a new loan to buy chairs, office accessories and pay for an office renovation for better service to her customers. In the future, she wants her business to grow and hopes she can witness her children's success.

loans.use: to buy chairs, office accessories, and pay for an office renovation for better service to her customers.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic  is 51 years old, married, and has two adult aged children.

Marivic has a farm and plants different commodities. She earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan for ricefield expenses. Marivic wants to buy farm inputs and fertilizers for land preparation.

Marivic  has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizers for land preparation

loans.name: Cesar Evaristo

texts.es: Cesar es  un joven de 38 años de edad, de profesión administrador de empresas, se dedica a su propio negocio de venta de mochilas  y ropa variada  como sabanas, cubre colchones, es padre de familia de un hijo de 2 añitos, junto a su esposa intenta salir adelante con su negocio, requiere de este crédito para invertir en edredones, mochila, pañales, mosquiteros, colchas entre otros de la demanda de sus clientes, que le permitan mantener sus ingresos y surtido de productos.
texts.en:
Cesar is a 38-year-old youth who works as a business administrator. He has made a living in his own business selling backpacks and a variety of cloth goods such as sheets and cushions.

He is the father of a 2-year-old son. Along with his wife, he intends to come out ahead with his business. He requires this loan to invest in quilts, backpacks, diapers, mosquito netting, and bedspreads, among others according to his customers’ demands, which allow him to maintain his income and product supply.

loans.use: to purchase quilts, backpacks, diapers, and mosquito netting.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase fertilizer and other farms inputs needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

Nida would like to apply for another 15, 000 PHP loan to buy more fertilizer and farm inputs. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. Nida looks forward to this financial improvement with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

She hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of having a good life. She meets up faithfully with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Luimark

texts.en:
Luimark, a father of two, provides transportation services in their village to make a living. For more than seven years he earns well to provide the family. It is his main source of income. He needs to buy tires and other maintenance of his motorcycle to improve the services. 

His wife is responsible for taking care of their children and for the household chores. 

With the microfinance loan from GDMPC, the motorcycle now runs safely and smoothly. In the future, Luimark wants to acquire a new motorcycle to use it for expansion of his services.

loans.use: to buy tires and other maintenance

loans.name: Mieu

texts.en:
Mieu is a 57-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn money by running a food stall that sells noodles to the people in their community.

Mieu would like a loan to purchase a better quality food to sell to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family. 

The words in the picture are not the name of the client's business.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Elmere

texts.en:
Elmere is 62 years old and married, with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elmere is borrowing PHP 22,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elmere has been raising pigs for 20 years and earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es: Doña Orbelina, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo con quien vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Ella siempre a buscado donde obtener ingresos y ha decidido vender mercadería, vende ropa como blusas, faldas, camisas, pantalones, usados y nuevos. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar camisas, blusas, faldas, pantalones y otra mercadería que le encarguen. El propósito es incrementar el inventario y tener mas clientes y su meta a futuro es lograr tener un local fijo para el negocio y mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Doña Orbelina is 43 years old and a single mother. She has one child that she lives with in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.

She is always looking for a way to make more income and she has decided to sell merchandise. She sells clothing like blouses, skirts, shirts, and pants, both used and new. She makes her sales as a street vendor and she takes orders.

The loan she is requesting is for 6,000 lempiras. She will use it to buy shirts, blouses, skirts, pants, and other merchandise that has been ordered. The purpose is to increase her inventory and gain more customers. Her goals for the future are to acquire a stable storefront for her business and to improve her family's income.

loans.use: to supply clothing like shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, and other merchandise in demand.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is 30 years of age, married with 3 children, who are school-aged. Ricky is presently residing in Aguada, Ozamis City. Ricky already had an existing mini-restaurant business in his house. He requested a loan to buy kilos of meat and spices for his restaurant .

Ricky hopes that he can be able to expand his business in the future and he can save money for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy kilos of meat and spices for his restaurant

loans.name: Kent Mark

texts.en: Kent Mark is 34 years old; he is married with 1 child, and lives in Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del NOrte, Mindanao, Philippines. In order to earn a living, Kent Mark operates a store that sells motorcycle spare parts and accessories. In 2013, he became an active member of PMPC. He wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy additional motorcycle spare parts and accessories. Kent Mark plans to save money for the college education of his son so that he can help him in the future, and to repair their house.

loans.use: to buy additional motorcycle spare parts and accessories for his business

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon has been 12 years in his service-based business providing repairs and maintenance of motorcycle and other electrical works. His perseverance gets stronger for the sake of his growing children. For that, he applied for a loan at GDMPC Micro Credit for additional working capital to purchase tools, spare parts accessories needed for repair services in his shop. In the future, he aims to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools, spare parts accessories needed for repair services in his shop.

loans.name: Maria Aleen

texts.en:
Maria Aleen has been operating a general store for many years, and she earns well for the family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She saved a portion of her profit for the improvement of their house. 

Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her shop.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 48 years old and lives in Clarin Mis. Occ. She is married with three adult–aged children. 

Imelda has a rice milling business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan for rice milling expenses to pay for rice milling expenses like maintenance, spare parts and lubricants.

Imelda has been a member of PMPC for less than three years. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her living conditions

loans.use: to pay for rice milling expenses like maintenance, spare parts and lubricants

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah lives in Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya with her husband and two children who both go to public schools. She has an acre of land where she produces and sells milk, eggs, vegetables and tea. 

Besides farming, she has a retail business and a transportation business via motorbike. In farming, she enjoys selling her products at higher prices hence making a good profit. Her challenge is insufficient rain leading to drought hence limited feeds for her animals.

Fridah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they finance assets to the farmers of all kinds without discrimination. This loan will enable her to start banana plantation to be able to feed her animals in difficult situations, plus the bananas will bring in more income. She will use the returns to educate her children.

loans.use: to start a banana plantation

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is widow with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 56 years old and has two children who are in school.

Amelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Amelita requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell to restart her business activities.

Amelita has been in this business for 3 years and because of the typhoon she start will start again and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Eva works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a coffee shop.  Eva is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Sok Ry Sory's Group

texts.en:
Sok Ry is a mother of one child and is aged in her late 20s. Her hometown is in Kampong Cham province, where her business is run. The main sources of her income are from rice farming, a grocery selling business, and her paid working during her spare time. The five years of engagement in her current business has enabled her to earn up to 31,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second microloan for Sok Ry and the first loan for her fellow-group member in the same group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully managed her past loan, which she has paid back completely, to upgrade her lifestyle better than before. 

As the leader, she will spend her portion to pay for plowing her paddy rice farmland and use some portion of her loan to buy more grocery items for resale. 

She hopes to earn triple income, better than before, so she can keep her kid in school.

loans.use: to pay for plowing her paddy rice farmland and buy more grocery items for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
Rosenda es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Rosenda es una madre soltera de 39 años que tiene 2 hijos, la más grande ya esta casada y el pequeño tiene 2 años y vive con ella. También tiene un nieto de 7 años de edad. Se considera una persona responsable que ha sabido sacar a su familia adelante. Su negocio es una tortilleria, que es un alimento basico de dia con dia, yo elaboro las tortillas, que son conocidas como las mejores de la zona. Me dedico a esto desde hace 27 años. Ella esta solicitando el prestamos porqué quiere ponerle una losa a una cuartos de su casa, porque piensa rentarlos y conseguir una entrada de ingresos adicional.
texts.en:
Rosenda is a client of Kubo Financial, and this is her story.

Rosenda is 39 years old and is a single mother to her two children. Her older daughter is married and her younger son is 2 years old and lives with her. She also has a 7-year-old grandson. Rosenda considers herself a responsible person who has worked very hard to help her family get ahead in life. She runs a tortilla business where she makes some of the most delicious tortillas in town. Rosenda has been making tortillas for the past 27 years.

With the support from this loan, Rosenda plans to finish off a couple rooms in her house so she can rent them out and generate additional income to support her family.

loans.use: to finish a couple rooms in her house so she can rent them and generate additional income to support her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to be able to help her avocado crops.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
A $ 600.00 loan is offered to Luisa to improve her business. She is married and she has one child. She opened her garden in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy crowbars, shovels, knives and machetes. She is generating a good income from selling.

Luisa has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy crowbars, shovels, knives and  machetes.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 30 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $800.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has five children. She opened her rental house in 2000 with her own working capital of $100.00. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan for items for her home repair, like stone, sand, cement and wood. She is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy items to repair her rental home, like stone, sand, cement and wood

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila was born in the year 1968. She is divorced and has a little child. She is a hardworking and smart woman. She always tries to find new sources of income to offer good living conditions for her child. She has been busy with selling women’s clothes and shoes in a local market. Jamila has run this business for more than six years. She has enough experience to develop her business. She manages her business alone. Jamila every season, renews her goods. She must to buy women’s clothes for the new spring season. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy women’s clothes. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothes for the new spring season.

loans.name: Tuk

texts.en: Tuk is 52 years old and lives in the village of Chong Doung, Baray, Kampong Thom province. Tuk is a widow and has two children, who are single and employed in their own careers. Having worked in agriculture for years, Tuk has become a very skilled and experienced farmer. Besides farming activities, Tuk makes and sells rattan products for additional income. Tuk is asking for a loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. They have never had a safe latrine before. Thanks to the water loan program, with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Tuk is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions. She is taking action to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her family

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon, 47, is a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. He is a widower and has a child. He and his child manage their household as he operated the business. He is working hard to provide for his family's everyday needs.

Ramon maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one Tricycle (motor cycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He works early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives until the wee hours in order to have a bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 500 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a loan of Php 12,000. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to keep his unit in good condition in order to have regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Ramon dreams of having another tricycle unit and hopes that his child will finish his studies. He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain his tricycle.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is married with three children. She is 50 years old and lives in Tukuran, Philippines. Elma is a farmer and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer for banana plantation. Elma has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Elma hopes to have her own delivery van.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en: Nila is married with five children. She is 47 years old and lives in the Tukuran, Philippines. Nila is a farmer and grows banana to earn a living; she has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her farming activities. Nila has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Nila hopes to buy another farmland to till.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 49 years old and married with nine children, five of whom are in school. Concepcion works very hard to provide for them. She runs a buy-and-sell dry goods in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of personal products like hairpin, hairnet, shampoo, etc.

Concepcion has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Concepcion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of personal products like hairpin, hairnet, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Alma Luna

texts.en:
Alma Luna is 57 years old, with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Alma Luna has a buying and selling of yakult business in the Philippines. Alma Luna requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional packs of yakult (probiotic dairy product) to sell.

Alma Luna has been in this business for three years. In the future, Alma luna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional packs of yakult (probiotic dairy product) to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Antonio works hard to support his family.

He has a bread vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Antonio is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more bread to sell for his bread vending business.

Antonio has been sustaining his business activities through his past 13 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 30 years old and has one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Alicia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future she would like to save enough to provide secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marjona

texts.ru:
Марчона живет в столице Таджикистана, в городе Душанбе вместе с мужем, свекровью и тремя детьми. Ее муж строитель, а дети еще маленькие. Марчоне 24 года. Она начала заниматься шитьем три года назад, чтобы помогать мужу обеспечивать семью. Эта профессия перешла Марчоне от матери. Она творчески подходит к своей работе и сама придумывает фасоны для платьев. Платья, сшитые ею всегда отличаются от других. 
Сейчас Марчона обратилась за кредитом для покупки новой швейной машинки, чтобы ускорить темп шитья и улучшить качество работы.
texts.en:
Marjona lives in the capital of Tajikistan, the city of Dushanbe, with her husband, mother-in-law, and three children. Her husband works in construction and her children are still very young. Marjona is 24 years old. She began her sewing business three years ago to help her husband provide for their family. This profession was passed down to Marjona from her mother. She approaches her work creatively and thinks up styles for her dresses. The dresses she sews always stand out from other dresses.

Now Marjona is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine to increase the pace of her sewing and improve the quality of her work.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to develop her sewing business.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras está en su ciclo número 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde  las integrantes se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza para ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Carmen es una de las integrantes, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir, ella se encuentra en un nivel medio, donde a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de prendas variadas es que está saliendo adelante y está ayudando a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de jeans, remeras, pantalones, camisas, pantalones y demás, con lo cual quiere ofrecer una mejor variedad para poder cumplir con sus clientes. Todas las integrantes están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Luchadoras" is in their twelfth cycle with this program committee of women who all work and help each other to get ahead. They are working on a survey of poverty elimination where all of the members find themselves improving their poverty situation to help their families. 

Carmen is one of the members who demonstrated a poverty level within the second class in her last survey. This means that she is in a middle class where through effort, a steady job, and the sale of various items, she can continue moving forward and helping her family. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of jeans, t-shirts, pants, blouses and more. She wants to offer a wider variety to satisfy her customers. All of the members are very thankful for the opportunity they are receiving to go and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, pants, blouses, and other types of garments.

loans.name: Katy Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Katy Gloria se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de pollos,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Katy Gloria continues to work raising chickens. She raises them and fattens them up and then she sells them in different markets. She works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm, and she has been in this business for several years. Her dream is to have a clothing store. She is asking for this loan to buy chickens and chicken feed. She is glad for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 41 years old.  He is married, and his wife does the household work. He has three children who are still studying. 

Noel works on a chicken farm that sells eggs and chickens. He was engaged in the business for more than two years, earning well for the family. The farm is five minutes away from his home.

Noel is requesting this loan to start a business of buying and selling pigs and broiler chickens, and also to help his wife start a retail business. 

In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to start a business of buying and selling pigs and broiler chickens, and also to help his wife start a retail business.

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lynn is 43 years old and has a live-in partner with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lynn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lynn has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose Alonso

texts.es:
Jose tiene 69 años de edad, estudió hasta primer grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales solo dos viven en su casa  y se dedican a trabajar.

Durante toda su vida, Jose se ha dedicado a la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre ya que desde muy pequeño lo llevaba al campo a sembrar, actualmente él piensa en sembrar una hectárea de maíz cerca de su casa, y otra media hectárea a 5 metros de donde él vive.
 
Jose está solicitando este crédito, para sembrar una hectárea y media de maíz para ello necesita pagar el arado de la tierra y todas las labores que se necesitan para la siembra de este cultivo.

Él planea seguir trabajando en el campo, pues le gusta mucho su trabajo, y además le sirve para llevar el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 69 years old and he went to school for first grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the domestic work at home. They have three children, only two of which live in their home and they both work.

Throughout his whole life, Jose has made his living in agriculture. He learned this occupation from his father. Ever since he was very small, his father took him to the fields to plant crops. Right now he is thinking of planting one hectare of corn near his house and another five meters where he lives.

Jose is requesting this loan to plant one and a half hectares of corn. To do this he needs to pay for the plowing of the land and all of the labor that he needs to complete the planting of this crop.

He plans to continue working in the fields as he likes his work a lot. It also helps him to support his family.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing of land and all of the labor he needs to cultivate one and a half hectares of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to care for and maintain her existing coffee plants as well as to plant a new nursery bed.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Belinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Belinda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes, such as shorts, blouses, socks, t-shirts, etc., to sell in her buy-and-sell business.

Belinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes, such as shorts, blouses, socks, t-shirts, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Selso Gusman Group

texts.es:
Gabino, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión  libre con su esposa con quien tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva 18 años cultivando maíz, el cual vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado el tercer ciclo de préstamo que es por 8,000 lempiras en forma grupal,  con el cual va comprar fertilizantes y va pagar por la preparación del terreno para la siembra de maíz.  Su objetivo es incrementar el área de producción.
El grupo se llama Selso Gusman, que esta integrado por 3 miembros que se dedican al cultivo de maíz, viven en la misma zona, cada uno solicita 8,000 lempiras para preparar el terreno y fertilizar para la siembra de maíz. El préstamo grupal es por 24,000 Lempiras. En la foto se identifican asi: a la izquierda esta Omar,Gabino y Jorge a la derecha.
texts.en: Gabino, 36, lives in a common-law marriage with his wife, with whom he has 3 children. He lives in the city of Negrito, Yoro. He has always worked in agriculture. He has been growing corn for 18 years, and he sells it in the local market. He has applied for his third loan, 8,000 lempiras as part of a group loan, which he will use to buy fertilizer and pay for the land to be prepared for planting corn. His goal is to increase the area of production. The group is called Selso Gusman, and it is made up of three members who all grow corn. They live in the same area, and each one is asking for 8,000 lempiras to prepare the land and fertilize for planting corn. The group loan is for 24,000 lempiras. These are the men in the photo: on the left is Omar, Gabino, and Jorge on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and prepare the land for planting corn.

loans.name: Shraf

texts.en: Shraf is a 30-year-old married man and has children.  They live together in Haja, Yemen. He has a mill ("tahoun") and has been involved in this business for four years. He is a hardworking man, and he strives to improve his living standards. In addition, this is the main source of his income. On the other hand, through lots of effort, he has managed to grind his customers' grains and offer good services for them. He took out a youth loan of 500,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase grains for his business, and sells them at a cheaper price for his customers. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. He thanks Kiva lenders for funding the first loan.

loans.use: to purchase grains for his business.

loans.name: José Noe

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y tiene tres hijos que son trillizos los cuales tienen 10 años de edad.

Él se ha dedicado a la agricultura durante toda su vida, aprendió este trabajo por su padre que desde muy chico le enseñó a sembrar maíz y frijol, actualmente José ha sembrado 1 hectárea de yuca de humedad, el lugar donde siembra está  aproximadamente a 30 minutos de su casa y se va en bicicleta.

José está solicitando este préstamo a CrediCampo, para abrir un negocio, el cual consiste en comprar 2 chivas para reproducirlas y sacarle el máximo provecho a las semovientes.

Él tiene como objetivo que el negocio que desea montar funcione, para comprar más animales en un futuro y con las ganancias brindarles el estudio a sus hijos y también mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old. He was able to study up to 6th grade. He has a partner and  three children who are 10 year old triplets. 

He has worked as a farmer for his entire life. He learned this trade from his father who showed him how to plant corn and beans when he was very young. 

Currently José has planted 1 hectar of yucca. The place he uses to farm is approximately 30 minutes from his house and he gets there by bicycle. 

José is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to open a business. He will buy two goats and use them for breeding and get the most out of the livestock. 

His objectives are to make the new business work so he can buy more animals in the future and use the profits to give his children and education as well as improve his house.

loans.use: to buy two goats.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
En algun barrio  vive Gloria, una mujer, una madre, una hija, una esposa, alguien que día a día trabaja  para y por el bienestar de la familia y el bienestar propio, cuenta con la bendición de no ser madre soltera ya que la acompaña el esposo, con el cual trabaja de la mano por el futuro de los dos hijos un princesa de 13 años y un caballero de 4 años, no tiene mucho pero tiene lo suficiente para estar unidos ya que tiene salud, un alimento siempre en la mesa y lo mas importante amor de familia.
Pero la vida de Gloria no siempre fue tan estable, ya que al igual que muchas mujeres fue madre muy joven, sin querer y sin planearlo, pero gracias a Dios contó con el apoyo de los padres y familiares cercanos, cometió errores en el afán de querer vivir, pero estos errores la formaron en la persona que es hoy y en la persona que nunca dejo de soñar, sabia que siempre que se lo propusiera lo iba a lograr, no solo por el bienestar de ella, también por el bienestar de la familia y de las persona que siempre han creído en ella.
Por eso tomo la decisión de estudiar, sin pensarlo dos veces, aprender era lo que siempre había querido y por fin dio ese paso, sabe que no va a hacer fácil, pero tampoco sera imposible, ya que una vez mas tiene el apoyo de las personas que la quieren y creen en ella y sabe que con Campo alto todo estará mas al alcance.
Espera terminar el camino que empezó, ya que así tenga tropiezos y hallan caídas la fortalecerá y la ayudara a crecer mas, el convenio con kiva seria de gran ayuda para que ella pueda terminar la carrera y mas ahora que los gastos se incrementan un poco en el pago de las mensualidades, con el convenio los valores del semestre seria un poco mas económicos y seria mas fácil hacer el pago.
texts.en:
Somewhere in Bogotá lives Gloria, a woman, a mother, a daughter, a wife, and a person who works day after day for the well-being of her family and herself.  She is blessed not to be a single mother as she has a husband who works hand in hand with her for the future of their two children, a little princess aged 13 and a little gentleman aged 4.  She doesn't have a lot but she has enough to be together since she is healthy, she can always put food on the table, and most importantly she has her family's love.  

But Gloria's life hasn't always been so stable.  Like many women she became a mother at a very young age, unintentionally, but thankfully her parents and other close family members supported her.  She made mistakes in her eagerness to live her life, but these mistakes shaped her into the person she is now, a person who never gave up dreaming.  She knew that whatever she set herself to do she would achieve, not only for her own well-being, but also for the well-being of her family and for the people who have always believed in her.  

This is why she decided to go back to school without a second thought.  Learning was what she had always wanted and she finally took that step.  She knows it won't be easy, but it won't be impossible either, since once again she has the support of the people who love her and believe in her, and she knows that with CampoAlto everything will be more within reach.  She hopes to finish what she started, since setbacks and mistakes will make her stronger and help her to grow more.  The arrangement with Kiva would be a big help for her in finishing her program, especially now that monthly payments are increasing a little.  With the loan, the semester would be a little more affordable and it would be easier to make payments.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre casado de 26 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos ambos menores de edad, actualmente viven en el Departamento de Suchitepequez.
Manuel se dedica a  dos actividades las cuales son: la compraventa de zapatos, que lo realiza en el mercado local de su comunidad y la otra actividad que realiza como guardián de seguridad en un centro de salud. La primera actividad la eligió porque su padre se dedicaba a lo mismo y gracias a esas enseñanzas ahora el obtiene ingresos y ganancias  que le ayudan a contribuir a la economía de su familia.
Por lo que ahora ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para comprar un terreno, ya que desea construir su vivienda. El préstamo lo pagara con los dos trabajos que actualmente cuenta.
El tiene varias aspiraciones una de ellas es tener un local en donde pueda exhibir su negocio, con el propósito de ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así poder incrementar sus ganancias para darles una vida de calidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 26-year-old married man. He lives with his two children who are both minors. The currently live in the Suchitepequez department.

Manuel makes his living with two occupations. One is buying and selling shoes, which he does in his community's local market. The other is working as a security guard in a health center. He chose the first occupation because his father made his living doing the same. Thanks to his teachings, he now makes an income and profits that allow him to contribute to his family's finances.

Now he has decided to request a loan of 4,000 quetzales to buy land as he wants to build a house. He will pay the loan back with the two jobs he has now.

He has many aspirations one of which is to have a storefront where he can display his business. The purpose will be to offer his customers better service and in that way increase his profits to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba was born in year 1976. She is married and has four children. Her children are non-adults. Her husband is a farmer. His income is not enough to provide four children with all the necessary things. Mahbuba decided to organize her own sewing business. 

Mahbuba took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women organization, and got a good knowledge. She is going to service to her clients in her house. She is asking for a loan of 850 Somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine for organizing new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to organize a new business.

loans.name: Oyguna

texts.en: Oyguna is 45 years old. She lives with her three children in a village. Her husband died some years ago. Oyguna has her own business. She has been busy with selling milk products in a local market. She began her business 20 years ago because she needed to earn money. Oyguna, little by little, developed her business. She gives a good education to her children from the profit of her business. Oyguna is going to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni to buy milk and kefir. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy milk and kefir to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel vive en la ciudad del Cusco y su actividad económica es la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, ella tiene galpón en su domicilio donde tiene varios ejemplares de cuyes.  Ya son varios  años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento apara cuyes.

Raquel se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Raquel lives in the city of Cusco and she raises and sells small animals like guinea pigs. She has a pen in her home where she has several guinea pigs. She has been in this business for many years and it is going well for her. On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy guinea pig feed. Raquel is grateful for this opportunity through these means and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pig feed.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina vive en la ciudad de Oropesa que esta ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, ella se dedica a la elaboración de panes "Chuta" y le va muy bien, ella pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Marcelina es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que saca adelante a su familia pues se sigue dedicándose  a la panadería y elabora panes “Chuta” que son panes tradicionales de la ciudad de Oropesa y Cusco. 

En esta oportunidad Marcelina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina.
texts.en: Marcelina lives in the city of Oropesa which is 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.  She makes chuta bread and it is going very well.  She belongs to the Ricchariy Puririsun communal bank with Asociación Arariwa.  Marcelina is an enterprising and hardworking woman who helps her family get ahead by continuing to run her bakery and make chuta bread, which is traditional in Oropesa and Cusco.  This time, Marcelina needs the loan opportunity to buy ingredients such as bags of flour.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as bags of flour

loans.name: Jesus Salva Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras exitosas una de ellas es Adilia mujer de 63 años de edad,  viuda, con dos hijos que no están a cargo de ella,  tiene 3 años consecutivos de tener  su negocio y  es la venta de repostería ambulante,  anteriormente vendía solo pan simple ambulante, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos como  churros, donas, picos, pan simple en barra, pan simple en bollo, galletas, pudines con baño de queque, etc. Betty tiene 24 años de edad y su negocio elabora puros de tabaco y Arlen tiene 34 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de pollo y carne de cerdo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of 3 enterprising and successful members.  One of these is Adilia, a 63 year-old woman.  She is a widow with 2 grown children.  She's had her business for 3 consecutive years; she sells bakery goods in an itinerant manner.  Previously, she used to only sell bread. Adilia will invest this loan in the purchase of products such as churros, donuts, breadsticks, baguettes, rolls, pudding cakes, etc.  

The other members of this group are Betty, 24, who has a business making cigars, and Arlen, 34, who has a business selling chicken and pork meat.

loans.use: to buy bakery goods for her business

loans.name: Guljar

texts.ru: Гулжар 56 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гулжар - высшее образование, окончила институт, по специальности инженер-технолог. Трудовую деятельность начала в районном общепите, затем вышла замуж, но продолжила работать. По характеру Гулжар очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Гулжар занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулжар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS), также обрабатывает 2,40 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и многолетние травы. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжар обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулжар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники.
texts.en: Guljar is 56 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Guljar has a higher education. She graduated from an institute with a degree in industrial engineering. Her professional career began in a district food franchise, then she got married but continued to work.  By nature, Guljar is very responsible, communicative and cheerful. Together with her husband, Guljar practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 15 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Guljar's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow, 1 calf, and 15 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).  She also works a 2.40 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans and perennial grasses. The collected harvest is sold to wholesale suppliers.  For the purpose of further developing her agriculture business, Guljar turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy bulls to increase the size of her herd. Guljar plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy household appliances.

loans.use: to buy bulls.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía tiene 47 años de edad, solamente pudo estudiar hasta primer grado en la escuela, lamentablemente su esposo murió hace 3 años de insuficiencia renal, tiene 5 hijos pero solo 2 hijas de 16 y 14 años de edad viven con ella, las cuales se encuentran estudiando.

Sofía tiene venta de tortillas a la orilla de la calle principal de su comunidad, tiene que caminar 2 cuadras para llegar al lugar, antes trabajaba como empleada en un negocio similar, sus hijas se involucran y le ayudan antes de irse a estudiar.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para comprar materia prima para su negocio de venta de tortillas, comprará maíz y leña, ya que en estos momentos el maíz está a buen precio y quiere aprovechar de comprarlo más barato y así guardarlo y tenerlo listo para cuando lo necesite, esto le permitirá a Sofía continuar con su trabajo y que no le falten los ingresos para su familia.

Ella se ha propuesto fortalecer su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias y sacar adelante a su familia, que sus hijas estudien y logren ser profesionales para que se ganen la vida de una forma más favorable al obtener un título universitario.
texts.en:
Sofia is 47 years old and was only able to study until the first grade. Unfortunately, her husband died three years ago from renal failure. She has five children, but only two daughters, ages 16 and 14, live with her and go to school. Sofia has a tortilla stand on the main street in her community. She has to walk two blocks to arrive to her spot. She previously worked as an employee for a similar business. Her daughters are involved and help her before going to study. 

She is requesting a loan from CrediCampo to buy supplies for her tortilla sales business. She will buy corn and firewood. At the moment, corn is available at a good price and she wants to take advantage of buying it for a lower price. Then she can save it and have it ready when she needs it. This will allow Sofia to continue her work and not lose income for her family.

She has decided to strengthen her business in order to make more revenue and move her family forward. This way her daughters can study, become professionals and make a more favorable living by getting a university degree.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her tortilla sales business.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach, 42, is married with three children, residing in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she has been selling grocery items, raising pigs, and catching fish. To supplement the income, she also works for others for a fee.
 
Mach is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is now requesting for a loan. Mach is going to use her loan to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Benard's Group

texts.en:
Benard is a member of Bidii Group in Matete District. He is pictured here in a group of three One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 36 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Benard has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented by this group are each receiving inputs for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum for cultivation. 

Benard is 65 years old and has been a farmer for three years. Benard works as a farmer to provide for his nine children. The community and other farmers know Benard as friendly and hardworking. Besides farming, he is also involved in his community groups such as the men's group, prayer group and burial committee. Benard described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group. 

The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Benard’s first season with One Acre Fund. He first joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. As an active member in his community, Benard also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member. Benard plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future and buy a cow. His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from harvest, was able to save money and feed the family. Benard also joined One Acre Fund because he wanted to eliminate hunger in his home. 

Benard and the Bidii Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: Dilafruz was born in year 1994. She is not married. Dilafruz is going to organize her own sewing business. She learned to sew national women’s dresses form a sewer who lives near her house. Now, she wants to service to local people as a sewer. She took part in a course ‘To get Ahead’ from a women organization. She is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina vive en la ciudad de Oropesa al sur del Cusco, ella continúa con el negocio de la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien. 

Alejandrina sigue participando en el banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Alejandrina lives in the city of Oropesa, south of Cusco. She continues to work raising and selling small animals like hens and guinea pigs. She has been in this line of business for several years and it is going well for her. On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy hens. Alejandrina still participates in the Ricchariy Puririsun communal bank of Asociación Arariwa and she is thankful for the opportunity provided through these means. She promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy hens.

loans.name: Epifracia

texts.en:
Epifracia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more dry goods, such as curtains, pillow cases, shorts, slippers, etc. to resell in her buy-and-sell dry goods business.

Epifracia has been in this business for 25 years. Epifracia earns more income from food vending.

Epifracia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods, such as curtains, pillow cases, shorts, slippers, etc. to resell.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, su familia era bastante numerosa y de muy escasos recursos, pero con mucho esfuerzo lograron que su hijo pudiese cursar hasta un quinto grado donde aprendió a leer y a escribir; luego se acompaño y de esta unión procrearon 3 hijos están pequeños y están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad, su compañera se dedica al comercio de venta de pescado con esto le ayuda a los gastos familiares.

Por su parte, José se dedica a desempeñar el trabajo de albañil esto lo realiza casi siempre, lo aprendió hace varios años un amigo le dijo que le ayudara como ayudante y luego le pareció interesante y siguió aprendiendo, hoy es el encargado de las obras, también se dedica en las épocas que no tiene trabajo como albañil como ayudante en un taller de estructuras metálicas, estos trabajos los hace todos los días ya que son las fuentes de ingreso que le ayudan a mantener a su familia, su esposa le ayuda en el comercio en venta de pescado y venta de ropa y le ayuda a una persona en los oficios domésticos.


Los fondos serán destinados, para arreglar su vivienda comprar laminas, ya que se acercan la época de lluvia y quiere que su familia tenga una mejor seguridad en la vivienda.

Quiere que sus hijos puedan estudiar, para que tengan una mejor oportunidad para su futuro, también con los fondos mejoraran su vivienda y darle mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old.  His family was pretty big and had limited means, but through a lot of effort they were able to give their son a fifth grade education, where he learned to read and write.  Later on he found a partner and had three small children from this relationship who are studying at the local school.  His partner sells fish for a living, which helps with the family's expenses. 

For his part, José works as a bricklayer almost all the time.  He learned this work several years ago when a friend hired him as his helper and it interested him and he kept learning and now he is in charge of the jobs.  When he does not have bricklaying work he also works as a helper at a metal shop.  He does these jobs every day, as they are the sources of income that help him support his family.  His wife helps him by selling fish and clothing and by helping someone with housework.  

This loan will be used to repair his home by buying sheet metal, as the rainy season is approaching and he wants his family to be safer at home.  

He wants his children to be able to go to school so they can have better opportunities for their futures.  This loan will improve their home and provide his family with greater safety.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal to repair his home

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco  es un hombre casado de 48 años de edad, vive junto a sus cuatro hijos y su pareja  en el Departamento de Suchitepequez.
Francisco comenta que se dedica a la compraventa de maíz en el mercado local de su comunidad. Decidió obtar por esta labor, porque anteriormente se dedicaba a la siembra de maíz, es como de esta manera fue surgiendo el interés por esta actividad, que es bastante productiva en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias. Como también comenta que tiene un terreno en donde cosecha banano y maxan, lo realiza con el fin de aprovechar los recursos que tiene. 
Ahora lleva diez y ocho años trabajando en esta actividad, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de ampliar su negocio, solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para la compra de maíz y así podrá incrementar más sus ganancias para aportar a la economía de su familia.
Cuenta que uno de sus sueños es construir un local en donde pueda colocar su producto y comprar un molino de nixtamal, para ofrecerles un mejor servicio  a sus clientes, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Francisco, 48, is married and lives with his four children and spouse in the department of Suchitepequez. He says that he works buying and selling corn in the community's local market. He chose this work because previously he worked planting corn. This is how he became interested in this work, which is quite productive in terms of generating income and profits. He says he also has land where he harvests bananas and maxán plants. He does this to take advantage of the resources that he has. Now he has been in this line of work for 18 years, which is why he has decided to expand his business. He is asking for a loan of Q 6,000 to buy corn and that way, to be able to increase his profits to support his family. He says that one of his dreams is to build a place where he can store his products and to buy a corn mill, to provide better service to his customers, in order to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn to expand his business

loans.name: Ma. Rosella

texts.en:
Ma. Rosella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of bananas business in the Philippines.

Ma. Rosella requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Ma. Rosella has been in this business for 10 years now.

Ma. Rosella would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 39 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marichu is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Marichu has been raising pigs for 10 years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 35 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo es agente de seguridad en un negocio de la ciudad, tiene 3 hijos que viven con ella y asisten a la escuela y son los únicos que dependen de ella.

Rosa es una persona muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a la venta de panes y golosinas en su comunidad, ya tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este rubro, ella decidió trabajar en esta actividad cuando su familia comenzó a crecer y los gastos eran mayores, los ingresos de su esposo no eran suficientes y por lo tanto ella ha tenido que trabajar para ayudar con el hogar.

Ella está solicitando este préstamo, pues lo necesita para comprar una yunta de terneros que piensa cuidar ya que tiene el pasto del cultivo anterior y quiere aprovecharlo, esto le permitirá a Rosa tener ingresos cuando los venda dentro de un tiempo.

Rosa sueña con que todos sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria, que en su casa siempre tengan lo necesario para vivir, y también desea mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old and studied until the sixth grade. She is married and her husband is a security agent at a business in the city. She has three children who live with her and attend school. They are the only ones who depend on her. 

Rosa is a hardworking person. She works selling bread and candies in her community. She has been doing this work for many years. She decided to work in this business when her family began to grow and their expenses were higher. Her husband's income was not sufficient and therefore, she had to work to help with their home. 

She is applying for this loan because she needs it to buy a pair of calves to care for. She wants to take advantage of the grass from a previous crop. This will allow Rosa to make a profit when she sells the calves after some time. Rosa hopes that all of her children will get a university degree and that her house always has what it needs to live. She also wants to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy a pair of calves.

loans.name: Maiay

texts.ru: Майе 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Майи - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Майя занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Майи, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 2 бычка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майя обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота.
