Доходы от кредита Майя планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Maiay is 32 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Maiay has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Maiay practices livestock breeding. She started this business 8 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Maiay's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow, 1 horse and 2 bull calves on her farm. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her agriculture business, Maiay turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy bull calves to increase the size of her herd. Maiay plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy bull calves.

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine is from Qarinj village of Lori region. She lives there with her husband and four children (in the photo).

Qristine and her husband have been running a farm for five years. They keep a livestock and cultivate wheat and potato. Their farm is not a very big one, but their plans and desires to make it rich and profitable are very strong. 

Due to their hard work over these five years, they are able to provide minimum living conditions for their children. Now, Qristine asks for this loan of USD 2,000 to be able to enlarge their farm. The loan will be used for purchasing five calves and forage for feeding the livestock. 

This will greatly help them increase the income from agriculture, and the family will be very grateful to lenders for such support.

loans.use: to pay for five calves and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Гульмиры - среднее образование, начала свою трудовую деятельность, проработав в аптеке, в данное время занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульмиры, на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка, 10 овец, 1,11 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, фасоль и многолетние травы для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку минеральных удобрений, так как нужно подготовить землю, также будет оплачивать услуги трактора на вспашку, боронование, культивацию и посев. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на оплату за обучение детей.
texts.en: Gulmira is 44 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Gulmira has a secondary education. She started her professional career working in a pharmacy, but she currently practices crop farming and livestock breeding. She started this business 14 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulmira's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 2 bull calves, and 10 sheep on her farm, as well as a 1.11 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows potatoes, beans and perennial grasses for personal consumption and sale. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulmira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers as she needs to prepare the land, as well as pay for tractor services for tilling, harrowing, cultivating and sowing. Gulmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Esam

texts.en: Esam is a 28-year-old married man who has children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He lives in a rented house with his family who have faced bad challenges in their life. He is applying for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase a sewing machine. He aspires to have a sewing store to gain profits so he has the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole and own a house.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for personal use

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe JIGUIYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles traditionnelle à  HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs quatorzièmes prêts avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  MAIMOUNA  fait le commerce d’habits (friperie) dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est  la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 2 balles de friperie à Sikasso. Elle vend au détail à la maison et au marché à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32 500 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group JIGUIYA are married women, who average 32 years of age and three children each. The women lives for the most part in traditional families in HAMDALLAYE, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their 14th loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers.

Ms. MAIMOUNA does commerce in clothing (used) in this group of women. She is first at the right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 bales of secondhand clothing in Sikasso. She makes her sales retail to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit at the house or at the market. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 32,500 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to pay back the loan with interest, and the other part goes toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha  vive en la ciudad de Oropesa que esta ubicado a 30 minutos al sur del Cusco y se dedica a la panadería y elabora panes “Chuta” que son panes tradicionales de la ciudad de Oropesa y Cusco. En esta oportunidad Bertha requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina.  

Bertha continua en el banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, ella tiene 46  años de edad y tiene tres  hijos.
texts.en: Bertha lives in the city of Oropesa, which is located 30 minutes south of Cusco. She bakes and makes Chuta bread, which is a traditional bread from Oropesa and Cusco. On this occasion, Bertha needs the loan to buy supplies, like sacks of flour. Bertha is still part of Asociación Arariwa's Ricchariy Puririsun communal bank. She lives in the city of Oropesa, in Cusco province. She is 46 years old and has three children.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sacks of flour.

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado de educación básica, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a lavar y planchar ajeno, tiene una hija de un año y medio, por lo tanto su hija y su pareja son las únicas que dependen de él.

José se dedica al trabajo de albañilería, aprendió esta actividad desde muy pequeño y ha ido perfeccionando la técnica con el paso de los años, él realiza los trabajos a clientes de su misma comunidad, quienes confían en su conocimiento en la construcción.  

El crédito que está solicitando, lo necesita pagar una deuda que tiene con un usurero, el cual le está presionando por el cobro excesivo de interés y necesita solventar esta situación para cubrir con los demás gastos familiares.

A futuro sus intenciones son instalar una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación, para mejorar sus ingresos y su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old. He was able to study up to 6th grade. He lives with his partner who earns money by washing and ironing clothes. 

He has a one and a half year old daughter. His partner and daughter depend on him. 

José works as a mason. He learned this trade when he was very young and has perfected the technique over the years. 

All his  clients are from his community who trust his construction knowledge. 

He is requesting a loan to pay off a debt he has with a money lender. 

He is being charged an excessive amount of interest and needs to resolve this situation so he can pay for other family costs. 

In the future he wants to set up a small store in his house to improve his income and his living standards.

loans.use: to pay off a debt he has with a money lender.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 45 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom are currently in school.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in in this business for 27 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nasygul

texts.ru: Насыгул 47 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа одна воспитывает 4 детей. У Насыгул - среднее образование, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Насыгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS), также обрабатывает 2,0 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и многолетние травы. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Насыгул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Насыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадебные мероприятия своих детей.
texts.en: Nasygul is 47 years old, a widow, and after the death of her husband, is raising four children alone. Nasygul has a secondary education and practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 14 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 6,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nasygul's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow and 15 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). She also works a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she mainly grows beans and perennial grasses. The collected harvest is sold to wholesale suppliers. For the purpose of further developing her business, Nasygul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Nasygul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's wedding receptions.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Al Faraj Group

texts.en:
Zeina is a the featured borrower of Al Faraj group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, since they have always been neighbors and friends.

Zeina is a 26-year-old married mother of two children who has been working selling clothes from her house for nine months. She established her current business at her house, to support her beloved husband in their living and covering their childrens' increasing living needs. Zeina is well known in her region for her good reputation and the special quality of products she sells, in addition, for the competitive and encouraging prices she sets.

Today, Zeina is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with newly released spring and summer collections. Zeina is very anxious about this loan, and she hopes that through her future acquired loans, she will be capable of opening her own separate clothes shop.

Zeina is pictured on the right wearing pink clothes. As for the other group members, Maryam is at the center wearing light blue, and Nadia is the first on the left.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with newly released spring and summer collections.

loans.name: Soroyiriwaso Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe SOROYIRIWASO sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, et ont en moyenne 05 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOKOUNA un des villages de la commune de Loulouni faisant partie de la région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs neuvièmes prêts avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme ALIMATA fait le commerce de pomme de terre et riz dans ce groupe de femme. Elle est assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 1 sac de 50kg de riz et 100kg de pomme de terre, sa vente se fait  en détail sur place, à Loulouni et à Kokouna à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.  
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17 500 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The six members of the group SOROYIRIWASO are married women, who average 43 years of age and five children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in KOKOUNA, a village in Commune de Loulouni, part of Région de Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their ninth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers.  

Ms. ALIMATA does commerce in potatoes and rice in this group of women. She is sitting first at the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase a 50-kg sack of rice and 100 kg of potatoes. Her sales are made retail to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit, locally. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to pay back the loan with interest, and the other part goes toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and rice

loans.name: Agua De Vida Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito, una de ellas es Sonia mujer de 51 años de edad, acompañada, tiene dos años de ser cliente de la institución, y 10 años de tener su negocio que es la venta de calzado, vende ropa nueva, su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de dama, pantalón de varón, blumers de dama, perfumen, cremas faciales, blusas de damas etc. Reyna es otra socia de 49 años de edad su negocio es la venta de refresco y frutas, Amanda tiene 25 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ensalada de frutas.
texts.en: This group is made up of three successful entrepreneurs. One of them is Sonia, 51. She is married and has been a client of the institution for two years. She has had her business for 10 years. She sells footwear, and new clothes. Her loan will be used to buy clothing like men's pants, women's pants, women's underwear, women's blouses, and perfume and face creams, etc. Reyna, another member, is 49. Her business is selling soft drinks and fruits. Amanda, 25, sells fruit salad.

loans.use: to buy clothing like men's pants, women's pants, women's underwear, women's blouses, and perfume and face creams, etc.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en:
Nigina is a 22-year-old single woman. Nigina is a smart woman, and is also a successful businesswoman. She began her own business growing tomatoes and potatoes three years ago. Nigina has her own land where she works from early morning till late evening. She earns additional income from animal husbandry. She feeds a milking cow and sells milk to local people. 

She wants to improve living conditions. She would like to buy furniture for her household but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 3,500 Somoni to buy furniture for her household. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her household.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 30-year-old mother from Kakamega County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is widow and she supports four people in her family, with two children of her own who are aged 6 and 2 years old.

She has a retail shop which she has been operating for the last four years and makes a monthly income of Kes 9,000. She is taking her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and soap for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to increase her stock.

Her dream is to educate her children and increase stock.

loans.use: to add more stock in her retail shop.

loans.name: Nhoern's Group

texts.en:
Nhoern, 43, is married with four children.  She resides in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. For the last 23 years, she has been planting rubber trees and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Nhoern’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and she is with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Nhoern is going to use her portion to buy seeds for her rubber plantation. She hopes this loan will enable her to timely plant her rubber trees to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her rubber plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Don enrique, es un señor que ha laborado como guarda de seguridad y en la actualidad se desempeña como conserje en una escuela, junto a su esposa  procreo 8 hijos, ya todos mayores de edad e independientes, don Enrique con el apoyo de créditos ha venido mejorando su humilde casita, hoy en día desea el crédito para asegurar la entrada principal de su casa y cuarto comprando dos puertas nuevas de madera.
texts.en: Enrique works as a security guard but at this time he is working as a caretaker in a school. Together with his wife they have 8 children all of them now adults and independent. Enrique with the help of loans has managed to improve his modest home. Now he wants a loan to secure the front entrance to his house and bedroom, buying two new doors made out of wood.

loans.use: to buy two doors.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe DANAYA sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  DIASSADIE  un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI faisant partie de la région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  SALIMATA  fait la vente de graine de karité dans ce groupe de femme. Elle est debout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 2 sacs de 50 kg de noix de karité, elle s’approvisionne à Diassadie ainsi que dans les villages environnants.
La revente se fait au comptant à LOULOUNI. La plupart de sa clientèle est  composée essentiellement d’hommes.
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 11 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The six members of the group DANAYA are married women, who average 47 years of age and five children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in DIASSADIE, a village in Commune de LOULOUNI, as part of Région de Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their 8th loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers.  

Ms. SALIMATA does commerce in shea seeds in this group of women. She is standing first at the right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase two 50-kg sacks of shea seeds. She gets her supplies from Diassadie, as well as from surrounding villages. Sales are made retail to a customer base composed of essentially of men paying with cash or credit in LOULOUNI. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 11,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to pay back the loan with interest, and the other part goes toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase shea seeds

loans.name: La Ceibita Group

texts.es: María es una mujer emprendoras miembro del  grupo lo cual está formada por tres socias, ella tiene 23 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos quienes le ayudan en el manejo del negocio, de ser cliente de la institución tiene 2 años y cinco años de tener su negocio que es la de tener una pulpería en su domicilio, este crédito lo solicita para compra de mercadería como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevo, aceite en bidón, sopas maggi, jabón de lavar ropa, jabón de baño, medicamentos populares, especies, algodón, galletas, pan, jabón de trastos, etc. Trinidad tiene 48 años de edad su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas de temporada y Aura tiene 41 años de edad y su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising woman who is a member of a group made up of three people. She is 33 years old, married and has two children who help her with managing the business. She has been a member of the institution for 2 years and has had her business for 5 years. The business is a small shop which is in her house.

The loan Maris needs is to buy merchandise like rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil in barrels, eggs, Maggi soups, laundry detergent, hand soap, popular medicines, spices, cotton, biscuits, bread, sliced ham, etc. Trinidad is 48 years old and her business is buying and selling seasonal crops. Aura is 41 and she also buys and sells crops.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, Maggi soups, laundry detergent, hand soap, popular medicines, spices, cotton, biscuits, bread, sliced ham, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 49 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Joseph and they are blessed with three children aged 23, 14 and 10 years old.

She is a farmer, a business she has been running for the last six years. She has applied for her first loan of KES. 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya which will be use to buy maize and bean planting seeds.

Susan's monthly income right now is KES. 10,000 and her plan is to use the anticipated profits from her business to educate her children and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, she hopes to be a very successful farmer in her area.

loans.use: to buy maize and bean planting seeds.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a plumber and has been in this business for seven years now. He is 31 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with three children. He supports four members of his family, and his spouse also provides additional income. 

He will be using this loan to buy plumbing equipment for use in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of his family. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and in future he hopes to expand his business and have a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy plumbing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 49 years old and is married with seven dependent children. She lives in a rural village in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, earning a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. She is able to earn about US$15 per day to support her family, but she can save about 40,000 KHR after daily expenses. 

Ny has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back her past loans. Now, she is applying for a loan to pay for plowing the field. She hopes to make more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to pay for plowing the field.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 29 years old and married. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a grocery store for a year and a half. His educational background is secondary. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

To earn extra income, he sells grocery items. To increase his profit income, he took out a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy grocery items for his business. He thinks that with this loan, he has been able to improve his living standards, and he hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for his business.

loans.name: Sindrala Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sindrala. It consists of three members who are ladies. They live in Aden, Yemen. 

Mina is 48 years old and is married with four children. She works in food production. This business gives her substantial income, which allows her to provide for her family and meet her own needs. In order to increase her working capital, she has requested a loan from AMB to buy sugar, flour, canned food, etc. for her business. In the future, she hopes to improve the quality of her food production.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, canned food, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf  membres du groupe  BENKELEMA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOKOUNA un des villages de la commune de Loulouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme AFOU fait le commerce du beurre de karité dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  3 sacs de 50 kg de noix de karité  qui seront transformées de façon traditionnelle en beurre pour la revente en détail sur place,  à Loulouni, à Kokouna et à Sikasso à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17 500 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The nine members of the group BENKELEMA are married women, who average 44 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in KOKOUNA, a village in Commune de LOULOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their ninth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers.  

Ms. AFOU does commerce in shea butter in this group of women. She is sitting second at the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase three 50-kg bags of shea nuts, which will be processed in a traditional manner into shea butter for local retail sale to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit, locally, as well as in Loulouni, Kokouna, and Sikasso. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 17,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to pay back the loan with interest, and the other part goes toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase shea nuts

loans.name: Allakabo Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf  membres du groupe ALLAKABO sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  DIASSADIE  un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI, (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leurs douzièmes prêts avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme DJENEBA fait la restauration dans ce groupe de femme. Elle est debout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 1 sac de 50 kg de riz et 1 carton de 20 paquets de spaghettis et divers condiments pour la restauration.
 Elle fait sa restauration au marché de DIASSADIE dont elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle. Elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The nine members of the group ALLAKABO are married women, who average 48 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in DIASSADIE, a village in Commune de LOULOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their 12th loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers.  

Ms. DJENEBA is in the restaurant business in this group of women. She is standing second at the right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase a 50-kg sack of rice, a box of pasta (20 packets per box), and a variety of condiments for her business. She caters at the DIASSADIE market, where she is much in demand by her customers, who are composed of men and women paying with cash or credit. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 12,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to pay back the loan with interest, and the other part goes toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her restaurant business

loans.name: El Mosaico Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras Neris es una de las miembros del grupo mujer de 40 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos hijos que están bajo su cargo, tiene dos años de dedicarse a vender ropa nueva de los cuales sus dos hijos le ayudan a comercializar el producto, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón de mujer, camisas de varón, camisas de damas, blusas, shores, etc. María es una cliente de 41 años de edad y su negocio es tener una pulpería en su domicilio, Rosibel tiene 49 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de frutas, verduras y los  fines de semana hace y vende fritanga en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is composed of four hardworking members, one of whom is Neris.  She is 40, single, and the mother of two kids she supports.  She has been selling new clothing for two years with the help of her two kids.  She will use the loan to buy clothing such as men's and women's pants, men's and women's shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.  Another member, María, is 41, and she runs a convenience store in her home.  Rosibel is 49 and her business is selling fruits and vegetables, and on the weekends making and selling prepared food at her house.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Sadokat

texts.en:
Sadokat is young and hardworking woman. She is married and has a son who is two years old. 

Sadokat has been busy with growing agricultural products and animal husbandry. Her income is small and not provide enough to improve her living conditions. She is going to start a new business sewing women’s clothes. She can sew wonderful women’s dresses and now she is going to get income from her ability. She is asking for a loan of 850 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start her new business sewing clothes.

loans.name: Charline

texts.en:
Charline is 35-years-old and married with three children.

She earns a living with a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Charline has been in the pig fattening business for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a 53-year-old married woman with ten children, four of whom are still in school.  

Catalina is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for four years. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Catalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlinda has been pig fattening for 15 years, and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her home.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: José Efraín

texts.es:
José  es un hombre casado de 27  años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos y su pareja  en el Departamento de Suchitepequez.
José comenta que se dedica a la venta de tacos y lo realiza en el mercado local de su comunidad. Eligio esta actividad porque anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa donde se distribuía alimentos, es por ello que tomo la iniciativa de emprender este negocio que lleva ya un año de tenerlo. Como también comenta que en sus tiempos libres es albañil, pero la forma de trabajar de él es por contrato ya que se gana un poco más y vale la pena el esfuerzo. Estas dos fuentes de trabajo le han ayudado a contribuir a la economía de su familia.
Ahora se ha dado cuenta que la venta de estos alimentos tiene una fuerte demanda, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de productos  y utensilios de cocina que servirán para la preparación de los tacos.
Comenta que uno de sus sueños generar más ganancias para poder tener otro puesto de tacos en otro lugar y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y asegurar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
José  is a 27 year old married man who lives with his wife and two children in Suchitepequez Department. José mentions that he sells tacos in the local market of his community. He choose his activity because he had previously worked in a food distribution company. And he took the decision to undertake this business which he has had for one year now. He also comments that in his spare time he is a bricklayer, but he works by contract so he makes a little more and makes it worthwhile. These two sources of income help him to contribute to the household economy. 

He now knows that the sale of these products are in great demand, so he is requesting a loan of 3,000 GTQ to buy product and cooking utensils which will help him prepare the tacos. He comments that he dreams of generating more income so that he can open another taco stand in another location. Thus improving the living standard of his family and secure his children's education.

loans.use: to buy supplies and cooking utensils to prepare his tacos.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district of Cambodia, Sophy is 47 years old, and is a married mother of four children, two of whom are still in school. 

To make a living, Sophy has been making fermented fish-paste and sometimes she works for others for a fee, earning around $12 per day, but she can save about $5 each day after daily expenses.
 
This will be Sophy's first loan cycle with VisionFund. Sophy is going to use her loan to buy more fish in order to make fermented fish paste. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make fermented fish paste.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district, Kampong Cham province, Mary is 44 years and married with three children. To make a living, she has been growing cassava and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 20 years, she is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family needs.
 
Mary is just with VisionFund this cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Seanghai

texts.en:
A humble farmer living in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Seanghai is a 23-year-old married mother of one son. She earns a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about $7 per day to meet the family’s need. 

Seanghai has just joined VisionFund for this cycle, and is now requesting a loan of $500. Seanghai wants to use her loan to buy a decent motorbike for her family to commute. She hopes this loan will enable her to reduce motor-taxi expenses.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her family to commute.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Ndèye Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Ndèye Fanta est une femme qui vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Elle habite aux  environs du guichet et évolue dans la commercialisation des légumes et de l’huile de palme. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières a part ses propres besoin et parfois aider son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes. Elle sollicite ce crédit d’un montant de 100.000F pour acheter et vendre des légumes et divers produits alimentaires. Ndèye a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 14h de l’après midi. A l’avenir, elle souhaite élargir son lieu de travail et satisfaire sa clientèle et en plus avoir une autonomie financière.
texts.en: Ms. Ndèye Fanta is a woman who lives with her husband and children near the branch office. She works at selling vegetables and palm oil. She has no particular expenses aside from her own needs, although she sometimes helps out her husband in managing day-to-day expenses. She is requesting this loan in the amount of 100,000 francs to buy and sell vegetables and also a variety of grocery items. Ndèye has over ten years of experience in this business. Her days starts at 9 AM and ends at 2 PM. For the future, she would like to expand her workspace, satisfy her customers, and have more financial autonomy.

loans.use: to buy and sell vegetables and palm oil

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 35-year-old farmer who lives in Nkubu with her husband and three children, all of school going age.  She has a two acre land where she has been farming for 11 years growing cabbages, potatoes and french beans.  She also rears cows and poultry.  She sells the output of her farm to the local market.  Her biggest challenge is insufficient water, crop pests and diseases.

Rose chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer their loans at low interest rates.  During the training, she learned how to develop a savings culture.  This loan will enable Rose to buy a water tank and pipes and thus, be able to produce more and this will improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and pipes.

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Narin, a 52-year-old mother, lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district of Cambodia.  She has been growing tobacco for 32 years. The current business earns her about 39,000 KHR per day. 

Narin is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy pesticides and pump water into her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her crop yields to improve her living for the better.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and pump water into her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Ukweli Group

texts.fr: Madame Chiregano est présidente de l’association d’affaire  Ukweli. A 49 ans, elle est mariée à un commerçant et ensemble ils ont 7 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usages  depuis 1992. Le nouveau prêt servira à acheter 20 paires de souliers usagés. Son vouloir est  d’accroitre ses activites.Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de soutenir les femmes et de son initiative à la culture de l’épargne.
texts.en: Ms. Chiregano is the president of the business association Ukweli. She is 49 years old and married to a merchant. Together they have seven children, all provided with education. She has been a vendor of used shoes since 1992. The new loan will be used to purchase 20 pairs of used shoes. Her wish is to grow her business. So she thanks Hekima for supporting women and for its initiative on savings practices.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pairs of used shoes

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito tiene 57 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad y están acompañados.

Benito trabaja en una oficina de la comunidad como secretario, además se dedica al trabajo en la agricultura y tiene una presa en el cual cría pescado. 

Él necesita muchísimo del crédito que está solicitando, para comprar pescado y echarlo a la presa, para venderlo cuando estén grandes, también para comprar abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz.


Benito planea que su negocio crezca para tener más ingresos para su familia, además desea dejar un capital para  que su familia tenga un lugar propio para trabajar.
texts.en:
Benito is 57 years old, studied until ninth grade, is married, and his wife takes care of the domestic tasks.  They have two children of legal age and both of them have life partners. 

Benito works as a secretary in a community office. He also works as a farmer and has a weir where he raises fish.

He is in real need of this loan since he has to buy the fish, raise it, and sell it when it reaches a proper size. He also needs to buy manure and fertilizer for the corn crops. 

Benito wants his business to grow so he can have more incomes for his family. He also wishes to leave them the enough capital so they can have their own place to work.

loans.use: to buy fish for his weir.

loans.name: Dieu Est Avec Nous Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST AVEC NOUS est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Linette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 37 ans. C’est la deuxième fois que Linette sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé. Linette est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de Alain. Le couple a deux enfants, scolarisés et à leur charge. Linette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Linette vend des œufs, de l’arachide et de l’huile végétale dans sa région depuis dix ans. Linette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Linette et les membres du groupe DIEU EST AVEC NOUS sollicitent pour la deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
DIEU EST AVEC NOUS is a group composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Linette (with her hand raised in the photo), is 37 years old. This is the second time she has requested financial support from ALIDé. Linette is married to a cook named Alain. The couple have two children, who are in school and in their care. 

Linette lives together with her husband and children, and they jointly ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. To do so, she has been selling eggs, peanuts, and vegetables oil in her region for ten years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customer demands, Linette, along with the other members of the group DIEU EST AVEC NOUS, is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the second time. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, peanuts, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Adhm

texts.en:
Adhm, a 22-year-old hardworking man, lives in Haja, Yemen.  He has been operating a sewing store for many years which sews men's fabrics. He has striven with great courage in order to provide for his family, laboring very hard so that he can become a professional.

Adhm would like to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 YER to buy an additional sewing machine and sewing materials for his business. He hopes to improve his social and economic level. He thanks Kiva lenders for funding him the first loan.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine and sewing materials for his business.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Sochea is 39-years-old and married with five children. Farming rice and selling grocery items are the main sources of her family’s income, which she has been doing for almost 20 years. To complement the income, her husband works as a paid worker. She could earn about 100,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 40,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
Sochea is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a computer for her children. She hopes this loan will enable her children to have enough school materials.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her children

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her in a previous loan, as she was able to buy the needed products for her business. Her income from her business assisted in her everyday expenses at home. 

Merlinda is a hardworking mother whose desire is to help not just her family, but others as well. She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more grocery items and other needed products to sell. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Merlinda dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Cinamula Group

texts.fr: La cliente Yalala est  membre du groupe d’affaire Cinamula. Commerçante expérimentée depuis 1994, elle est mariée à un homme sans travail et mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés. Avec le nouveau crédit, elle  va acheter 1 ballot de friperie. Elle souhaite avoir un dépôt de stockage et acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima et prie Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en: This client, Yalala, is a member of the business group Cinamula. An experienced merchant since 1994, she is married to an unemployed man and is the mother five children, all provided with schooling. With this new loan, she is going to purchase a bale of secondhand clothing. She would like to have a warehouse and to purchase a parcel of land for her children. So she thanks Hekima and prays that God blesses it.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Karla Yadira

texts.es: Karla, tiene 36 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, vive en el Municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. Ella lleva 6 años de tener su propio negocio de venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser azúcar, manteca, condimentos, verduras, productos enlatados, carnes, refrescos, pastillas y otros abarrotes. Ha mantenido el negocio activo mediante la inversión de varios prestamos. Actualmente esta solicitando el séptimo ciclo y es por 10,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar mas productos para surtir como ser granos básicos, carnes, refrescos, verduras, churros, productos enlatados, y otros abarrotes, para aumentar las ventas y los ingresos. Su meta es seguir con el negocio para apoyar a su hijo con el estudio.
texts.en: Karla, 36, is a single mother with one child.  She lives in the municipality of Quimistan, in the department of Santa Barbara.  Karla has had her own business for 6 years.  She sells consumer staples such as sugar, butter, condiments, vegetables, canned goods, meat, beverages, over-the-counter medicines, and other groceries.  She has kept the business active through the investments she has made from various loans.  At this time, she is in her 7th loan cycle.  This loan, for 10,000 Honduran lempiras, will be used to buy more products to stock her store, such as staple grains, meats, beverages, vegetables, chips, canned goods, and other groceries.  This will allow her to increase her sales and income.  Karla's goal is to continue with her business so that she can pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy grocery products for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure, among other things, to help her coffee crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Elsy Marina

texts.es:
Elsy es una joven de 26 años de edad, casada, con un grado de estudio primaria completa la cual culmino gracias al apoyo financiero y moral por parte de sus padres a quien ella agradece el apoyo por todos estos años. De su matrimonio tiene un hijo el cual es menor de edad y estudia en la escuela de la comunidad teniendo como apoyo en los diferentes trabajos de campo y otros ingresos a su esposo quien trabaja en la zona industrial del sector maquila para poder generar mayores ingresos a su hogar. Tiene 3 años de tener sus cultivos de café generando la mayor parte de ingresos para el bienestar de su familia de este rubro ya que las fuentes de empleo en la zona no son las mejores opciones y mientras su esposo no se encuentra son sus padres quienes le apoyan en la limpieza, aplicación de abono, entre otros esperando el fin de semana para la llegada de su esposo.
Sus planes para el futuro, es poder reforzar su casa de habitación ya que actualmente está hecha de adobe y desea hacerla de bloque. Para con su negocio de café seguir ampliándolo y poder comprar el próximo año dos manzanas de tierra las cuales sueña con cultivar para así mejorar los ingresos y el patrimonio para su familia. Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento el cual podrá utilizar para el pago de mano de obra para la siembra de una manzana de tierra y otra parte para poder comprar más plantilla de café ya que de esa manera ella podrá ir cumpliendo sus metas y sueños poco a poco mediante las ganancias recibidas.
texts.en:
Elsy is 26 years old and is married. She completed primary education thanks to her parents' financial and moral support. She appreciates the support they have given her for all these years. 

From her marriage she has one young son. He studies at the community school with the financial support from her agricultural work and her husband's income. Her husband works in the industrial manufacturing zone in order to generate more income for his family. 

For the past 3 years her coffee crops have been generating most of the income for the family because the options for employment in this region are not very good. While her husband is away, her parents help her with the cleaning, application of manure, and other tasks, while she waits for her husband to return home on the weekends.

Her plan for the future is to renovate her house because it is currently made of adobe. She wants to build it out of block. She also wants her coffee business to continue to expand, and to buy two plots of land for agricultural use next year, to be able to increase her income and build up her family's assets. 

She is currently requesting a loan to use to pay labourers to plant a plot of land and also to buy more coffee plants. This way she will be able to reach her goals and slowly acheive her dreams using the profits she makes.

loans.use: to pay labourers and to buy new coffee plants to plant.

loans.name: José Simeón

texts.es:
José tiene 53 años de edad, solo estudió primer grado en la escuela, está casado y tiene 4 hijos que ya formaron sus propios hogares.

José proviene de una familia muy humilde de la zona rural, tuvo que comenzar a trabajar desde muy pequeño en labores agrícolas junto con su padre y demás familia, hoy en día, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa que atiende su esposa mientras él trabaja como jornal en su comunidad.

Este préstamo que está solicitando, lo necesita para surtir y ampliar el inventario de la tienda, ya que ha crecido la demanda de sus clientes y esto le puede generar mayores ingresos, José es una persona muy admirada por los demás, debido a que no pudo terminar la escuela pero a pesar de ello es una persona muy hábil e inteligente para los negocios.

José se ha propuesto para un futuro, que su negocio crezca y sea estable, además planea comprar un vehículo para transportarse a la ciudad a comprar los productos para la tienda sin tener que pagar transporte particular.
texts.en:
Jose is 53 years old, only attended to the first year of school, is married and has 4 children, all of them living on their own.

Jose comes from a humble family of the rural area. He had to start working in farming at a young age along with his family. Now he has a small store near his house that is managed by his wife, while he works as a farmer in their community. 

The loan he is requesting will be used to supply his business and increase its inventory. His customers’ requirements have been increasing and such actions would generate more income for him.  Jose is a person admired by others because, even though he has no studies, he is a smart and skilful man when it comes to making business.

Jose’s purpose for the future is to have a growing and stable business. He also plans to buy a vehicle to go to the city and buy products for his store, without having to pay for private transportation.

loans.use: to supply his business and increase its inventory.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda was born in 1983. She is married and has a little child. She lives with her husband, child, and mother-in-law.  Mavjuda wants to organize an animal husbandry business to improve her living conditions with the profits. She took part in a women's organization course, titled ‘to get ahead’, and received a certificate. She got a lot of new and useful information from this course. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing this new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Amani is a group of six farmers in Matete district, with Grace selected as the Kiva representative. Grace has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative, and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 61 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings. 

Grace is 55 years old and has been a farmer for 15 years. Grace works as a farmer to provide for her six children. The community and other farmers know Grace as friendly, hardworking, and trustworthy. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community, such as the women's group and prayer group. Grace described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Grace is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Grace joined One Acre Fund in order to get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed her family. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member and wants to help more farmers. Grace plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school and invest in a business. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Grace’s own life was improved because she has more farm training and was able to feed the family. 

Grace and the Amani Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Thet's Group

texts.en:
Thet, 39, lives with her husband in a rural area located in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband earn a living through growing cucumber, eggplant, and chili pepper. Sometimes she works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 36,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
This is the first loan for Thet’s group with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and use another portion of it to pay for labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from the current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee crop

loans.name: Delphine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est un composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Delphine(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo),âgée de 34 ans a très peu fréquenté l’école. C’est la première fois que Delphine sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé. Delphine est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Léandre. Le couple a trois enfants, scolarisés et à leur charge. Delphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Delphine et son mari  assurent ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Delphine vend divers produits(des biscuits, du savon, du miel et de l'igname séché de façon ambulante depuis douze ans. Delphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Delphine ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent pour la première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Delphine (with her hand raised in the photo), is 34 years old and did not have much schooling. This is the first time she has requested financial support from ALIDé. She is married to a retailer named Léandre. The couple have three children, in school and in their care. She lives together with her husband and children. 

Delphine and her husband jointly ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. To do so, she has been hawking products (cookies, soap, honey, and dried yams) for twelve years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customer demands, Delphine, along with the other members of her group, is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products (cookies, soap, honey, etc.)

loans.name: Al-Ebtsam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ebtsam and consists of three ladies. Kothar is a housewife who is 32 years old. She lives in Aden, Yemen. She makes a living selling clothing and perfumes. She decided to establish her business because she saw it as profitable.

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Yemen Rials (YER) from AMB to buy ladies clothing. She states that this loan will be of help because she will be able to buy varied merchandise to invest in her clothing business. This will increase her sales, generating greater earnings at the same time. She has future plans of making improvements to her house to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ladies clothing for her business.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a 23-year-old lady who operates a farm in Nakuru. She has been in the business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of about KES 8,500.

She was introduced to Vision Fund Kenya by our credit officer and has been loaned 10,000 KES, which serves as her first loan from the organization. Peris will use the loan to purchase additional farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds for her business. She intends to use the profits from the business to continue educating her two nieces and to expand her farming activities.

In the future, Peris wishes to further expand her farming activities and practice mixed farming. This will increase her earnings and help improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Shohsanam

texts.en:
Shohsanam is 18 years old. She is a hardworking and smart woman. Shohsanam is not married and lives with her parents in the northern part of Tajikistan. Shohsanam has always wanted to organize her own business and will do so with animal husbandry.

She took part in a women's organization course, called 'To get Ahead’, and received a certificate. She will feed cattle in her house and sell it in the local market. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing this new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old and married with six children. With four children currently in school, Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to resell in her general store.

Maria has been in this business for four years, and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. 

Maria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks such as canned goods, snack foods,  soft-drinks, etc. to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosita is 31 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Rosita has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to resell.

Rosita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched-roof house in a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Rat is 51 years old and married. She and her husband have seven children. They earn a living by farming rice and have been in this business for almost 30 years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day to support her family.

This is the first loan for Rat’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Rat is going to use her portion to plow the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to plow the field.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
El joven Mauricio, es de una familia humilde, la madre con tan solo 16 años aun sin saber enfrentar la vida le toco asumir la responsabilidad de padre y madre tratando de buscar un trabajo para poder salir adelante con el hijo, luego se trasladaron a otra localidad  donde medianamente le a podido pagar los estudios, el joven termina con éxito los estudios hasta bachillerato de hay en adelante los estudios se vieron un poco troncados debido a la falta de dinero, la institución campo alto le dio esa oportunidad de poder estudiar con algunos acuerdos de pago, estos acuerdos de pago se hicieron cada semestre ya que el sueldo que devenga la madre del joven Mauricio  no es suficiente para pagar la suma de dinero que pedían en esta institución, faltan 2 semestres para la finalisacion de este técnico lo cual le permitirá a el joven Mauricio   encontrar un empleo con mas ingresos para el y la mama. 
Para poder a si continuar en un futuro con una carrera, la ayuda que presta kiva es fundamental ya que con el valor mas bajo en el pago de las cuotas el se pueden financiar los transportes ,uniformes u otros requisitos de las sedes de practicas, este subsidio le seria de gran ayuda.
texts.en: Mauricio comes from a humble family, his mother at only 16 years old and before knowing how to face life, assumed the responsibility to be mother and father.   She tried to find a job to get ahead with her son, they moved to another city where she has been able to pay for his studies.  He finished high school successfully, but after that his studies were truncated because of lack of money. The Campo Alto Institution gave him the opportunity to study with financial arrangements for every semester, Mauricio's mom's salary is not sufficient to pay for the money requested by the institution.  Two semesters are left to finish which will allow Mauricio to find a job and earn income for him and his mother.  Kiva's help is fundamental because with a lower payment schedule he can finance transportation, clothing and other requirements for practices and this subsidy would be really helpful.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a small scale farmer living in Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. She is married and has 2 children of school going age. She has farmed for the past 13 years where her main source of income comes from the sale of milk, eggs, tea and potatoes. She loves farming because it gives her a good return. Her biggest challenge is poor markets.
Janet chose Juhudi Kilimo  for this loan because they offer low interest rates on their loans. During the training sessions offered, she learnt how to develop a savings culture. This loan will enable her to plant bananas which will bring in more income that will help her in the paying for her children's school fees,and also improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to invest in banana plantation.

loans.name: Wekesa's Group

texts.en:
Wekesa is a member of the Best Home Group in Matete District. He is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of fifty-three individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Wekesa has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

 Wekesa is married and has ten children. He is 60-years-old and is known as friendly, hardworking and trustworthy. He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee. Wekesa has been a farmer for twenty years. He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. Wekesa first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Wekesa joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member and he wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Wekesa plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, repair the home and save for the future. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Wekesa’s own life was improved because he has more profits from the harvest, able to save money and feed the family.

 Wekesa and the Best Home Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem is 34 years old and married with a young child. She lives with her family in Tuol Damnak village, an area of Baray, Kampong Thom province. She operates a farming business and makes rattan products to sell for profit. She usually sells her products to local traders who visit the village and collect rattan products several times a month. From her current businesses she is able to earn daily income of USD 10.80. 

This time Sem needs financial support in order to improve water and sanitation for her entire household. She realizes that all these play an important role for healthy living conditions. The loan will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sem is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank.

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Rahel is a 32-year-old, hardworking, married woman with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in livestock as her main source of income, though she earns an extra income from agriculture. She started this business to earn a living and to take good care of her family. She has a challenge of seasonality, where she sometimes does not get customers (especially during the lent period). She hopes for educating her children and for owning a big farm with nice looking bulls.

She is requesting a loan to buy more bulls to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bulls for selling.

loans.name: Silvia Paola

texts.es: Silvia, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 1 hijo, vive en el municipio de Santa Bárbara junto a su conyugue, hijo y su madre. Ella estuvo trabajando como maestra escolar y hace 6 meses inicio con la venta de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, churros, condimentos, papel higiénico, verduras, etc. este negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para surtir mas su negocio de productos como granos básicos, golosinas, condimentos, verduras, y otros, con el propósito de cumplir la demanda al cliente y que su negocio crezca. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y cuidar bien a su hijo.
texts.en: Silvia is 25.  She lives with her common law husband, their son, and her mother in the city of Santa Barbara.  Silvia was working as a school teacher and six months ago she began selling groceries such as staple grains and pulses, chips, condiments, toilet paper, vegetables, etc.  She runs the business out of her house.  Silvia has requested a loan of 10,000 HNL to stock her store with products like staple grains and pulses, snacks, condiments, vegetables, etc. so she can meet customer demand and grow her business.  Her goal is to grow the business and take good care of her son.

loans.use: to buy staple grains and pulses, snacks, condiments, vegetables, and other products to stock her store

loans.name: Umoja Musoma Musoma Group

texts.en:
EZEKIEL, who is in his early 20s is single.  He has been running a poultry business for one and half years now.  He works from 07 am to 06 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be EZEKIEL's 1st loan.  He will use this loan to buy chicks and chicken feed.  He dreams of owning a retail shop. 

Ezekiel will share this loan with his loan group "UMOJA MUSOMA" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Saadi

texts.en: Saadi is a twenty eight year old married male with one child living in Bundibugyo Uganda. A farmer dealing in cocoa, timber growing and coffee. He has been in business for ten years and has improved the well being of his family. He hopes to buy more trees to produce more timber to improve his business. Only poor transport and bad debtors affect his output. Saadi intends to use the loan to buy more tress to produce much timber for better profits and income.

loans.use: To buy coffee and timber

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi is aged 39, married to a tricycle operator and blessed with four children. She manages a retail business in which she sells home products for the last five years. In this business she earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. Her net income is usually spent on their daily expenditures and sometimes she saves her profits for emergency use. Due to insufficient fund she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase home products such as mosquito nets, blankets, pillows, and umbrellas to sell. She's is hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase home products such as mosquito nets, blankets, pillows, and umbrellas to sell.

loans.name: Saray

texts.en:
Saray is 35 years old and a resident living in a small village of Kralanh, Siem Reap province. She is married to Lout, a 35-year-old farmer and a loving father of two school-going children. Saray operates a rice farming business and earns additional income from rice trading. From her current businesses she is able to earn well for her family.

Saray wants to improve water and sanitation for her entire household, but she has insufficient capital to make it possible. That’s why she is asking for a loan amounting to USD1,500 to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Saray is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael has a retail business in Emali town where he sells retail items as well as grocery food such as potatoes. He is 51 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 4 children. He has been in this business for 12 years and it has been profitable.

He will be using this loan to buy more stock of goods for resale. These include sugar, rice and cooking oil. He will use the anticipated profits to do home repairs and provide health care for his children.

This is his 7th loan term and he has repaid his previous loans successfully. In future Raphael hopes to be successful in his business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a thirty one year old female married with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells cassava flour, cabbage, rice and palm oil to the local population in the area. She began the business to increase on her income and pay school fees for her children. She's challenged with price fluctuation and bad weather. She needs a loan to buy  cassava flour, cabbage, rice and palm oil for resale.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour, cabbage, rice and palm oil for resale

loans.name: Ela Marina

texts.es: Doña Ela, tiene 46 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 1 hijo, reside en Quimistán, santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado al negocio, hace  mas de tres años que vende golosinas como churros, galletas, confites, jugos, helados etc. esta actividad la realiza en su casa. El préstamo que solicita es por 11,000 lempiras y los va invertir en surtir el negocio de productos como churros, dulces, galletas, helados, jugos y refrescos, con esta inversión va incrementar las ventas y mantener surtido siempre el negocio. Su plan es poder ayudar a su familia con los ingresos del negocio.
texts.en: Ela is 46, lives with her husband, they have one son. They live in Quimistan, Santa Barbara. For more than three years she's had a business selling snacks like chips, cookies, candy, juices, ice cream, etc. she works on this activity from home.  The loan requested is for 11,000 HNL and she will invest it to stock the business with products like chips, candy, cookies, ice cream, juices and sodas.  With this investment her sales will increase and she will be able to always supply the business.  Her plan is to be able to help her family with the business income.

loans.use: to stock the business with products like chips, candy, cookies, ice cream, juices and sodas.

loans.name: Ma Altagracia

texts.es: Ma Altagracia, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Santa Bárbara junto a su nuera y dos nietos. Lleva 10 años de tener una pulpería, vende arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, café, pastillas, plásticos, condimentos, champu, cereales, churros, pan etc. Ha obtenido siete ciclos de prestamos con el actual, este es por 16,000 lempiras para surtir de mas productos como azúcar, manteca, huevos, arroz, frijoles, pan, condimentos, carnes, maíz, cal, churros etc. para poder seguir trabajando con el negocio y obtener ingresos para subsistencia de su familia.
texts.en:
María Altagracia, 57, is a single mother with three children.  She lives in the town of Santa Bárbara with her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.
