For 10 years she has had a grocery store where she sells rice, beans, shortening, eggs, coffee, pills, plastic products, condiments, shampoo, cereal, chips, bread, etc.

María Altagracia is in her seventh loan cycle.  This one, for 16,000 lempiras [HNL], is to continue with her business and earn income to support her family.

loans.use: to stock up on products

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 51-year-old hard working mother of six children. She has specialized in wedding and special events decoration for the last fifteen years. In 2009, she established her own business to develop her career and improve her family's living.
Aida is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for necessary medications which she needs.
She hopes to stay in good health to keep on providing for her beloved children with the necessary living needs and education.
She loves her business a lot because she loves to spread beauty and happiness everywhere she visits. She will make sure that one day she will establish a special events organizing company that will handle everything might be needed from A to Z.

loans.use: To pay for necessary medications she needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more eggs for resale

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 65 year-old married man and a father to three children. He has been operating a carpentry shop in Nakuru for the last thirty years and he has been earning a monthly income of about KSHs. 8,000. 

Patrick was introduced to Visionfund kenya by our credit officer and has now been loaned KSHs. 20,000 which serves as his first loan from the organization which will be used to purchase additional working materials like tools for his business. He intends to use the profits from the business to continue educating his children and looking after his family. 

In the future Patrick wishes to further expand his carpentry shop so as to accommodate more employees and also be able to increase his earnings so that he may improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials needed for his carpentry business

loans.name: Clara Isabel

texts.es:
Clara es una mujer soltera de 24 años de edad, actualmente vive junto a sus dos hijas  en el Departamento de Suchitepequez. 
Ella es una mujer que lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Comenta que actualmente cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada a unos metros de su vivienda. Eligió esta actividad porque es rentable y productiva y además de ello sus padres fueron los que la motivaron para emprender este negocio, que le ha ayudado  a contribuir al sustento familiar.
Ahora cuenta con dos años de tener su negocio que le ha generado buenos ingresos y ganancias. Por lo que ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para la  compra de productos de consumo diario para poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así incrementar sus ganancias.
Su sueño es incrementar más sus ganancias para remodelar su vivienda y de esta manera podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Clara is a single 24-year-old woman, she currently lives with her two daughters in the department of Suchitepequez.  She fights for her family's well-being.  She currently has a convenience store, that is located meters from her residence.  She chose this activity because it's profitable and productive and also her parents motivated her to start it, it's helped her contribute to support her family. She's had the business for two years and has generated good income and profit.  She has decided to request a loan of 10,000 GTQ to buy groceries, products for daily consumption, with this she will offer better service to her clients and increase her profits.  Her dream is to have more profits, renovate her home and be able to improve life conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemmima sells second hand clothes and has been in the business for three years now. She is 24 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children.

She will be using the loan to buy more clothes for resale. She will also use the loan to start a poultry keeping business by buying chickens for rearing. She anticipates to supply chicken and eggs to various customers in the area and thereby make more income. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to open another kind of business as well as save for her future.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hope is to see her businesses grow and her family have a bright future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale and also start poultry keeping.

loans.name: Saleem Group

texts.en: This group is called Saleem and is comprised of four women. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. This community is hardworking and they work as much as they can in order to improve their living conditions. They took out a loan of 160,000 YER. Fatima is the leader of the group. She is 41 years old. She lives with her children in Sana'a, Yemen. She is a hardworking woman who dreams of providing her children with a better future. She went through a lot of effort and had to save money with the help of her family to set up her small house. Now she has applied for a loan to buy construction supplies to complete her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete her house.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is 50 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Boniface and they are blessed with eight children aged 31, 28, 25, 23, 20, 5, 3 and 1 year.

He is a farmer, a business he has been running for the last five years. She has applied for his first loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which will be used to buy some maize and bean seeds for planting.

Her monthly income right now is KES. 15,000 and her intention is to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya and to buy a plot of land and construct some rental houses for more income.

In the futur, she hopes to be financially stable

loans.use: To buy maize and bean seeds for planting

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 53 year old, married, and a father to two children. He operates a farm in Nakuru and has been in the business for the last ten years whereby he has been earning a monthly income of about KSHs. 15,000. 

Isaac was introduced to Visionfund kenya by our credit officer and has now been loaned KSHs. 20,000 which serves as his first loan from the organization. Isaac will use the loan to purchase additional farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds and so on for his business. He intends to use the profits from the business to continue educating his children and looking after his family. 

In the future, Isaac wishes to further expand his farming activities and practice mixed farming so as to be able to increase his earnings in order to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional farm inputs for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction equipments for use.

loans.name: Langet

texts.en:
Langet sells jewelery such as a bracelets, armbands and necklaces made of beads. She also sell traditional shawls (Leso) and has been in this business for 2 years. She is 41 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 6 children. 

She will be using this loan to buy more beads for making more jewelry for resale. She will also buy the traditional Lesos fore resale and thereby boost her business. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more beads.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to have a successful business.

loans.use: To buy beads for making jewelery.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be stable. He operates a farm where he keeps livestock and also grows crops. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in an area fit for the business. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water storage facility and buy farm inputs. The water storage facility will enable his family store clean water for domestic use. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Angela Marina

texts.es:
Angela es una mujer casada de 30 años de edad, actualmente vive junto a sus tres hijos  en el Departamento de Suchitepequez. 
Ella es una mujer que lucha junto a su esposo por el bienestar de su familia. Comenta que actualmente cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada a unos metros de su vivienda. Eligió esta actividad porque es rentable y productiva y además de ello sus padres fueron los que la motivaron para emprender este negocio, que le ha ayudado  a contribuir al sustento familiar.
Ahora cuenta con dos años de tener su negocio que le ha generado buenos ingresos y ganancias. Por lo que ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo de Q 10,000.00 para la  compra de una refrigeradora y productos de consumo diario, para poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así incrementar sus ganancias.
Su sueño es comprar un terreno en donde puede construir una tienda más grande y surtirla para mejorar sus servicios y extenderlo, para las demás personas circunvecinas. Esto lo pretende realizar con la finalidad de mejorar la economía de su familia.
texts.en:
Angela, 30, is a married woman who lives with her three children in the department of Suchitepequez.  Together she and her husband strive for their family's well-being.  She said she currently has a grocery store located a few meters from her home.  She chose this activity because it's profitable and productive.  Her parents inspired her to undertake the business, which has helped her support her family.

Angela has had her business for two years now and it has generated good income and profits for her.  She has decided to request a loan for 10,000 quetzales [GTQ] to buy a refrigerator and daily staples to give her customers better service and increase her profits.

Her dream is to buy a plot of land to build a bigger store to stock and expand, so she can improve her service to the other nearby neighbors.  Her objective in doing this is to improve her family's finances.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and staple products

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is a new borrower aged 36 years old, a resident of muyombo in Ntungamo municipality. He is married and he has applied for a loan of UGX.2000, 000 shs, to buy more manure for his coffee and banana plantation a business that he has survived on for 6 years, while educating his own children and his brothers. He has a challenge of little output from his plantation so he wants to use the money to buy more manure for his plantation and believes he can yield more if he can improve on the way he looks after the plantation. This will help him to get more income for his family and also provide employment for a few residents.

loans.use: To buy manure for his plantation

loans.name: Timiseho

texts.en: Timiseho is a 30-year-old farmer who is married with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a cocoa garden and has been practicing farming for 10 years. He does brick laying as another source of income. He hopes to have a big store of cocoa and export his cocoa for better prices and profits. He is a hardworking man, though challenged by the theft of his products.Timiseho needs a loan to buy cocoa beans to sell..

loans.use: To buy cocoa beans to sell

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa was born in 1954. She is a hardworking woman who is widowed and has three children. She has been busy selling shoes for more than 20 years. She sells her goods in a local market. Hanifa has her own selling place and she has her regular customers. She is such a sociable woman. She is going to increase her working capital and maximize her profit. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy shoes for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes for the new season

loans.name: Hulkarkhon

texts.en: Hulkarkhon was born in 1986. She is a smart and hardworking woman. Hulkarkhon has a higher education. She is a teacher. She teaches computing and its uses to pupils. She has works at this more than one year. Hulkarkhon is married and has 2 children. She is going to improve her living condition. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy furniture. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice sells ornaments made of beads and string in Kangundo town and has been in this business for 6 years now. She is 49 years old and widowed with 2 children. Right now her monthly income from her business is KES 45,000.

She will be using the loan to buy beads and string to make necklaces, bracelets and other kinds of ornaments to sell. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to provide the basic needs such as food and clothing for her family.

Having repaid her previous loans successfully, this will be her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her dreams and hopes in the future are to grow her ornament shop to a bigger one and be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To buy beads and string for making ornaments.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Don Alexander es originario de la ciudad de Estelí. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de fritangas. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que logro comprar los productos necesarios para la realización de la comida que ofrece a sus clientes. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: Pollo, Carne, Lechuga, Tomates entre otros productos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar las ventas y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Alexander is from the city of Estelí.  He's a merchant who makes a living selling fried snacks.  He's grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because he was able to buy the products he needed to make the dishes he sells to his customers.

Alexander's requesting a new loan to buy chicken, meat, lettuce, tomatoes, and other products.  He thinks the loan will be a big help to him because he'll be able to increase his sales and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, lettuce, tomatoes, and other products

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 35-year-old female with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells dry fish and tomatoes and some coffee beans to the local population in the area. She has been in the business for six years and wishes to boost her business to a big stall because of high demand for fish. She hopes to earn more profits to educate her children by diversifying her business. She is hindered by the bad weather and price fluctuations in the market. She intends to use the loan to buy fish, tomatoes and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish, tomatoes and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Katagyira

texts.en:
Katagyira is a fourty six year old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge- Uganda. He is a district planner and that is where he earns a living though he also practices farming to earn an extra income. He started this business to earn income for the betterment of his family. He faces a challenge of low pay, but has hopes of becoming self employed.

He is requesting for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a  Kiva borrower. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. His business is located in urban area and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. He will use the Kes 79,920 loan to buy iron sheets and other building materials to build a house. The iron sheets will enable him to harvest rain water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future he will be stable. This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of KES 300,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: iron sheets and other building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products to maintain her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 42-year-old single lady who, three years ago, started running her father's convenience store since he passed away. The store is her only source of income and she has to work hard to develop the store as much as she can to make sure that it will provide her with all the necessities of life.

Today, Huda is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with spring and summer special offer beverages. In addition to food and beverages, Huda also sells small quantities of accessories, cosmetics, stationary and gifts, which she intends to develop too, to increase her income.

Huda will work hard to expand and develop her business to respond to her customers' needs and attract new customers.

loans.use: To buy more special offer beverages to sell

loans.name: Trufosa

texts.en:
Trufosa is a 48 years old lady from Kakamega. She is married to James who is also a businessman in the same region with whom they have 4 children, who are all grownup. She sells charcoal, a business she has done for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of kes 35,000.

This the first loan she is taking with Vision fund Kenya, a loan of kes 20,000 to use in expanding her business. The anticipated profits will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal and repay her loan.

Her dream is to become a wholesaler and bring up a stable family

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal to resell to her clients, who mainly uses charcoal in this region as a source of fuel.

loans.name: Mkombozi Group Musoma

texts.en: Raphael, who is in his late 40s is married with seven children, who are still going to school.  He works from 08 am to 06 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, toothpaste, pepper, etc  for her business.

loans.name: Julife

texts.en: Julife owns and operates a retail store that sells grocery items in her village to make a living. For more than seven years, Julife has earned a good income and successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to buy goods. She also sells fish and shrimp in her community. Julife is determined to earn more income to support her large family. Recently, she took out a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. In the future, she would like to improve her business to ensure a better income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Djenbubu

texts.ru: Дженбубу 60 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Дженбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Дженбубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Дженбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 3 лошади, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дженбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Дженбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадебное мероприятие дочери.
texts.en: Djenbubu is 60 years old, married and raising 3 children together with her husband. Djenbubu has a secondary education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 14 years ago with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Djenbubu's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 3 horses and 20 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Djenbubu requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy cows in order to increase livestock headcount. Djenbubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her daughters wedding.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Makhabat

texts.ru: Махабат 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Махабат - среднее образование, она работает охранником, супруг работает оператором в школе, старший сын работает водителем маршрутного такси, остальные дети учатся в школе. Семья очень сплоченная и дружная. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Махабат занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Махабат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Махабат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Махабат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство дополнительного помещения для скота.
texts.en: Makhabat is 41 years old, married and raising 4 children together with her husband. Makhabat has a secondary education and works as a security guard.  Her husband works as an operator at a school, the oldest son works as a taxi driver, and the rest of the children attend a school. The family is very united and friendly.  To provide additional income for her family, Makhabat is involved in animal husbandry, having started 14 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Makhabat's hard work, today her business contains 3 dairy cows and 15 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Makhabat requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy sheep in order to increase livestock headcount. Makhabat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to build an additional space for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en:
Hannington is pictured in his banana plantation with the UGAFODE Credit officer (left to right)

Harrington is a married man who looks after a family of  six children. He is predominantly a farmer from where he derives food for his family and income for other basic needs through the sale of food crops. He has applied for a loan of UGX.2,000,000 to buy more fertilizers to boost his production so as to increase his earnings and look after his children well. He knows that if he utilizes the loan well, his output will be good and so will his income which will eventually push him out of poverty. He is thankful that KIva lenders through UGAFODE are dedicated to empower them for an improved well being.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Bridgid

texts.en:
Bridgid is 48 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with five children. She is a dairy farmer in Kangundo town. She supports five people in her family and her spouse does provide additional income. She has been in the business for four years and right now her monthly income from her business is KES 70,000.

She will be using the loan to buy cattle feed and a goat. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to expand her farming project.

This is Bridgid's third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she has repaid her previous loans successfully. Her hopes and dreams in the future is to run a big farming project.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and a goat.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is 36 years old. She lives with her husband in Gaza and they have six children. She works at home weaving wool. This business has helped to increase the family's income because her husband works in a public institution with a low salary. They are a big family and need to provide for their kids. 

Hana applied for a loan from Ryada to pave the ground and pay for plumbing work for the bathroom.This will help her to improve her house and make it better. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her.

loans.use: to pave the ground and pay for plumbing work in the bathroom

loans.name: Vilma Aracely

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 39 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado debido a que su familia era de escazos recursos económicos y la escuela estaba muy lejos de su casa, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja vende minutas en bicicleta, sus hijos viven con ella.

Ella se dedica a la venta de platos típicos desde hace 6 años, pues la necesidad de mantener a su familia la ha llevado a realizar esta actividad. Primero, ella comenzó a vender minutas, una amiga le comentó que la venta de minutas era buena y le enseñó como se hacia el jarabe y como debía vender, hoy en día es su esposo quien se encarga de la venta de minutas y ella le prepara los materiales que se utilizan, además Vilma vende tamales, tostadas, pasteles, pupusas y más, de modo que no hay nada que detenga a esta señora para trabajar y para sacar adelante a su familia.
su jornada de trabajo comienza a las 5:00 AM para preparar la venta de minutas, luego sale a vender tamales y platillos típicos en los caseríos cercanos, para lo cual debe caminar aproximadamente 4 horas para terminar su venta.

El préstamo que ella solicita, será utilizado una parte en el negocio y otra para construir un cuarto para sus hijos, comprará 700 ladrillos, 3 quintales de hierro, 20 bolsas de cemento, arena y piedra.  

Vilma sueña con poder comprar otro solar para dejarles a cada hijo un espacio y que construyan sus casas, también le gustaría mejorar su vivienda, comprar otra bicicleta para que venda su hijo y con la ganancia de sus negocios y conesfuerzo espera pagar este crédito
texts.en:
Vilma, 39, studied up to second grade because her family didn't have the financial resources and the school was very far from her house.  She's married and her companion sells snow cones on a bicycle.  Their children live with them.

Vilma has sold traditional dishes for six years because she needs to support her family.  First she began selling snow cones.  A friend told her that selling snow cones was good and taught her how to make the syrup and how she should make sales.  These days it's her husband who's responsible for sales while she prepares the food.  Vilma also sells tamales, tostadas, savory pies, pupusas, and other things.

Nothing stops this woman from working and getting her family ahead.  Her work day starts at 5 a.m., when she makes the snow cones.  Then she goes out to sell tamales and traditional dishes in the nearby communities.  She has to walk four hours by the time she finishes her sales.

She'll use part of the loan she's requesting on her business and the rest to build a room for her children.  She's going to buy 700 bricks, 3 quintals of rebar, 20 bags of cement, sand, and stone.

Vilma dreams of being able to buy another plot of land to give each child a place to build a house.  She also would like to improve her home, buy another bicycle so her son can make sales, and work hard to pay back this loan.

loans.use: to invest in her business and to build a bedroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business.

loans.name: Subhiniso

texts.ru: Шахритуз не большой район, где все друг друга знают. В этом районе живут трудолюбивые люди и одна из них Субхинисо. Ей 54 года. Субхинисо милая и отзывчивая домохозяйка. Она, как и большинство людей, родного района хочет заняться животноводством  - выращиванием овец. В Шахритузе почти у каждой семьи есть скот во дворе. Сумму от кредита она потратит на приобретения крупнорогатых скотов. Она собирается держать их в коровнике и на скотном дворе. В Шахритусе даже зимой тепло и солнечно. Субхинисо верит и надеется, что сможет начать бизнес и ее поддержат.
texts.en: Shahrituz is a small district in Tajikistan, where everyone knows everyone else.  Many hardworking people live in that district.  One of them is Subhiniso.  Subhiniso is 54 years old.  She is a kind and sympathetic homemaker.  Like most of the people from Shahrituz, she wants to be involved in animal husbandry, and raise sheep.  In Shahrituz, almost every family owns some livestock, which they keep at home.  Subhiniso will use her loan amount to buy some farm animals.  She plans to keep them in a barn as well as outside.  In Shahrituz, even winters are warm and sunny.  She believes that she will be able to start her own business.  She is hoping to get some support.

loans.use: to start her own animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is a 50-year-old married mother of three children, who has worked as a cook from her house for nearly thirty years. She is well known in her region with her good reputation and special cooking talents and services.

Latifa is the sole breadwinner for her three children and three grandchildren who live with her in the same house, which forces her to work harder to make sure that she can respond to her beloved family's increasing needs and develop her business.

Today, Latifa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to buy an electric oven that is necessary for developing her business and increasing her business production, so that she can meet her increasing customers' requests.

Latifa works continuously from 6am to 6pm. She hopes that in the future she can establish her own restaurant, and that her daughters will help her in managing and developing it, to increase her family's income and attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy an electric oven that is necessary for developing her business and increasing her production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to raise more chickens and refurbish her house.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a farmer living in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. She is married and has three children, all of whom are of school-going age. She has been farming for the past 12 years and she has an acre of land where she does dairy, poultry and tea farming. In farming, she loves dairy farming, which helps to pay for her children's school fees. Her biggest challenge is insufficient rain, which causes insufficient animal feed.

Joyce chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer a favorable interest rate on their loans. During the training, she learned more on how to develop a savings culture. This loan will enable her to get proper animal feed for her livestock so they will be healthy, produce more and provide more income. This will improve her family's living standards and help with her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Sinan's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province where her paddy rice is grown, Sinan is a married mother of four kids and is aged in her early 40s. Nowadays, she only needs to support two of her children who are still in school. Besides her agribusiness, she also works for others for a fee during her spare time.
This business has generated her about 33,000 KHR per day. 

Sinan is in her second loan cycle, while the other two borrowers are in their first and sixth cycles, respectively. Sinan managed to use her past loan wisely and she has managed to keep her kids in school and improve her lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, she is a group leader. Sinan will spend her loan portion to pay for farmland ploughing and levelling fees. She hopes that she can gain a higher income better than before.

loans.use: to pay for farmland ploughing and levelling fees.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 38-year-old man from Kakamega. He is married to Callence and they have three children who are 10, 7 and 4 years old, respectively. He is a carpenter, a business he has done for the past 14 years, earning an income of KES 10,000 monthly. 

He is taking his fifth loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya to use in purchasing more timber and new equipment. He plans to use the profits to improve the lives of his family members.

His dream is to own a mega workshop for carpentry work.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and more timber to make furniture

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma has been helping her husband operate their own farm for a living. For more than seven years, the couple has earned well and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying fertilizer. She was successful in expanding her farm and recently took a new loan to buy seeds and organic fertilizer for the next cropping season.  In the future, she wants to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer for the next cropping season.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. From his loan, he was able to assist his children's education as well. His income from his business assisted in his everyday expenses at home. There are some challenges that he is facing in his business, but he is always finding ways to overcome them. He is a hardworking father. 

Carlos would like to apply for another 11,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Carlos dreams to improve his business and hopes that his family will always be in good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a repeat borrower aged 28 years old, and is a resident of Kagarama town. She lost her husband three years ago and has kept on maintaining her home by educating children, feeding them and clothing them through the sale of drinks and beverages. This has kept her family going but with increased inflation, the little resources can hardly maintain the business, so she has applied for a loan of UGX1500,000, to improve her business by increasing her stock. She says this will help her buy in bulk and at a cheaper price which will increase her returns. 

She thanks UGAFODE for the dedication towards serving the rural population. In the photo is Mary with the UGAFODE Credit staff at her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell.

loans.name: Dinora Cecilia

texts.es:
Dinora tiene 36 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, una  hija ya se acompañó y 3 viven con ella de los cuales solo 2 están estudiando y nadie mas vive con ellos.

Dinora es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a vender pupusas y atol desde hace 3 años, la necesidad de salir adelante fue la que llevó a Dinora a buscar una forma de ganar dinero, antes ella se dedicaba al cuidado del hogar, pero lamentablemente su esposo murió y tuvo que buscar un trabajo para mantener a sus hijos por sí sola, una amiga suya la indujo a que hiciera pupusas y atol y es así como se dedica a ese negocio. Ella se levanta a las 4:00 AM a preparar el atol, a las 6: 00 AM sale con la venta casa por casa en los caseríos vecinos  y regresa a las 9: AM; por la tarde vende pupusas, comienza su venta a las 3:00 PM y termina a las 6:30 PM, así es su rutina diaria, pero dice que lo hace con gusto porque su sueño es que sus hijas estudien.

El préstamo que Dinora está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para cambiar el techo de su casa ya que la lámina que tiene no sirve y cuando llueve se moja, es por eso que necesita ayuda para garantizar la seguridad de su familia.

Sus expectativas a futuro son, que sus hijas se preparen en una carrera universitaria, mejorar su casa, construir otro cuarto, además ella sueña con poner un comedor y con las ganancias espera ahorrar para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Dinora, 36, studied to ninth grade.  She's the single mother of four children.  One daughter is already married and the other three live with her.  Only two of them are going to school.  Nobody else lives with them.

Dinora's a hardworking woman who has made a living selling pupusas and atol [a corn beverage] for three years.  The need to get ahead is what brought Dinora to look for a way to earn money.  Previously she worked in the home, but unfortunately her husband died and she had to find a job to support her children on her own.  A friend encouraged her to make pupusas and atol, and this is how she came to work in that business.

Dinora gets up at 4 a.m. to make the atol; at 6 she goes out to make door-to-door sales in the nearby communities, returning at 9.  In the afternoon she sells pupusas, starting at 3 p.m. and ending at 6:30.  That's her daily routine, but she says she does it with pleasure because her dream is for her daughters to go to school.

Dinora needs the loan she's requesting form CrediCampo to change the roof of her house.  The metal isn't any good and it leaks when it rains.  She needs help to ensure her family's safety.

Her hopes for the future are for her daughters to go to college and to build another bedroom to improve her house.  She also dreams of putting in a restaurant.  She hopes to achieve her dreams by saving her profits.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Tcveta

texts.ru: Цвета 63 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 7 детей. Все дети женаты и проживают отдельно со своими семьями. На попечении Цветы еще 4 внука, которые остались сиротами после смерти невестки при родах. Присматривать за внуками и вести хозяйство Цвете помогает супруг, который в данное время-пенсионер. У Цветы - высшее педагогическое образование, она имеет 30-летний стаж работы в школе. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Цвета занимается животноводством, стартовав 11 лет назад, с покупки скота на 14,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Цветы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Цвета обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Цвета планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку нового большого дома для семьи.
texts.en:
Tcveta is 63 years old and married.  She and her husband have raised seven children.  All their children have now left home and started their own families.  However, Tcveta still cares for four of her grandchildren who were left orphans after their mother (Tcveta's daughter-in-law) died during childbirth.  Tcevta's husband, who is retired, helps her to take care of the grandchildren and to run the farm.  Tcveta has a teaching degree and worked for 30 years in a school.  She is now involved in animal husbandry, an activity which provides the main source of income for the family.  She started in this business 11 years ago, with the purchase of livestock for 14,000 som (KGS).

Thanks to many years of hard work, Tcveta now owns three dairy cows, one horse and six sheep.  She makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  Eager to further develop her business, she has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" and requested a loan to buy some calves.  This loan will allow her to increase her animal headcount.  She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.  She is also planning to save enough money to buy a newer and bigger house for her family.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Doña Hilda de 44 Años de edad gracias a su primer financiamiento pudo asistir sus cultivos de café logrando comprar formula cafetalera, fórmula para crecimiento, urea entre otros que ayudaron a dar protección a la plantación para ´posteriormente recolectar un buen grano para su venta el cual trajo ganancias. Gracias a ello ella pudo vender una parte del grano a los diferentes compradores de la zona e intermediarios y cancelar su compromiso en su totalidad por lo que agradece el apoyo brindado por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL. 
Nuevamente Doña Hilda solicita su segundo financiamiento el cual será utilizado para la compra de fertilizantes y el pago de mano de obra para limpieza de la propiedad y la planta la cual es necesaria ya que después del corte la planta y la propiedad quedan deterioradas por lo que es necesario asistir nuevamente para poder sacar una excelente cosecha para esta temporada.
texts.en:
Doña Hilda is 44 years old. Thanks to her first loan, she was able to support the cultivation of her coffee. She was able to buy coffee formula, growth formula, and urea, among other things that helped to protect her crop. As a result she produced good coffee beans that she could then sell to make a profit. Thanks to this she was able to sell a portion of the beans to the different buyers and middlemen in the area and completely repay her loan. She is grateful for the support offered by the many lenders on the Kiva platform that is in partnership with the COMIXMUL cooperative.

Doña Hilda is again requesting a second loan that she will use to buy fertilizers and pay for manual labor to clear her property and the crops. This is necessary because after the plants are cut the property is left with the deteriorating crop, which makes it necessary to attend to it so as to be able to harvest an excellent crop this season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for manual labor to help in cultivating coffee

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Callen grows cash crops such as vegetables and bananas to sell. She is 42 years old and married. Together with her spouse they have been blessed with seven children and she also supports seven people in her family. Her spouse does provide additional income.

She will use this loan to pay school fees for her child. She anticipates making more income from her farming business and she will use the generated profits to grow her business as well as repay the loan.

This is Callen's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to be successful in her business and be able to give her family a comfortable life.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a business where she rents houses to customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of good bathing facilities. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy iron sheets and building materials to improve the standards of her bathroom and toilets of her rental houses. She hopes that in the future, she will live a good happy life. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Previously she was operating a retail store where she was selling household items.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and building materials

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is 31 years old and from Nakuru. She is married to David and they are blessed with four children, aged 22,18,12, and 2 years old. Salome is a farmer; a business she has been running for the last 11 years. She has applied for her first loan of KES20,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy hair weaves and braids. Her monthly income right now is KES10,000 and her plan is to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to improve her farming activities and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya. In the future, she hopes to be the best beautician in her area.

loans.use: to buy some hair weaves and braids to sell to her salon customers.

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en: Aged 38 and a resident of Battambang province where her maize and watermelon are grown, Ang is also the mother of four kids, two of whom are in school. Besides her plantation, she also uses her spare time to work for others to earn additional income. Ang has been occupied with her current business for more than ten years and she has received a decent income to improve her lifestyle, resulting from the positive impact of her past loans. This is the second loan for Ang and the third loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Both of them are seeking 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee to replant her maize. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her crops better than before.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee to replant her maize.

loans.name: Yeremiya

texts.en: Yeremiya is a 51 year old married man with eight children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a second-hand clothing business which he operates along side a cocoa buying and selling business. He has been in the two businesses for eight years and wishes to improve his family's well-being. He sells his cocoa to one of the leading cocoa agents--ESCO Uganda. His main challenges are competition and bad weather. Yeremiya will use this loan to buy more second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en: Zulfiya is 48 years old and married with two children. As a responsible mother, Zulfiya works hard every day to generate income to cover her daily costs and send one of her children to school. She is dedicated to her farming business of growing potatoes on her own land. In order to improve her family's living standards she has worked hard from the early morning until the late evening for the past 20 years. Zulfiya would like to develop her business, which is why she is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season.

loans.name: Tursunjon

texts.en:
Tursunjon was born in 1985. She is not married. For four years, Tursunjon has worked in a café as a cleaning woman. Now she is going to open her own café. She will cook national dishes and sell it to local people, who often have lunch and dinner in cafes. She took part in a course called "To Get Ahead" and learnt a lot of new information for herself. 

Tursunjon is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy equipment and to pay for rent for the café. She awaits your support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy equipment and to pay for rent for the café.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 41-year-old single lady, who has been employed in an architecture company for four years. Diana is an ambitious lady who is looking forward to developing her career, which is why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. She wants to start her own business and buy the necessary tools for this step forward. 

In the meantime her business will take place at her house, since she is going to take private projects of her own, until she finds herself financially ready to open her own architecture company in the future.

loans.use: to start her own business and buy the necessary tools.

loans.name: Mafanikio Group

texts.en: Sore is a mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She is in her early forties and married. For three years, Sore has been running two business, a grocery and a clothing store. Her business is open from 8 am to 5 pm every working day. She is able to make a good monthly profit. This is Sore's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use the loan to buy business clothes and drinks. With the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, Sore bought drinks, such as beer and soft drinks, and clothes. Sore has managed to earn extra income which she uses to cover transportation costs for her business as well as school fees and home expenses. Sore would like to expand her business so it has high sales. She will share this loan with her loan group "MAFANIKIO" which has three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business clothes and drinks.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
This is Mercedes. Her previous loan was a big help to her business for she was able to buy the spare parts and accessories for her tricycle. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her children. Her income from the business assisted her with her everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs.

Mercedes would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Additional profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedes dreams of expanding her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her tricycle (motorcycle).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for her children's tuition fees and raise more chickens.

loans.name: Yohana Azucena

texts.es: Yohana tiene 19 años de edad y habita en casa familiar junto a su madre, abuelo y hermano de 13 años de edad. Yohana se dedica a la venta de pupusas (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz, frijoles y queso)y  productos de primera necesidad en una pequeña tienda que ha logrado establecer en su hogar de residencia. Yohana desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del techo de la vivienda ya que se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y polines.
texts.en: Yohana is 19 and lives in her family home with her mother, her grandfather, and her 13-year-old brother.  Yohana sells pupusas (a food made from corn dough, beans, and cheese) and basic necessities in a small shop which she has managed to establish in her home.  Yohana wants to improve her living conditions and those of her family so she requests this loan from FUSAI to spend on improving the roof of her house, which is damaged.  With the requested money she will buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and roof beams.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and roof supports to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married and a mother of five children, three of which are below the ages of 15, and they all live in an eight-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate finances to properly manage her business, paying for her children's education, being unable to provide a square meal to her family, and the death of her family members.

With the new loan requested, she will buy foodstuff from bush markets such as plantains, potatoes, cocoyam, garri, and provision store items. Also she will invest part of the loan in agriculture--that is, she will buy seedlings, pay for labour, and the income will go to the running of the business. She holds a positive view for her business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time and as such has experience in the field. She has customers who buy from her at regular intervals and her business is situated at a good site were the demand for food is high. With this activity, the community will benefit from a reduction in prices and the people of the community will not travel long distances to buy foodstuff.

With the profit from this loan she will educate her children, expand her business, and support all family developments. GHAPE loans are preferable to her business because the interest rates are low and there are also convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff such as plantains, potatoes, garri, rice, groundnuts, provisions, and cocoyam.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail has been photographed in the midst of his apple orchards; a typical landowner holds five dynyms of land or about one dynym per person in the household, with some of it being arable, according to poverty assessments done a few years back.

Ismail lived in Italy for a very long time, and recently he settled in his village, where his plans are to expand the agricultural business, as he sees it as profitable and enjoyable. 

He is a 28-year-old married father of a year-old child. The village where he and his family reside has taken a second name, that of “Skanderbeg”, the national hero of Albania. According to history, Skanderbeg and his army passed through the road in the midst of the village, hundreds of years back. 

The homemade alcohol drink called “raki”, which is made of plum fruits, remains traditional in his village. The way that this drink is made is as follows: the grapes are put in plastic barrels for fermentation for about 2-3 weeks; then, the grape marc is burned on wood in copper bins where a pipe is linked to another pot were the steam is turned into the drink. Up until the 90s, this was a common activity. The more grapes villagers had, the more days and nights they needed to prepare this special and organic drink.

loans.use: to cover the house with a roof.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Minu, a married woman of 45 years, is from a remote village, Nirendrapur, which is situated in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives there in their own small kachha house (made of bamboo, straw and mud) with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). The children attend school, and both are in grade 7. Both Minu and her husband are illiterate and can sign their names only.

Minu's husband, Jayanta, 55 years, is associated with agricultural activities. He is the only earning member in the family. He works hard on his agricultural land. Minu also helps her husband in his work. They sell the products in the local market and somehow manage the family expenses. 

But, they cannot provide their children with enough education equipment. Their daughter, Jayadevi, is in grade 7. She is a very intelligent girl, hardworking and dedicated fully in her studies. She wants to study uninterruptedly, and aims to be a doctor. There are few doctors in their locality, so she wants to give service to the poor villagers, being a doctor. She wants to prepare herself from now onwards. She needs the help of private tutors who can guide her properly.

Minu has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase study materials, such as pens, pencils, notebooks and uniforms, and to pay the school fees and tuition fees for her daughter's smooth education.

She is hopeful that the loan will give her daughter an opportunity to proceed to her aim. Minu wants to see her children successful in life. 

Minu and her daughter (in the picture) are grateful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase education equipment and pay school and tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Jairo Armides

texts.es: Jairo tiene 22 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y hermanos desde hace mucho tiempo. Jairo trabaja como jornalero desde hace 5 años y es así como percibe el ingreso necesario para llevar el sustento a su hogar y colaborar con los gastos de su familia. Jairo desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera ya que el material que tiene por el momento se encuentra en mal estado.
texts.en:
Jairo, 22, has lived in his own house with his mother and his siblings for a long time.  He has worked as a day laborer for five years, earning the income he needs to support his household and help pay his family's expenses.

Jairo wants to improve the roof of his house because it's worn and in bad shape.  He's asking FUSAI for this loan to buy galvanized metal sheets and wood.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets and wood

loans.name: Sadhana

texts.en:
Sadhana is a rural woman and housewife from the remote village of Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She is 31, uneducated, and can only sign her name.  She lives with her husband Ganesh, 41 years old, and two children (one daughter and one son), who are students in grade 10. They have a kachha house (bamboo, straw and mud-made). Sadhana's husband is engaged in agricultural activities.

The income from Sadhana's husband’s agricultural business is not sufficient to meet the educational expenses of their children as well as household expenses. Both their son and daughter are very studious and sincere. If they could get private tutoring or coaching then they could do much better.  Sadhana’s daughter, Sathi,  is very intelligent, and she needs private tuition to improve herself.

Sadhana  has come to know that BJS makes loans to poor women for the education of their children, so she has taken out a loan from them.  She will utilise the loan to buy articles related to education such as pens, pencils, uniforms and pay school fees and tuition fees for a private tutor.

Now Sadhana is very ambitious but quite relaxed for her daughter. Sadhana and her daughter (standing beside Sadhana in the photo) give their hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To  purchase educational equipment and to pay private tuition fees and school fees for her daughter’s education

loans.name: Kalyani

texts.en:
Kalyani is a 40-year-old married woman.  She lives with her husband and four school-going children (one son and three daughters).  They read in grades 10, 9, 7 and 4, respectively. Kalyani's husband Yogesh is 46 years old and associated with agriculture.  Both Kalyani and her husband are illiterate and can sign only their names.  They live in their own house in the village of Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri. 
Kalyani's husband is a farmer by profession and the only source of income for the family.  As the family expenses are increasing gradually against his income, some disputes arise over their children's education.

One of their daughters, Sabita, is a student in grade 9.  She is very promising and possesses outstanding merit. Kalyani and her husband are very much concerned about their children's education. They want to give Sabita the proper tutorial help to improve her skills.

Thus, Kalyani is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS.  This loan will help Kalyani to purchase educational equipment like books, pens, geometry box, uniform etc. and to pay tuition fees and school fees for her daughter.

Kalyani and her daughter, Sabita (in the picture) are thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase educational supplies and pay tuition and school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 32 years old and lives in Gaza with his wife and three children, two of whom attend primary school.

On the first of May 2010, Mohammad opened his own barbershop, and recently he hired an employee to help him because his number of customers is continuing to increase. He is very well known now.

He asked Ryada for this loan to buy barber tools, an electronic generator and new decorations for his shop. This will attract more clients and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions of his family. 
 
Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy barber tools, an electronic generator and new decorations for his shop.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a married woman of 28 years from the small village Nirendrapur in the district Jalpaiguri. Her husband Ganesh, aged 28 years, is a rickshaw puller by profession. Both Purnima and her husband are illiterate and can sign their names only.  They are raising two children (one son and one daughter).  Their son is below the school-going age and the daughter is in grade 7. They live in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made).

Purnima's husband earns too little to cover the family expenses.  So, he is unable to afford much money towards her daughter’s education. Their daughter studies a lot to reach her goals in life. She wants to be a teacher in the future.  So, she wants to prepare herself starting now to reach her goal.

Purnima heard about BJS and has taken a loan from them for her daughter's uninterrupted education. She plans to use the loan to cover the tuition fees and school fees and to buy the study materials which her daughter needs.

Purnima and her daughter (in the picture) are very much grateful for the support provided which will help her to fulfill their dream and they are thanking Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase study materials and to bear education related cost for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali lives in a small village Tekatuli in Moynaguri  in the district Jalpaiguri.  She is 35 years old and a housewife. She is a courageous woman.  She passed grade 5 and could not continue studies due to her parent's poor financial resources, so she is determined to give her children good education at any cost. She is blessed with two children( one son and one daughter).  Both are students and read in grade 8 and grade 10 in loca school. Dipali lives in their own kachha house( mud, straw and bamboo made) with her children and husband Subal, aged 43 years.

Dipali's husband works as a mechanic in a garage. His income is so scanty, that they can not even afford their family expenses.  So, it has very much difficult to meet up the educational expenses of their children.

Their daughter Puja is a meritorious student who desires to continue her studies and wants to be an engineer in future.  She is now in grade 10 and very much serious about her studies.
Dipali learnt about BJS that they give education loan, and she has taken a loan from them, so that her daughter can continue her study.  With the loan she will purchase study materials like pens, pencils, books, note books, uniforms and most importantly engage a private tutor for Puja who can guide her properly.

Now Dipali is very much relaxed about her daughter's education as she is financially helped very much by her lenders.

Dipali and her daughter, Puja (in the picture) give their hearty thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees and to purchase educational equipment for her daughter.

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
Merina lives in the remote village Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  She is only 25 years old and is a housewife. She is blessed with 2 children, who are school- going and are in grade 5 and grade 2. They live in their own kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw). She is married to Ashad who is 28 years old.  Both of them have no elementary education, but they try their hardest to give their children proper education.

Merina's husband is associated with agribusiness.  It is the main source of income for the family. The income from the business is so scanty that they can hardly cover the family expenses. So, it has become impossible to afford their children's educational cost.

Merina is requesting the loan from BJS for her daughter Chumki.  Chumki is a bright and intelligent girl who studies seriously to score good marks in examinations but she needs someone's help in her study so that she can get better result.  She wants to be a teacher in the future. Merina and her husband are unable to give her a private tutor.  Merina plans to utilize the loan to purchase educational materials such as pens, pencils, books, note books, uniforms etc. and engage a private tutor for her daughter's smooth education so that she will be able to reach her goal.

Merina and her daughter (in the picture) are very much thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase educational materials and to pay the school fees and tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Sabena

texts.en:
Sabena is 40 years old.  She is from the village Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She lives in their own house with her husband and one school-going daughter.  She studied up to grade 6 and is a housewife. Her husband Robiul, aged 49 years, is a farmer by profession.  He has a primary education.  Their daughter is a student in grade 9.

Their entire family depends on the income of the agribusiness of Sabena's husband. He grows different crops in their farmland and Sabena helps her husband at the time of harvesting. This cannot give a decent income to the family.  Now, the lack of financial support for her daughter's tuition fees, school fees and other educational expenses are the main challenge.

To overcome the challenge, Sabena has taken a loan from BJS to purchase all the necessary articles and pay the school fees and private tuition fees for her daughter. Their daughter, now in grade 9, is very serious about her studies and examinations. It keeps her busy all day long as she has no private tutor. Sabena will spend the entire loan for her daughter's education, so that she can smoothly go ahead with her studies.

Sabena and her daughter (in the picture) are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for their loan.

loans.use: To cover her daughter's school fees, private tuition fees and to pay other necessary expenses

loans.name: Ahima

texts.en:
Ahima, 44 years old, is a mother of two school-going children (one son and one daughter) who are in grade 9 and grade 7.  She lives with her children and husband Makbul, 49, in Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Ahima and her husband are uneducated but they are very much concerned about their children's education.

Ahima's husband has been farming vegetables on their own plot of land. He toils and grows vegetables as the primary source of the family's income.  Although a housewife, Ahima helps her husband to generate more income. Yet,  they are unable to give their children the proper educational help.

Ahima's son Rahed is in grade 7. He is a meritorious student.  If he could get private tuition or coaching, then he could do much better in his final examination.

Suddenly one fine day, Ahima met with one of the credit officers from BJS ( Kiva's partner) and learned that BJS gives loan to poor women for the education of their children.  She decided to take a loan from BJS for her son's uninterrupted education. With this loan, she will pay school fees and buy school clothes and other necessary study materials like books, pens, pencils, etc.

Ahima is very much ambitious for her son and quite relaxed about his education since BJS and Kiva came forward to help her financially to secure her son's future. She and her son (in the picture) give their hearty thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: To pay private tuition fees and school fees and buy school supplies for her son.

loans.name: Sahijan

texts.en:
Sahijan is a 36-year-old married woman with two school-going children (one son and daughter). They are in grade 5 and grade 9. Sahijan is a housewife  who is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband Mansur, age 49, is also uneducated and a cycle-van puller by profession. They live in their own house in the small village of Bagnan in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Sahijan is an example of the women who work hard to give their children a better education. The income of her husband is not sufficient, which is a hindrance for their children's education. His inconsistent income makes them unable to go ahead with their education. But Sahijan wants to educate their children at any cost. Her daughter Mahasina is in grade 9. She is a meritorious girl with vivid attention and interest in studies. She wants to do a job after her graduation to help her parents financially.  But she cannot get the necessary educational supplies and private tuition because of her parent's poor financial resources.

Sahijan heard about BJS and has taken a loan from them. She plans to invest the entire loan to purchase study materials and to pay tuition fees and school fees for her daughter. She hopes it will help her daughter to get an uninterrupted education and reach her goal.

Sahijan and Mahasina (in the picture) are thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase study materials and pay school and tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Masuda

texts.en:
Masuda is 46 years old.  She is from the remote village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  She is uneducated, and can sign her name only.  She is a widow.  Her husband died long ago, so she has had to struggle a lot for her family. From then, she has been working as a labourer on daily wages to cover the family expenses and to look after her only son. They live in their own kachha house (straw, bamboo and mud-made).  Now her son has grown up. To provide financial support to the family, he is also engaged in agricultural activities.

Masuda's son works on their agricultural land from dawn to dusk to grow vegetables. As it is the main source of income for her family, Masuda also works hard and helps her son in this work, yet they are unable to make both ends meet. So, Masuda and her son have decided to start a milk supply and milk products business.

Masuda has taken a loan to purchase a dairy cow which will boost their milk production.  Then she will easily be able to start a milk supply and milk products--butter, paneer (fresh cheese), cheese and curd business. She will supply milk from door to door in her locality.  Her main customers will be her neighbours, friends and relatives.  Her son will also help her by selling the milk products in the local market.  She hopes to earn a good profit from this business as the products have great demand in the present market. So the increase in income will improve their living standard.

Masuda wants to build a concrete-made house for them and purchase more cows to expand her business in future, with the profit from her business. She and her son are very much thankful to the lenders ( BJS and Kiva) as they stand beside them in their difficult days.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk products business.

loans.name: Protima

texts.en:
Protima is married to Rangnath. She is 35 and her husband is 42. Both of them are illiterate but can sign their names. They are raising three sons and providing education for them. The sons are in grade 10, grade 8 and grade 5. They are from the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Protima's husband is a farmer. He is extensively engaged in agribusiness. Protima, though a housewife, is very hardworking and tenacious. She has to do all the household works and look after her sons and husband. After that, she helps her husband grow vegetables on their farmland and sell the products in the market. This business is a very important source of income for the family. But, due to price increases in essential commodities, it has become difficult for Protima's husband alone to cover all the expenses of the family – especially their children's educational expenses. So they have decided to start potato cultivation on their agricultural land. To do this, they need to make some investments in it. So Protima has taken out a loan from BJS (Belghoria Janakalyan Samity) to purchase potato seeds and good quality fertilizers to start potato cultivation. As potato is an important vegetable in India, they expect the business will be a profitable one.

Protima's goals are to give their sons good education so that they will establish themselves in future, to upgrade their poor lifestyle, and lastly they want to purchase a tractor in the future to cultivate with ease.

Protima and her family appreciate the support of the lenders (BJS and Kiva) in collecting the needed amount to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 33-year-old housewife from a small village in Dhupguri. In her family, she has her husband and one son. Rani passed class VI (grade 6) and her husband studied until class VII (grade 7). They also admitted their son to school. Both of them are very ambitious and want to give a good life to their child with a good education.

Her husband is engaged in an agriculture business. They have their own land where her husband grows different vegetables and crops in different seasons and supplies those items to the wholesale market. Now, she plans to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in potato farming by buying necessary supplies like potato seeds, fertilizers, urea and more. She decided to sow potato seeds because potatoes are a year round crop and a very popular vegetable used in most Indian dishes. In the future, she dreams of extending her business by buying more land with the profits earned from the business.
 
Rani is very much grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rinki

texts.en:
Rinki is a housewife.  She is only 30 years old and lives in Netajipara in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married to Khokon who is a car driver by profession. Rinki studied up to grade 10 and her husband passed 12th grade.  They have two daughters.  Both are students; one is in grade 6 and the other is in kindergarten.

Rinki's husband is the only earning member in the family. His earnings are not sufficient to cover the essential needs of the family. So, they are unable to afford much money for their daughter's education and some disputes arise about their daughter's education.

As their daughter Retuja (in grade 6) possesses an outstanding merit, Rinki and her husband are determined to give her any kind of support.  In order to improve her educational skills and give her proper tutorial help, Rinki asked for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS who gives education loans to needy women.  The loan will help Rinki to purchase educational materials (books, pens, notebooks, pencils etc.) for her daughter and to pay private tuition fees and school fess, so that she receive an education without any obstacles.

Rinki and her daughter (in the picture) are very much thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To  purchase educational materials and pay tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Doli

texts.en:
Doli is a 49-year-old married woman but unfortunately lost her husband. She is the mother of 2 children. They all are engaged in their education & she is busy in her business, which is selling clothes door to door.  Due to lack of money, she could not purchase a large variety & good quality of clothes and so her products were not up to the mark. She had to face lots of problems to run her family & to continue making money.  Now she decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) of INR 15,000 to purchase a lot of different types of clothes & also of better quality as per the demand of the market. She has a future plan to open a shop of her own with the profit of her business so that she can do business on a larger scale and reach more customers.

Dolly is very thankful to BJS and Kiva for this financial support.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for retail sales

loans.name: Suchitra

texts.en:
Suchitra, a 28 year old woman, lives in the small town Dhupguri with her husband and two children. By profession her husband is a van puller. He rents a van from a local owner to carry people or goods from one place to another. Both of them had completed up to grade 9 and 6 only so they are more interested to give proper education to their children. 
Suchitra, being a housewife, is more concerned with her husband’s income because she has noticed that her husband has a great skill to start to pull his own van as a business. But they have no capital for starting their own business.  Her husband’s income was very inconsistent because he had to give a large amount of his earned money to the cycle van holder. At that moment, she heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan to purchase their own cycle van as a transport in their locality. She knows that they would receive the whole profit from the business as their own and then they would be able to run their family smoothly without any financial hurdles. She dreams to purchase an auto rickshaw in the future with the profit of her new planned business. 
She and her husband both are very glad to thank BJS and Kiva for their great support in purchasing their own cycle van.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van to start her own business.

loans.name: Subha

texts.en:
Shubha is a 42-year-old married woman with four children and her husband is 46 years old. They live in the small town of Dhupguri. Shubha is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. Shubha and her husband are both illiterate and can sign only their names. They sent all their children to school. They dream that their children will get a higher education.
 
They have chosen to grow rice because they have their own plot of land and it is a profitable business in their area. They believe that farming on one’s own land is much more profitable than harvesting crops on someone else’s land.
 
She also hopes that with the profit from selling the rice, they will be able to build a pakka house (made of bricks and cement). She wants her children to lead a better and smoother lifestyle than they have now.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to make her dreams come true.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for helping her financially.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Pushpa

texts.en:
Pushpa is a 24 -year -old married woman. She is a homemaker. Her husband, aged 37 years, is a farmer by profession and earns money by selling vegetables in their local market. Both Pushpa and her husband are illiterate, able to sign their names only.
She is a mother of a son and a daughter. One of them receives education and the other one is too small to go to school. They live in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own Kachha house (mud and straw made).

She needs a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that she can buy seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation and make a good profit from this business. She hopes to improve their financial condition and give a good upbringing to their children. There is a very good demand of potatoes in this area so the business will be a lucrative one. They want to become financially successful from this business. Pushpa and her husband dream to upgrade their kachha house to a brick-built house.

Her full thanks go to BJS as well as to Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes

loans.name: Golapi

texts.en:
Golapi is a 23-year-old married woman. By occupation her husband is a farmer. He grows different kinds of vegetables. They have their only son who is in class V (grade 5).
