Golapi lives in Magurmari of the Jalpaiguri District. She has reached up to class VII (grade 7) while her husband completed class XI (grade 11).
Her husband’s income is too low to run his family smoothly and to care for their only son. Like every mother, Golapi also dreams to give the best to her child and so she plans to do something on her own. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds for potato cultivation. The field in which she is standing is now being used for cultivation of other vegetables but after the season is over she will rotate the crops and harvest potatoes in the same field. Now she will harvest potatoes because there is a great demand for potato in her area. Her financial condition will improve when she starts earning the profit from her potato farming and moreover she can also farm other vegetables in the same field. 
She is really thankful & grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for farming potatoes

loans.name: Reba

texts.en:
Reba is a housewife from Maynaguri who has studied up to class IX (grade 9). Her husband has been running a small business for many years. Their two sons are now students in classes IX (grade 9) and X (grade 10).

Her husband’s business is not going well nowadays and that is why she is perplexed about her children’s education. She also fails to manage the family expenses. For this reason she decided to start a new business which would maybe uplift them out of their critical condition, so she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase different ingredients like oil, potatoes, ghee, spices, etc. for making fast foods such as pakora, cutlets, fried pastries, potato chips, etc. to sell in her local area because there is great demand for fast food in her locality. Each and every person in her locality relishes her fast food items as there is no other fast food centre in their locality and there is a great demand for the product; that is why Reba earns a lot of profit from this business. Moreover, she can extend her business with the profit she makes and can give her family a smooth life.

Reba expresses her heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva for their kind financial support.

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients to start her new business of making snack food.

loans.name: Archana

texts.en:
Archana, a housewife of 48 years old, lives in Maynaguri with her husband and two children. Both of them had completed Madyamik, and their children are preparing themselves for a B.A. (Bachelor of Arts) and H.S. (higher secondary).

Her husband, Dhirendranath, is running a small business of ground spices used in Indian cookery. He buys the spices from the wholesale market and grinds them to sell door to door in the village area. Archana also helps him in packing the spices into different packets. Both of them work so hard, but their income is not sufficient to run their family. Moreover, her children’s educational expense is too high for them to afford, though she is totally concerned with their higher education. 

Archana chose this business because ground spices are in great demand in their village for daily cooking, and are also very profitable, but Archana is unable to earn their own profit as they have small variety of spices. 

Now she has applied to BJS (Kiva’s partner) for a loan to purchase more variety of ground spices, those which are used in Indian dishes. With the profit from this business, she hopes to expand her existing business by selling more spices door to door, as well as to the local market, which will enable her to be a good entrepreneur.

Archana is thankful to Kiva and BJS, as they have funded her to prosper in her business field.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of ground spices for her own business of ground spices, those which are used in Indian cookery.

loans.name: Chabi

texts.en:
Chabi is a 24-year-old married woman. She stays with her husband and her two children in the small town of Maynaguri.  Both Chabi and her husband are illiterate and just know how to sign their name.

Chabi is a housewife and her husband is a van puller. He rents the van from a local owner. For many days, they have been facing many problems in running the family. She learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan to purchase a rickshaw of their own. Like a van puller and auto driver, a rickshaw is also one kind of puller that carries people, goods etc. from one place to another, especially in remote areas. Now their family is earning sufficient money and she hopes that their financial condition will improve because being the owner of the rickshaw, the whole profit from this business will be hers.  

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for giving the loan to make her dreams true.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Debeswari

texts.en:
Debeswari is 54 years old and married. She is illiterate and just knows how to sign her name. Her poverty, ignorance and lack of knowledge have not allowed her to receive an education. Now, she is a mother of an only son and he is engaged in his own fruit business.

She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner)to purchase a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. Her husband is running a small business. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their child that is not affected by poverty and ignorance. This loan will give them an opportunity to make their dreams come true. Now, Debeswari lives in a Kaccha house (made of straw & mud), but with this loan, she will try to make a Pakka house (made of bricks & cement). 

Debeswari is thanking BJS and Kiva, as she is successfully running her dairy products business and has taken hold of the market for selling milk products.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk & milk products.

loans.name: Aroti

texts.en:
Aroti, a 46-year-old housewife, lives in Maynaguri with her husband Tarun and one son. Both parents are illiterate and can sign their names only. Due to their illiteracy and to having no knowledge of doing business, her husband has not been successful in running his business. In this critical situation, Aroti plans to start her new business of selling candy floss in her area. Her only son who is in class XII (grade 12) inspires her to start the business as soon as possible.

That is why Aroti is taking this loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase all the ingredients, as well as the cotton candy machine,  for making candy floss to sell in her area. The villagers are very fond of candy floss and the little children have this candy floss as much as they can, so Aroti chose this business. She hopes she will flourish in this business and with the profit she can build a concrete shop so that she would not have to move here and there on a cycle van to sell the candy floss. 

Aroti is very much thankful and highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for funding because to start a new business, financial assistance is required.

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients and the cotton candy machine for making candy floss to sell in her village area.

loans.name: Jhunu

texts.en:
Jhunu, age 41, is a hardworking housewife from the small town of Mayanaguri in Jaipaiguri District. She has completed class V (grade 5) while her husband has completed class VIII (grade 8). She lives with her husband and one son who is in class IX (grade 9).

Her husband is involved in the building business and she assists her husband in his business. The demand for building materials is high in their locality. But due to insufficient materials to sell, their earnings are not enough to cover their family expenses. Therefore, to have a good quantity of stock, she needs a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). After getting the loan, she wants to purchase bricks for their business.

Her dream is to develop this trade on a large scale so they can earn much profit and cover the family expenses smoothly. 

Both Jhunu and her husband are thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase bricks to sell

loans.name: Bela

texts.en:
Bela is a 48-year-old married woman, and her husband is 50 years old. She is a housewife, and her husband is a clay modeler. She has two children. Both of them are receiving education. 

Her husband has inherited the business of making clay idols. From the very beginning, he has been engaged with this occupation only. But as the days are passing by, it becomes very difficult to purchase everything for preparing clay idols, as the cost is too high. It was becoming very hectic for them to continue the business, for preparing one idol takes a lot of time. It includes lots of material, time, money, skills and patience.  

Bela has now decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to help her husband so that he can use the money in purchasing more things for preparing clay models. She believes that their business will be expanded, and they will run their family more smoothly without any interruption in the profit from their new planned business.

Bela is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding her.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, straw, colors and clay for making idols.

loans.name: Suniti

texts.en:
Suniti, age 46, is from a small town, Maynaguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and has a son and a daughter. Her husband is engaged in agriculture. Suniti and her husband are illiterate and only know how to sign their names, but they are providing education to her daughter. They live in their own kachha house (straw, bamboo and mud-made).

Her husband's earnings are hardly enough to cover food and household costs for the family of four. In order to generate income, her son also works as an electrician. Due to poverty, he could not get the chance to receive education, so Suniti plans to grow eggplant. She applied for the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). With the loan amount, she will purchase eggplant seeds and fertilizers and start cultivating eggplant, which is in great demand in the local market.

Suniti hopes her initiative will be lucrative, and she will be able to increase the family funds. She will be able to give her children better education and a better future, and at the same time, meet the family’s expenses.

She is thankful to BJS as well as Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase eggplant seeds and fertilizers to start a cultivation business.

loans.name: Purneswari

texts.en:
Purneswari is 25, married and lives with her husband and children. She is a rural woman from a small village, Raipara, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She studied up to grade 7. Her husband Uttam, aged 38 years, is a farmer by profession. They have two school-going daughters who are in grade 6 and grade 9. They live there in their kachha house (straw, bamboo and mud-made).

Purneswari's husband has been working many years on their farmland, and he absorbed good faith, diligence and punctuality. By character, he is determined, hardworking and responsible. He is the main source of income for the family. But his income from this agribusiness is so scanty that it is hardly sufficient to cover all the necessities of their family. So, they have decided to start cultivation of beans on their farmland.

Purneswari is a very optimistic woman. She has come forward to help her husband. She has taken a loan from BJS to purchase bean seeds and good-quality fertilizers to start cultivation of beans. They are very much hopeful to earn an extra profit from this business, as it is a product that is in great demand in the market.

She plans to use the resulting income to build a concrete-made house and to give better education to her daughters. She wants to save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds and fertilizers for cultivating beans.

loans.name: Manjuma

texts.en:
Manjuma is 43 years old.  She is a married woman and a housewife. She is uneducated and can sign her name only. Her husband, Bablu, aged 48 years, has an education of primary level. He is a farmer by profession who raises seasonal vegetables. He has several years of experience in this field, which makes him an experienced and skilled farmer. 

They live in their own house in the small village, Altagram, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri with their four children (three sons and one daughter). The eldest son is a mason, and two other children are students in grade 5.

Manjuma's husband usually sells his crops to the market in his area. His products are in good demand in the market. Raising crops takes a lot of strength. This is very hard work, and that's why Manjuma helps her husband in his agricultural work after managing her household work. But this business cannot provide them enough financial sustenance, so they have decided to start potato cultivation on their land.

Manjuma needs additional money to invest in seeds and fertilizers. They chose the business because it is a profitable one, and there is a great demand in the market. They applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS for this purpose.

This business will give her an opportunity to earn profits to fulfill her dreams, such as financial development of their family, to provide education to her children and improve her business to secure their future.

In the future, they want to purchase a tractor for use in their cultivation.

She is thankful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate potatoes.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju is a rural housewife from the village of Altagram in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She has two sons. She is 41 years old and a housewife. She lives with her husband and sons in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo). Her husband, Rahimudfin, aged  46 years, is associated with agribusiness. Their two sons are working as carpenters. Both Manju and her husband are illiterate and can sign their names only.

Manju's husband is an experienced farmer. To take care of his family, he works hard to overcome the financial hardship of their family. Manju assists her husband. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. This is the family's main source of income.

To continue the business in a sustainable way, they need to expand their business. They have decided to start a potato cultivation business. So, Manju applied for a loan from BJS to purchase fertilizers and potato seeds to start cultivation of potatoes. The loan will help her run her agribusiness in a productive way.

Her goals are to assist her husband to cover the expenses of their family and purchase a car with the additional profit generated from the business. The car would be for their own use and to make available for hire as another means of income.

Her full thanks go to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Jose Nicolas

texts.es:
José, tiene 55 años de edad, se dedica a vender hot dog, galletas, hamburguesas, refrescos, jugos, etc., desde hace 8 años, es apoyado por su esposa; realizando esta actividad genera los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos familiares, es casado.
En busca de surtir el inventario de su negocio se decidió a solicitar un crédito el cual utilizara en la compra de un coche para fortalecer el negocio y brindar un mejor servicio, espera aumentar la variedad de sus productos, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más amplio y aumentar la rentabilidad para tener un mejor estilo de vida así como también cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old; he has sold hot dogs, cookies, hamburgers, soft drinks, juices, etc. for a living for eight years, with his wife's support.  This business generates the income he needs to cover his family expenses, as he is married. 

Seeking to stock his business's inventory, he decided to request a loan that he will use to buy a car to strengthen his business and offer better service.  He hopes to increase the variety of products he offers, increase his sales, and improve his earnings. 

His dream is to have a bigger business and increase its profitability so he can have a better lifestyle and repay his debts.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Felicito

texts.es:
Felicito de 43 años de edad, debido a los escasos recursos de sus padres no pudo cursar ningún grado académico ya que no tenían lo suficiente para darle esta oportunidad y tenia que trabajar y mantener a su grupo familiar y ayudar a sus padres en la agricultura y en la pesca. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco en la comunidad y sus hijos uno el  mayor de edad quien ya tiene su propio hogar y  dos están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.

Felicito a sea dedicado desde muy pequeño a la pesca artesanal donde su padre y sus hermanos se dedicaban a esta misma actividad y también al cultivo de maíz, la pesca la realiza todos los días sea por la mañana o  por la noche dependiendo el tiempo y la agricultura la realiza en la época de invierno para esta época tiene que laborar doble ya que cada una de las actividades requiere tiempo y esfuerzo, su esposa se dedica a la venta del pescado que él captura en la laguna.


Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados en su vivienda, ya que se acerca la temporada de lluvia y requiere reparar el tejado de la casa.

Espera sacar adelante a sus hijos mandándolos a la escuela, que tengan una mayor oportunidad, también arreglar su vivienda ya que en la época de lluvia tiene problemas en el tejado
texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Felicito was not able to attend school at all because of his parents' limited resources, as they did not have enough to give him that opportunity and he had to work and support his family group and help his parents with farming and fishing.  His wife sells fresh fish in the community and, of his children, the eldest is an adult and already has his own home, while the other two attend the local school.  

Felicito has worked in traditional fishing since he was very young, as his father and brothers also did this work, and he also grows corn.  He fishes every day in the morning or in the evening, depending on the weather, and he farms in winter, during which time he has to work double because each of his businesses requires time and effort.  His wife sells the fish that he catches in the lagoon.  

The money from the loan will be used on his home, as the rainy season is coming and he needs to repair the roof on his house.  

He hopes to get his children ahead by sending them to school so they will have better opportunities, and he also hopes to repair his home, as he has problems with the roof during the rainy season.

loans.use: to repair the roof on his home.

loans.name: Jared

texts.es: Don Jared es originario de la ciudad de Estelí, casado y padre de un hijo. Tiene 40 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de artículos de librería y oficina. Inicio con el trabajo de mantenimiento de máquinas y luego se especializo en su propio negocio el cual ha mantenido hasta el día de hoy. Su meta próxima es diversificar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Tóner, Cuadernos, Libretas, Lápices entre otros. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a aumentar los productos que ofrece en su tienda. Su plan futuro es ampliar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en: Jared is from the city of Estelí, married, and the father of one child.  He is 40 years old.  He is a shopkeeper; he sells stationery and office supplies.  He started out working as a machine repairman and later specialized in his own business, which he has maintained to this day.  His next goal is to diversify the products he offers his customers.  He is requesting this loan to buy toner, exercise books, notebooks, and pencils, among other things.  He believes this loan will help him increase the number of products he offers in his store.  His plan for the future is to expand the infrastructure of his business.

loans.use: to buy toner, exercise books, notebooks, and pencils, among other things

loans.name: Katia Elizabeth

texts.es: Katia tiene 20 años de edad  y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida. Katia es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir desde hace 6 años. Tiene muchos clientes dado que sus productos son de buena calidad y buenos precios. Katia desea construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento, ladrillo y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder proceder a la construcción del cuarto lo antes posible y poder contar con mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en: Katia is 20 years old. She lives in her own home with her life's companions. Katia is a very hardworking woman who has worked making clothing for more than 6 years. She has a lot of customers because her products are good quality and well priced. Katia wants to build a room in her house and for that she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in buying sand, cement, bricks and iron. She hopes to have to loan and thus be able to start construction on the room as soon as possible and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks, and iron to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Glenda Maribel

texts.es:
Glenda de 32 años de edad, su familia  con mucho esfuerzo lograron que pudiese estudiar hasta un bachillerato ya que querían que tuviera una mejor oportunidad en la vida, luego se caso y formo su propia familia y ya no pudo seguir estudiando, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y sus hijos  están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.

Ella  se dedica a la crianza  de  animales de granja, esta actividad la a realizado desde que estaba muy pequeña los que tenían sus padres;  después que se caso y empezó por su propia cuenta y con ayuda de su esposo a la crianza de los mismos,también se dedica con su esposo a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, la granja la tiene en su casa y tiene la oportunidad de cuidarlos todo el día ya que los cerdos requieren mucho cuido, el que le ayuda es su hijo mayor quien después de regresar de la escuela esta muy pendiente de ellos.

Los fondos serán utilizados en la compra de 4 cerdos de engorde y ademas concentrado para la alimentación de los mismos.

Glenda espera progresar en la crianza de cerdos construyendo una galera que pueda albergar mas y lograr que sus hijos puedan alcanzar un nivel de estudio si es posible universitario.
texts.en:
Glenda is 32 years old.  Through a great deal of effort, her family was able to give her a high school education, as they wanted her to have better opportunities in life.  She later married and started her own family and could not continue with her studies.  Her husband works in agriculture and her children attend the local school.

She raises farm animals for a living.  She has been doing this work since she was very young and she worked with her parents; later on she married and started out raising animals on her own with the help of her husband.  She also works in farming with her husband, growing corn.  Her farm is in her home and she is able to look after her animals all day, as her pigs need a lot of care.  Her eldest son helps her when he gets home from school and he takes very good care of them.

The loan will be used to buy four pigs for fattening and feed to nourish them. 

Glenda hopes to progress with her pig-raising by building a pen that can hold more and she hopes to get her children to reach university-level education, if possible.

loans.use: to buy four pigs for fattening and also feed to nourish them

loans.name: Gavino Marcelino

texts.es: Don Gavino es un señor que actualmente es soltero y sin hijos bajo su cargo, es comerciante de ropa y calzado, por este medio de ingresos apoya a sus padres. Gavino necesita este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción e invertir en la mejora de su casa, en esta ocasión desea continuar realizando un muro perimetral que ya había empezado, de esta manera desea garantizar la seguridad en su casa.
texts.en: Gavino is currently single and has no children under his care.  He sells clothing and shoes and uses that income to support his parents.  Gavino needs this loan to buy construction materials and to invest in improving his home.  He currently wants to continue building a perimeter wall that he had already started, which will guarantee his home's security.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, iron, and gravel

loans.name: Nolvia

texts.es:
Gracias a su primer financiamiento doña Nolvia compro los insumos y abonos necesarios para poder asistir sus cultivos de café protegiendo a estos de plagas, enfermedades entre otros que pudieron afectarlos y deteriorarlos de no tratarse a tiempo. Ella agradece el apoyo brindado por los inversionistas en KIVA y la cooperativa COMIXMUL quienes ella considera están muy interesados en el bienestar y desarrollo de cada uno de los pequeños productores y demás. 
Hoy en día doña Nolvia solicita un segundo financiamiento que le permitirá comprar abono, deshierba (Limpieza), asistencia en general a su plantación de café, pago de mano de obra y plantación de una nueva chapola ya que esa es su mayor necesidad y por medio de este segundo apoyo económico ella podrá asegurar una excelente producción y un excelente cuidado ya que las ganancias serán utilizara para cumplir con su compromiso de pago, mejorar su nivel de vida, comprar más tierra para seguir cultivando y re invertir en su negocio esperando nuevamente ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma.
texts.en:
It was with the help of her first loan that Nolvia bought the supplies and fertilisers she needed to protect her coffee plants from blight and disease that could affect and damage them if not treated in time. She is grateful for the help given by Kiva lenders and the COMIXMUL cooperative. She believes that they are really interested in the well-being and development of every one of the small growers and other borrowers.

Nolvia is now asking for a second loan that will allow her to buy fertiliser and help on her coffee plantation, such as for weeding and clearing and to pay workers to plant new coffee seedlings, as this is what she needs most. With this second loan, she will be able to assure excellent plant protection and production. She will use her profits to repay her loan, improve her living conditions and buy more land to be able to continue planting and re-investing in her business. She hopes to be helped again by lenders.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to pay for workers to help with her coffee crop.

loans.name: Tumpa

texts.en:
Tumpa is a housewife.  She is only 23 years old and married to Ashutosh, aged 38 years.  Both are illiterate.  They live in their own house in the small village of Gadang in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri with their two children (one son and one daughter), who are below the school-going age. Tumpa's husband is a farmer by trade.

Tumpa's husband has been involved in cultivation for many years. Particularly he cultivates wheat, potatoes, tomatoes and other green vegetables. But his income is not enough to run a family well. Now this hard-working farmer needs financial support to enhance his business.

Tumpa is a very ambitious woman.  She wants to give her children a decent lifestyle and educate them properly.  So, she has taken out a loan to purchase fertilizers and potato seeds, which will help her husband to get more products for the whole year. The loan will greatly assist her husband to solve his farming problems and continue his agricultural business.

Tumpa aspires to start a hotel of their own with the profit earned for their secure future.

She gives her full thanks to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Bibi Ruqiya

texts.en:
Bibi Ruqiya is a 36-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and one son. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides welding services, making iron doors and iron windows. He owns a welding shop in the market. He manages his household necessities from his earnings from his welding shop. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. In this regard, Bibi Ruqiya's husband needs raw material, such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his welding work so that he can generate more income to financially support his family. Bibi Ruqiya is applying for a loan from a Kiva field partner for her husband's work.

She is very thankful to Brac Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories at a welding shop.

loans.name: Saneka

texts.en:
Saneka is from the village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  She lives with her husband Gouri and their two school-going children.  She has a primary education but her husband is uneducated and can only sign his name.  Their children are in grade 2 and grade 3.

Saneka’s husband has been involved in agricultural activities for several years. He cultivates different vegetables in different seasons.  Though a housewife, Saneka helps her husband in his agricultural works. They sell the agricultural produce in the local market, and that is the main source of income for the family. They cannot afford a living based on this small income.  To be able to continue running their agricultural business in a sustainable way, they want to expand their business by cultivating potatoes.

Saneka heard about BJS and has taken out a loan which she plans to utilize to purchase fertilizers and potato seeds.  They chose this business as potatoes are a product which is used in every dish throughout India, so they hope it will be a lucrative business and will give them a good profit.

Saneka dreams of giving good financial support to her family with this business which will enable her to uplift their poor financial condition, give a proper education to her children, and start a flower nursery.

They are grateful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their support.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna, a housewife of Maynaguri, lives with her husband and one son. She has studied up to grade 8 and her husband up to grade 10. Both of them are very much interested to give a proper education to their son. As Swapna’s husband has a small business selling snack items, it is going very difficult for her to afford her son's educational expenses. For instance, she is unable to give him private tuition and reference books related to his studies. 

Swapna’s son Abhisekh is a student of class XII (grade 12) and is preparing himself for the board examination but due to monetary problems he is deprived of private tuition, suggested books, Xerox notes, etc. Sometimes it seems that he would not be able take the board exam this year. 

At that time Swapna heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner), learning that it helps poor communities and soon she applied for a loan to give her son smooth education at any cost. She hopes now she will be able to give him more facilities for his education and her son will also receive better education to go further. She dreams that her son, being properly educated, will help them to extend their business as a lucrative one.

Swapna and her son Abhisekh (as per photo) are highly grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To afford all the expenses of her son’s education and also give him more facilities in getting a good education.

loans.name: Shamim Akhter

texts.en: Shamim Akhter is 28 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family consisting of four persons. She is well trained in cloth stitching. She provides services in stitching to people from her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for the shop, including threads, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Shamim Akhter is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her a loan as per her requirement. Shamim Akhter is very thankful to Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stitching related items such as clothes, thread, cotton, a sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Fouzia's Group

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 39-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. She maintains her household activities properly. She has been running a beauty salon for the last few years. She is well trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, the number of clients increases day by day. Therefore, she requires some beauty salon related items, such as facial creams, combs, mirrors, and furniture items such as hairdressing chairs, etc. So, Fouzia made contact with the Kiva field partner Brac Pakistan. Brac staff visited her enterprise and issued a loan.

Fouzia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy salon items such as hairdressing chairs, facial creams, combs, etc.

loans.name: Yesenia Noemy

texts.es:
Yesenia de 35 años de edad, estudio 2° año de bachillerato contador, vive soltera, ya que su esposo la dejo y se fue con otra mujer, vive solo con sus dos hijas, las cuales estudian en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven,.

Yesenia, tiene 20 años de estar dedicada a la venta de comida típica ( yuca frita, nuegados, enchiladas, tostadas de plátano y otros.), decidió trabajar en esta actividad, ya que nunca encontró un empleo formal y la necesidad de sobrevivir, todos los días camina a pie, casi medio kilómetro hasta llegar a la placita de su comunidad, ahí prepara sus insumos y una hornilla improvisada, para su negocio, el cual lo hace durante todo el día.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar 20 pliegos de lamina, para hacer un correredor en su casa, ya que cuando llueve el agua le azota hasta adentro de la casa y con esto se evitara, problemas de humedad en su casa.

Yesenia planea ahorrar y trabajar muy duro, para ampliar su casa y que sus hijas vivan con mayor privacidad, también sueña con que sus hijas sean profesionales, para lo cual debe ayudarles en su estudio.
texts.en: 35-year-old Yesenia, who studied as far as the second year of the high school accountancy degree, lives alone, as her husband left her for another woman.  She lives alone with her two daughters, who go to school in the community in which they live. Yesenia has worked for 20 years selling typical local food: fried yucca, nuegados (sweet dumplings), enchiladas, fried plantains, etc.) and she decided to work in this business because she had never had a proper job and she needed a way to survive. Every day, she walks nearly half a kilometre to the square in the town where she prepares her  supplies and an sets up an improvised stove and works there all day. The loan which she is applying to CREDICAMPO for will be used to buy 20 pieces of sheeting to make a hallway for her home, because rainwater flows into the house.  This will mean that she can prevent damp in her home. Yesenia intends to save up and work very hard to extend her home, so that her children have a more private place to live in.  She other ambition is to see her daughters have professional careers and so she has to help them with their studies.

loans.use: to buy 20 pieces of sheeting to make a hallway for her home, because rainwater flows into the house.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  BALIMAYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne 04 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à   OUYAERMA I un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme ASSAN fait la restauration dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient en première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 2 sacs de riz, divers condiments et 5 casiers de boissons, elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour  la qualité de sa cuisine.
 Elle fait sa restauration au marché. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The four members of the Balimaya group are married women who are on average 33 years old with four children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouyerma 1, one of the popular quarters of Sikasso in the third administrative region of Mali.
This is their third loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to satisfy the demand of their customers.
Within this group of women, Mrs. Assan is a caterer. She is first on the left in the photo.
With her loan she plans to buy two sacks of rice, various condiments and five crates of drinks. She is much in demand from her clientele due to the quality of her cooking.
She sells her food at the market. Her customers are men and women.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs CFA, part of which she will use to pay back the loan and she will save the remainder.

loans.use: to buy rice, condiments and drinks.

loans.name: Saiqa

texts.en:
Saiqa is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for six years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make repairs to his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good, and it requires maintenance expenses on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make the required repairs of his taxi. Therefore, Saiqa has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Saiqa's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Saiqa also plans to save the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Saiqa is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Kosar Bibi's Group

texts.en: Kosar Bibi lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons and four daughters. Her husband owns an artificial jewelry shop which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase a variety of jewelry for the shop that includes bangles, necklaces, rings, bracelets, etc.  Therefore, Kosar Bibi has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase artificial jewelry for her husband's shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business. Kosar Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more artificial jewelry items like bangles, necklaces, rings, bracelets, etc. for her husband's shop

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 48-year-old mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession; he has been working in a private medicine company for many years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of his family. Farah has been running a vocational training center for the past five years. She provides the facility for different types of trainings of home economics to women. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Farah needs to buy some furniture and other accessories for her training center to provide better facilities for training but due to some financial constraints she is not in the position to buy all of these items. Therefore, she has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
This loan will enable her to buy furniture and accessories for her business. This will also be helpful for her to earn a favorable income to meet her regular expenditures in the business.

Farah is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some furniture and other accessories for her training center

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to tend his pineapple crops

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Irum is a 25-year-old woman.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop for the past sixteen years.  He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family.  Irum's husband needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc., for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Irum has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to purchase these above accessories and also help him to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Irum is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband purchase pieces of clothes, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 36-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past two years. He alone is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Robina's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business, but due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Robina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these commodities and also help him to maximize his profits to manage his household and business. 

Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of commodities for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Sahera

texts.en:
Sahera is a simple rural woman from Maynaguri who lives with her husband and two children. She received only a little education due to her family problems and her husband is also illiterate and can only sign his name. Sahera's son is now in grade 9 while her daughter is in grade 7. Sahera herself is a housewife so she has to look after all the household matters including her children’s education. Her husband is a farmer, cultivating different kinds of vegetables and crops and selling them at the local rural market for income. As his income is very inconsistent, he is unable to cover the family expenses, so Sahera is interested in making her children eligible to help their father in his work.

Sahera's younger daughter Mini is a very intelligent student and has been coming in first in her class exams for five years. Sahera inspires her to do still better in the higher exams but she is unable to buy her textbooks for each subject and pay her school fees, tuition fees, etc., due to their poverty. Now Sahera has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to help her in solving these serious problems. She hopes she will be able to make Mini competent in her education with this loan money by giving her full support such as books, pens, copies, guidebooks, etc., whatever is needed. This support will help them to do well in future.

Sahera and Mini (as seen in the photo) gladly thank BJS and Kiva equally for funding.

loans.use: To purchase books and pay school and tuition fees of her daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials to lay a floor in her living room.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El señor Oscar, tiene una cosecha de una manzana de Pitahaya en el municipio de San Ignacio, todo su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar la tierra, sus esposa e hijos lo apoya incondicionalmente, el credito lo solicita para la compra de Fertilizantes, para limpiar sus cultivos ademas establecera cierta parte de la cosecha por lo que comprara, Tutores de Pitahaya, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Oscar has plot of land where he grows dragon fruits in the San Ignacio municipality. He has spent all of his life working the land and is supported unconditionally by his wife and children. Oscar is applying for this loan in order to buy fertilisers to clean his crops. These fertilisers will be used on some of his harvest. Oscar is grateful to "Afodenic" and Kiva for the support provided to him.

loans.use: to look after his dragon fruit crops.

loans.name: Maria Erodita

texts.es:
Doña María Erodita tiene 42 años de edad la cual es una mujer que se dedica a la producción de café, madre de 6 hijos 2 de ellos trabajan y los otros 4 estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Junto a su compañero de hogar se dedican al cultivo de café el cual al final de la cosecha y una vez recolectado es vendido a los diferentes beneficios de la zona donde es comprado para posteriormente revenderlo o exportarlo. Desde muy temprana edad en compañía de sus padres aprendió a elaborar la poda, limpia, levantamiento de sombra, fertilización entre otro. Gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio por muchos años Doña María Erodita pudo comprar un pedazo de tierra en el cual empezó a cultivar café y con el tiempo fue ampliándolo poco a poco. Su propiedad está ubicada a pocos metros de su casa de habitación al cual se dirigen en familia para dar la asistencia y mantenimiento protegiéndolos de enfermedades como la roya, la broca y bichos que puedan deteriorar el grano y la planta en su totalidad. 
Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales con hogares establecidos y sólidos. También sueña con ver poder algún día extender sus cultivos de café comprando más tierra y sembrando una variedad de café más atractiva para sus clientes y con un buen precio en el mercado ya que de esa forma ella generara ingresos para su familia y fortalecerá la economía en su hogar. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara fertilizantes, foliares, abono entre otros que ayudaran a proteger sus cultivos de café y a generar de la cosecha obtenida mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
María Erodita is 42 years old and makes a living growing coffee. She is a mother to six children, two of whom work while the other four are attending the local school. Alongside her partner, María makes a living growing coffee which, at the end of the season, once it is collected, is sold to different people in the area. The people buy the coffee to later sell or export it. María learned to prune, clean, grow and fertilise coffee alongside her parents from a very young age. 

Thanks to many years of effort and sacrifice, María was able to buy a small plot of land where she started to grow coffee and, with time, her crops have gradually grown. María's plot is just a few metres from her home and she arrives there with her family in order to support and look after her crops and protect them from illnesses such as blight, and from bugs, which can affect the quality of the crop and of the whole plant.

María dreams of seeing her children having their own profession and their own stable households. María also dreams of expanding her coffee crops, buying more land and growing a more popular variety of coffee for her customers. This will have a good price on the market and, this way, María can earn an income for her family and strengthen the household economy.

To do this, María has applied for a loan which she will use to buy fertilisers, manure and other items. These will help to protect her coffee crops and will help to generate a harvest that will give higher profits.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to look after her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sunati

texts.en:
Sunati is a housewife from Maynaguri, raising two children with her husband. Her husband runs a very nominal business from which he cannot earn sufficient income. They are experiencing a tough life due to their poverty. Both of them, being illiterate, want to make their children properly educated. They can only sign their names but they dream of giving higher education to their children. Sunati's children are students in grade 9 and 7.

Her elder daughter, Namita, is a very intelligent student. Now, Namita needs private tuition for her further studies.  Thus, Sunati is taking out a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy educational equipment and pay her daughter’s school fees, tuition fees, etc., so that she can pass all her regular examinations smoothly . Sunati does not want her daughter to lose any educational year because she dreams of her daughter’s uninterrupted education. Sunati took the loan to give a firm educational base to her daughter and make her more knowledgeable so that she should have that spirit to take on the whole responsibility of her family independently, in future.

Sunati and Namita (standing side by side in the photo) both have received great help from BJS and Kiva as well, due to their funding.

loans.use: to buy educational equipment and pay all fees for her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Torre Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores de éxito, una de ella es Martha tiene 49 años de edad, casada, su negocio es la venta de fritanga desde hace 8 años  consecutivos en su domicilio, y de ser cliente de la  institución tiene 6 años. Ella misma con otra ayudante atiende el negocio, este crédito lo invertirá en materia prima como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite en bidón, carne de res, carne de pollo, plátanos verdes, plátanos maduros, perecederos, sal, carne de cerdo etc. María Elena es otra socia su edad es de 56 años de edad y su negocio es fabrica de dulce, caramelo. Cándido  es un hombre de 57 años de edad su negocio es la venta de golosinas al por mayor.
texts.en:
This group has three successful and enterprising members. One member is 49-year-old Martha, who is married. Martha has had a restaurant for eight years, and has been a member of the communal bank for six years. Martha runs the business out of her home and works with one employee.  This loan will be used to buy supplies such as rice, beans, sugar, drums of oil, red meat, chicken, plantains, bananas, perishable items, salt, pork and more. 

Another member of the group is 65-year-old María Elena - she has business making sweets. Cándido is 57 years old and sells sweets.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, beans, sugar, drums of oil, red meat, chicken, plantains, bananas, perishable items, salt, pork and more.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María de 32 años de edad, nivel de estudio sexto grado, debido a los escasos recursos económicos de los padres. Es madre soltera ya que la persona con quien quiso formar una familia la abandono, solo procrearon 2 hijos esto paso hace dos años, desde entonces se a dedicado a trabajar por sus hijos quienes los tiene estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.

María se dedica al comercio, hace unos siete años atrás  trabajo como mesera en una pupuseria,   al principio atendía las mesas luego paso ayudar hacer las pupusas aprendió muy rápido, tardo algunos meses en tomar la decisión de dejar su pequeño empleo, vio la oportunidad que su vivienda esta ubicada a orillas de la calle principal que le podría ir bien si decidía emprender su propio negocio con mucho esfuerzo compro su propia plancha a gas y otros utensilios para el negocio, hoy en día vende tamales y otras productos alimenticios, tiene que levantarse muy temprano para preparar los ingredientes que utilizara en los alimentos también para prepararles los alimentos y los uniformes para que vallan sus hijos a la escuela, luego en el transcurso del día se dedica a la venta y cuando no logra vender todo se va a venderlo de casa en casa.

 María utilizara el préstamo para comprar mercadería para atender mejor a sus clientes en su pupuseria, ella vera su trabajo reflejado en sus ganancias.

María planea para el futuro arreglar  su vivienda siendo esta propia y dar a sus hijos una educación académica que  ellos puedan ir a la universidad para que tengan un mejor futuro de las ganancias, ella podrá realizar su deseo de ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y aumentar el negocio comprando mesas para atender mejor el negocio.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old and attended school through sixth grade, due to the limited financial resources of her parents.  She is a single mother since the person she wanted to create a family with left her.  She has two children.  This happened two years ago, and since then she has been dedicated to working for her children, who are studying at the school in her community.  

Maria works as a merchant.  Seven years ago, she worked as a waitress in a restaurant selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas).  In the beginning, she attended to the tables, and later helped to make the pupusas.  She learned very fast, and in a few months, decided to start her own business.  She saw an opportunity since her house is located along the main street, a business could go very well if she decided to start it.  With a lot of effort, she purchased her own gas grill and other tools for the business.  Today, she sells tamales and other food products.  She has to get up very early to prepare the ingredients she uses for the food, in addition to her children's food and uniforms for school.  Later in the day, she focuses on sales.  If she isn't able to sell everything, she goes out to sell door to door.  

Maria will use this loan to purchase merchandise so she can better serve the customers at her pupusa restaurant.  She sees her work reflected in her profits.  

In the future, Maria plans to fix up her house, since she owns it, and give her children a good education so they can go to university and have a better future.  With her profits, she will be able to realize her dream of seeing her children become professionals and be able to expand her business by purchasing tables.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her pupusa business.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is a 36-year-old woman and the mother of two children (one son and one daughter).  She is married to Nitya, aged 36 years.  They live in the small town of Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own house.  Her children are students in grade 9 and grade 10.  Though Laxmi and her husband both are uneducated, they are trying hard to fulfill their children's needs, including food, health, clothing and education.

Laxmi's husband has been a farmer by trade for many years. Laxmi has also helped her husband in the agricultural work for many years.  They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. The income from their business is too low to give the family a decent lifestyle and cover all the expenses, including their children's educational expenses, as the prices of essential goods are growing day by day. They thought to start cultivation of potatoes to overcome their financial hurdles.

Laxmi has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers.  This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. Thus they will be able to cover all the expenses of the family including the educational expenses of their children.

Laxmi aspires to start a rice mill of own with the profit generated from the business. Laxmi and her husband both are thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Riffat is 26 years old. She is a responsible mother of one daughter and one son. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of four persons. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to people at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for the shop, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to a lack of money, she finds it difficult to buy these materials. Therefore, Riffat is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Riffat is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes, thread, cotton, a sewing machine, and other stitching-related items.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María de 45 años de edad, sus padres eran de muy escasos recursos económicos y su familia bastante numerosa con muchas responsabilidades y mucho trabajo no vieron la necesidad de que sus hijos estudiaran y se pudiesen preparar, su esposo se dedica a la pesca artesanal, sus 4 hijos el mayor ya no pudo seguir estudiando prefirió trabajar con su padre en la agricultura y sus otros dos hijos están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad cursando secundaria.

 María se dedica al comercio informal en la venta de pescado y también en la venta de verduras esta actividad la realiza desde muy pequeña ya que su madre se dedicaba a este mismo tipo de negocio y cuando se caso no se le puso  difícil el de ayudar en los gastos familiares, ella espera la pesca que su esposo realiza por las noches y luego por las mañanas los va a vender a un punto especifico o tiene que caminar para llevarlos donde el cliente lo desea, también se dedica a vender verduras cuando no  hay pescado que vender, esto lo realiza todos los días excepto los domingos que es el día que descansa pero en  las épocas de veraneo vende todos los días ya que son las de mas venta.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para la compra de 2 semovientes, ya que espera engordarlos y que su esposo los cuide.

Los sueños a futuro son sacar adelante a sus hijos que estudien y puedan prepararse para que tengan una mayor oportunidad y con la compra de los semovientes al final de la temporada pueda venderlos y obtener una ganancia con las que se ayudaras ella y su familia.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old.  Her parents had very limited financial resources and a large family with many responsibilities and a lot of work, so they did not see the need for their children to attend school and prepare themselves.  Her husband works as a fisherman.  They have four children.  The oldest did not want to continue school and preferred to work with his father as a farmer.  The other two children attend secondary school at the school in the community.

Maria works selling fish and vegetables.  She has been doing this work since she was young since her mother did the same type of work.  When she married, it was not difficult to help with the family expenses.  She waits for the fish her husband catches at night and in the morning, sells it at a specific place or walks to bring it to where the customer wants it.  She also sells vegetables when there is no fish to sell.  She does this every day except Sunday, since that is the day of rest, but in the summer, she sells every day since there is more sales.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase two heads of livestock to fatten.  Her husband will care for them.

In the future, she hopes to help her children who are in school succeed and be able to prepare themselves to have better opportunities.  With the purchase of the livestock, at the end of the season, she can sell them and earn a profit to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 28-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Her husband has been doing his own business on a poultry farm for the past eight years. He is only responsible for fulfilling the needs of his family and manage the household.

Shehnaz's husband needs to buy different kinds of poultry items but, due to lack of sufficient funds, he is not in the position to buy these items for his business. Therefore, Shehnaz has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she'll provide financial assistance to her husband to buy these items so that he can earn the maximum profitable income.

Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of items relevant to the poultry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 41-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three daughters and her husband has been running his own PCO (Public Call Office) for the past three years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Sajida's husband needs to buy some furniture and make renovations to his business place, but due to insufficient financial means, he is not in the position to incur these expenses for his business purposes. Therefore, Sajida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she'll provide financial assistance to her husband to fulfill the needs of his business and to make proper renovations to his business place. This will also be good for her husband to earn a profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance, Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to incur some expenses of her husband's PCO booth

loans.name: Los Hijos De Tisma Group

texts.es: Los socios son hombres y mujeres emprendedores de éxito donde cada socio tiene su propio negocio una de ella es Ana mujer de 41 años de edad acompañada, con dos hijos su negocio es la venta de sopa en su casa actividad que viene realizando desde un año anteriormente trabajaba como obrera en la zona franca, ella misma atiende su negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como carne de res, hueso, yuca, chiltoma, tomate, chayote, ayote, culantro, hierba buena quequisque, naranja agria, chilote, repollo, leña, ingredientes etc . Yajaira es una mujer de edad de 29 años su negocio es la venta de pescado, Jose tiene 68 años de edad y su negocio es la venta y hecha de tortilla y Edgard tiene 44 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de pescado y verduras.
texts.en:
The members are successful men and women, and each one has their own business.  Ana, age 41, is one of them.  She is in a relationship and has two children.  Her business is selling soup at her house.  She has been engaged in this business activity for one year.  She previously worked as a worker in the free zone.  She tends to the business herself.

She will use the loan to buy ingredients like beef, bones, cassava, hot peppers, tomatoes, vegetable pears, pumpkins, coriander, herbs, taro root, bitter oranges, sweet corn, cabbage, and firewood, etc.

Yajaira, age 29, sells fish.  Jose, age 68, has a business of making and selling tortillas.  Edgar, age 44, sells fish and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like beef, bones, cassava, hot peppers, tomatoes, vegetable pears, pumpkins, coriander, herbs, taro root, bitter oranges, sweet corn, cabbage, and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Sajjad Ahmed

texts.en:
Sajjad Ahmed,40, lives with his spouse, son and parents in Sahiwal, Pakistan. He feeds his family and sees to the medical treatment of his parents.

He owns a hardware shop in Lahore, Pakistan and sells goods such as nails, nuts, bolts, door locks and handles, cutters and cutting blades. He wants to sell paint and cement as well.  But Sajjad needs additional capital to expand.  However, Sajjad is unable to buy inventory because he has been spending most of his money on household and medical medical expenses of his family.

Sajjad has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy sacks of cement and paints in various colors.

Sajjad feels that the loan will reduce his stress and generate enough profit for him to cherish his entire family. He is thankful of your support.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cement and paints in various colors.

loans.name: Easter's Group

texts.en:
Easter is a 52 years old active borrower from BRAC Pakistan.  She has three children and her husband has run a photocopier business for two years.

Easter's husband needs to buy accessories for his photocopy machine to keep it maintained, but he lacks sufficient financial resources.

Easter wants to help her husband by securing a Kiva group loan with another member, from BRAC Pakistan.  With this loan her husband can buy all of items he needs for his business.  The loan will help him maximum his income by providing better services.

Easter is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain photo copier machine.

loans.name: Insa

texts.en:
Insa is a responsible mother of two daughters and two sons.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Her husband has been a taxi driver for the last five years. 

He is responsible for his family.  Insa's husband needs to maintain his vehicle because its current condition is not good.  Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to maintain his taxi. 

Insa has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.  With this loan, Insa's husband will be able to repair his taxi and earn extra income. 

Insa plans to save the profit from her husband's business to meet her family's needs in the future.  She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain taxi car.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda, 30, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.  From the past many days his rickshaw has not worked properly and he is not able to generate any income.  He wants to repair it as soon as possible.

Therefore Saeeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw.  This will help him continue his business. 

Saeeda is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en:
Sobia is a 30-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of one son and two daughters. She looks after her family at home as she is a good housewife. Her husband provides painting services to buildings as well as shops. He also owns a small shop of paints, distempers, paint brushes, etc. for resale. He is a very hardworking man and performs his services honestly. 

His customers increase day by day due to his efficient work. In this regard, he was in need of some painting-related items such as paints of different colours, brushes, distempers, etc. These items will be used to increase his workload as well as for resale to customers. Sobia made contact with BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC Pakistan issued her a loan. Sobia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more paints, distempers, paint brushes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to cultivate his land.

loans.name: M. Arshad

texts.en:
M. Arshad, age 35 is the father of two sons and a daughter.  They live in Lahore, Pakistan.  He is religious, sympathetic, honest and a hard worker. 

He is a pharmacist and runs a small pharmacy in a nearby town to help poor people.  He can treat minor diseases with a very low services charges.  This is how M. Arshad generates some income to run his house.

He is very famous in his area due to his kindness; this is the reason the demand for medicines have been increasing.  He needs more medicine in bulk to cope with the demand.  M. Arshad also wants to buy injectors, medical equipment, syrup etc. 

He does not have enough capital to invest because he has to spend a large part of his savings on household expenses  Therefore, M. Arshad has requested a loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.  He hopes lenders will support his work.

loans.use: to buy medicine, syrup, injections, medical equipment etc.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a 24-year-old housewife who lives with her husband and children in the small town of Promode Nagar in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  Her husband Tapan, aged 31 years, is engaged in agriculture.  They have two children (one son and one daughter), who are students. They are in grade 3 and grade 5.  Both Namita and her husband are uneducated and can only sign their names.

Namita's husband is an experienced farmer. He is the main breadwinner of the family. With the help of Namita he grows vegetables; such as beans, chillies, onions etc. in their agricultural land. They sell the agricultural produce in the local market. This is a very important source of income for the family, but in spite of toiling at it they can't get much profit to run their family smoothly.  So they have decided to start potato cultivation in their agricultural land.

Namita needs a loan to cover the initial cost of purchasing seeds and fertilizers, so she has taken out a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).  Thus they will be able to grow potatoes in their land; potatoes are a very important vegetable used widely in India.

Namita and her husband hope that they will earn additional profit from this new business which will cover all the family expenses and as well as the educational costs of their children.

In future they want to purchase a cycle van to carry their harvest produce to the market. They give their hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Las Mujeres Del Maiz Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias una de ellas es Rosario tiene 46 años de edad, soltera, tiene tres años de tener su negocio que es la venta de sopa, anteriormente se dedicaba hacer ama de casa, su producto los comercializa en su vivienda a vecinos, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como carne de res, hueso, yuca, quequisque, ayote, chayote, naranja agria, culantro, hierba buena, leña, etc. Brenda tiene 22 años de edad su negocio es la venta de café, pan con mantequilla, Blanca tiene 46 años su negocio es la venta yoltamal y carne de cerdo.
texts.en:
This group has three members, one of whom is Rosario, a 46-year old single woman who has had her soup-selling business for three years. She used to be a housewife, but now sells her product to neighbors from her home. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients, such as beef, bones, yuca (manioc), quequisque (a tuber used in soups), ayote (pumpkin), chayote (vegetable pear), bitter orange, coriander, mint, firewood, etc. 

Brenda is 22 years old and she sells coffee and bread with butter. Blanca is 46 years old and she sells sweet tamales and pork meat.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as beef, bones, yuca yuca (manioc), quequisque (a tuber used in soups), ayote (pumpkin), chayote (vegetable pear), bitter orange, coriander, mint, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 44-year-old woman from the small village of Moimonsingpara in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband and their only son in their own kachha house (mud, wood and straw-made).  Her husband, aged 48 years, is a peasant.  Both are uneducated, but are able to sign their names.  Their son is a mason.

To take care of their family's needs, Anita's husband is extensively engaged in agriculture.  He sells his produce in the local market and his business is the main source of income for the family.  But his income is not sufficient to cover all the needs of the family. Thus Anita is also engaged in animal husbandry.  She sells milk and dairy products in her locality and also sells the small calf and offspring of the livestock in her locality. As life is getting more expensive day by day, Anita wants to earn more profit from her business to be able to  meet the needs of her family more effectively. She wants to buy forage for her cattle which she cannot do for lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase forage like hay, oil cake, grass etc. for her cattle. She hopes to have good profit from her husbandry business in future to be able to give financial support to her family.

In future she wants to purchase more cows to make a herd to expand her business. Anita and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders (BJS and Kiva) and thank them for their support.

loans.use: To purchase forage for her cattle.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid lives in Karachi, Pakistan with his family. He believes in hard work and honesty. He owns a cosmetics shop in the community market. He sells a variety of cosmetic products, including a variety of facial creams, shampoos, conditioners, makeup kits, etc. In addition, he also sells artificial jewelry in his shop. Unfortunately, his stock of jewelry is old fashioned. As a result, customers don't want to purchase the jewelry from his shop. He wants to replace the old stock of jewelry with the latest variety of jewelry. 

Therefore, to cover the cost of purchasing jewelry, Khalid has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. Khalid hopes that the loan amount will help him increase his sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase new varieties of jewelry

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 29-year-old woman and the mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a fruit stall, selling different types of fruits, e.g. apples, bananas, guava, etc. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Nasreen's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits so that he can increase the size of his business, improve sales growth and earn maximum profit. However, due to his unfavorable financial condition, he is not in a position to purchase these fruits for his business. 

Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband purchase the fruit. Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruits for reselling.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a rural housewife from the village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri . Her husband Porimol, aged 35 years, is a farmer by trade.  Together they are raising three sons, who are receiving an education and  are in grades 7, 3 and 1, though Maya and her husband are completely uneducated and can only sign their names. They live in their own house.

Maya`s husband has been in this agricultural business for many years.  He has got a lot of valuable experience that gives him an opportunity always to obtain the best harvests. The land he cultivates is located in a rich agricultural area near his house.  He sells his produce in all the neighbouring areas, and he has many customers because people know that every thing he sells is of the highest quality and is available at affordable prices.  He is an enterprising man and is very much dedicated to his work.  Of late his family expenses and his children's educational costs have increased a lot, so in order to increase his income he has decided to grow his agricultural business by cultivating potatoes.

Maya has taken a loan from BJS to buy potato seeds and fertilizers.  They hope to earn more profit from this, as this product has a great demand in the market. They hope that they will be able to cover their family expenses and educational expenses and at the same time bring greater economic security to their home.

Maya aspires to purchase a auto-rickshaw in future with the profit.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 35 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of two children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shehnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and pay for a little bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes to his business.

Shehnaz thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy new tires and pay for the rickshaw's engine maintenance

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 30-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of a son. Her husband is a plumber by profession and is the person responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Saima has been working as a tailor for the past six years. She provides tailoring services and contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household.

Saima needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. needles, threads, pieces of clothes, etc. for her business purposes but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan. With the help of this loan she can enable herself to buy all these things for her business purposes and she can also earn maximum profitable income. She is also planning to make savings with the amount of her profit.

Saima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of tailoring accessories

loans.name: Yeleida María

texts.es:
Yeleida es una mujer activa, pujante y emprendedora; vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante trabajando arduas jornadas.
Durante 7 años vivió en Europa, allí trabajaba como empleada en diferentes restaurantes, donde obtuvo la experiencia y el conocimiento en el manejo de este tipo de negocios; esto la impulsó a volver a Colombia con la firme intensión de montar su propio restaurante y al mismo tiempo poder estar cerca de su familia. Hace 4 meses se radicó nuevamente en la ciudad y se le presentó la oportunidad de adquirir un local ubicado en un sector comercial del barrio donde reside, el cual está remodelando y ha adquirido algunos activos, pero requiere comprar una nevera y los insumos necesarios (verduras, granos, sal, carne), para comenzar con su proyecto productivo y generar recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. Su horario de trabajo será todos los días de 6 am a 11 pm y contará con el apoyo de una cocinera y un domiciliario.
Yeleida sueña con acreditar su negocio y posicionarlo en el sector, logrando que sea rentable y, en un futuro tener la capacidad de adquirir un nuevo local más amplio para atender mejor a sus clientes, mejorando así la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yeleida is an active, driven and enterprising woman. She lives with her husband and their two children, whom she has gotten ahead with her hard work. 

For 7 years, she lived in Europe. She worked there as an employee in different restaurants, where she gained experience and knowledge about the management of that type of business.
