This drove her to return to Colombia with the firm intention of opening her own restaurant and at the same time being able to be close to her family. Four moths ago, she moved again to the city and had the opportunity to acquire a locale located in a commercial area of the neighborhood where she lives. She is remodeling it and has acquired some assets, but she needs to buy a refrigerator and the necessary ingredients (vegetables, grains, salt, meat) to start producing and generate income to help her husband support the home. Her work schedule is every day from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. and she will have the help of a cook and a cleaner.

Yeleida dreams of making her business be well known and well positioned in the area and for it to be profitable. In the future she wants to have the capacity of acquiring a new, bigger locale to serve her customers better. In this way, she will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and necessary ingredients (vegetables, grains, salt, meat).

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Farzana is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Rafaq Hussain

texts.en:
Rafaq Hussain is 34 years old. He is an energetic young man living with his spouse, daughter, and elderly parents in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. His forefathers and relatives have been selling meat for many years. Butchery is a traditional work; he learned the art of slaughtering animals and dividing the carcass from his father. He earns a reasonable income for his entire family. 

In the beginning he was purchasing small quantities of beef from the market and selling them for very reasonable rates in his town from his butcher shop. The customers were upset by stale beef for many days and he does not want to compromise his reputation and the quality of his product. This is the reason he wants to produce fresh beef and wants to buy a bull calf for producing more beef to sell. Unfortunately, he does not have enough cash in hand.
For this reason, he contacted BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner. After understanding all of the procedures, he has requested a Kiva loan so that he can buy a bull calf. 

He hopes that this loan will prove productive and beneficial for his butcher shop. Now he can easily produce fresh and healthy beef and he can maintain constant quality for his valued customers. He thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf for producing meat to sell

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is 52 years old. She is a responsible mother of three sons and three daughters. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of eight persons. She is well-trained in stitching clothes. She provides stitching services to people at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So, Asia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan as she requested. Asia is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To buy stitching related items like cloth, thread, cotton, a sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Nasir

texts.en:
Nasir is a responsible father of six children. He owns a bangles and cosmetics store in his community market. His elder son helps him in the business, while the rest of his children are studying in school. He sells beautiful, attractive and colorful bangles and a variety of facial creams and shampoos in his shop. 

Nasir has a friendly nature and he loves to work hard. Currently he is in need of purchasing more colorful bangles and facial creams for his shop. For that he has requested a KIVA loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase bangles and a variety of cosmetic products. This will help to increase his net sales and income. 

Nasir and his wife pray for the bright future of their family. He is thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of bangles and facial creams to sell.

loans.name: Nazish

texts.en:
Nazish is the age of 22. She is the mother of a kid and is living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible daughter, wife and mother. She has to look after her young baby, her old parents and the sibling of her husband. She wants to construct a separate house from the generated income for her family in which she could feel easy and relaxed, but her husband’s job is unsatisfactory for getting a high income.

She wants to help her husband for the growth of his business. Her husband owns a medical store in which he sells types of medicines. His medical store is near a medical clinic; most of the customers are referred by the doctor of that clinic. Most of the medicines are unavailable due to high costs.

Nazish knows that her husband can earn maximum profit if he offered these missing medicines. Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband. She hopes that he would be able to buy medicine and additional syrups, injections, etc., so that he can earn maximum profit. 

Nazish hopes that through the profit amount, she will be able to construct a new house soon.

loans.use: To buy medicine, syrups, injections, etc., for the medical store.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 36-year-old active borrower of Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of a daughter and two sons. Her husband is a butcher by profession, and he has been running his butcher's shop for the past twenty years. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family.

Shaheen's husband wants to purchase meat in bulk for reselling purposes but he has not enough amount to purchase it. Therefore, Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she'll enable her husband to buy the meat in bulk so that he can fulfill the demands of his customers and he can earn a maximum profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Shaheen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a new ice cream shop.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos es un hombre casado de 41 años de edad, actualmente vive junto a sus cinco hijos de los cuales son: tres hombres y dos mujeres, ambos viven en el Departamento de Suchitepequez. 
El es un hombre trabajador. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de granizadas en las calles de su comunidad. Decidió emprender esta actividad porque le gusta y  además es una labor que le genera buenos ingresos y ganancias, ya que donde vive es una zona donde hace mucho calor. A través de su negocio puede aportar a la economía de su familia.
Ahora cuenta con seis años de tener su negocio que le ha generado buenos ingresos y ganancias. Por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de un triciclo para poder visitar otras zonas y así incrementar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos en sus estudios, para que en un futuro tengan mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Marcos is a married 41 year old man. Right now, he lives with his five children, three boys and two girls. He lives in the department of Suchitepequez. 
He is a hardworking man. He says that he sells slushies in the streets of his town. He decided to start this activity because he likes it and it is also work that generates good income and profits, because where he lives it is very hot. Through his business, he is able to support his family.  

He has had his business for six years now and it has generated good income and profits. That is why he is asking for a loan of Q 3,000.00 to buy a tricycle to be able to visit other areas and thus increase his income. His dream is to get his children ahead in their education so that in the future, they will have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a tricycle to sell slushies.

loans.name: M. Azeem

texts.en:
M. Azeem is a 25-year-old young and energetic boy living in the area of Sahiwal, Pakistan with his parents. He is not a well educated person because he could not continue his studies due to financial problems.

He has been selling and getting experience from a lace selling shop. Now he has much experience with this business and newly started this business with very low capital so he can generate enough income for his parents and sibling. Many tailors and the ladies of his town like to buy lace from his shop. His customers appreciate his collection and selection of lace varieties. 

Currently he is interested in purchasing some of the latest varieties of expensive laces and embroidered pieces of shirts to enhance his income, but finds it difficult due to financial constrains.  Therefore, M. Azeem has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan so he can buy expensive laces, embroidered shirt pieces and additional items such as spools, paper cotton, buttons, packs of zippers, various colored thread, etc. This will not only help him to grow his lace selling business, but will increase his net income and savings as well. 

He wants to provide an education to his sibling because he wants to see them become a literate person. For this purpose more earning are required, and he hopes that the lenders will support him. He is very thankful to Kiva, lenders and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy expensive laces, embroidered shirt pieces, spools, paper cotton, buttons, packs of zippers, various colored thread, etc.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Zeenat is a 31-year-old woman and the mother of a son and a daughter. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband runs a restaurant; he sells different types of food items and also provides lunch and dinner with different types of Pakistani foods. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Zeenat's husband needs to purchase different types of food and other items for his business in order to increase the size of his business, improve his sales, and earn maximum profit. But, due to limited finances, he is not in the condition to purchase these items for his business. Zeenat has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband purchase the above items for his business. Zeenat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy different types of commodities and other food items for her husband's restaurant business

loans.name: Niaz

texts.en: Mr. Niaz is a very hardworking man. He lives with his family in Karachi, Pakistan. Mr. Niaz has been running his own general store near his house, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is currently in need of purchasing some products for his store, including powdered milk, flour, rice, chips, oil, soap and candies, etc. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business, but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase products for his store, including powdered milk, flour, rice, chips, oil, soap and candies, etc.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is 44-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of a son and a daughter. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	La señora María Antonia,  posee un negocio de venta de granos básicos  ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace quince  años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia, es madre de dos  hijos de los cuales solo una está a cargo.

El  crédito que solicito a CEPRODEL lo utilizo para compra de arroz, frijoles y productos varios  por mayor lo que permitirá a obtener mayores ganancias. Y así lograr  un  mejor nivel de vida de ella su hija. 

La señora María Antonia  está sumamente agradecida con Ceprodel por el apoyo que obtendrá del crédito puesto que este le será de mucha bendición para su desarrollo
texts.en:
Maria Antonia has a business where she sells basic grains in one of the Leon markets.  She’s been doing this for 15 years so she can support her family.  She is the mother of two children, but only one still depends on her.

She used the loan she got from CEPRODEL to buy rice, beans, and various products in quantity, which will maximize her profits and allow her to provide a better quality of life for her daughter.

Maria Antonia is very grateful to CEPRODEL for the support through this loan which will be a great blessing for her development.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Guillermina Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina Mercedes,  posee un negocio de venta de comida  ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace veintidós  años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia, es madre de cuatro  hijos de los cuales solo uno está bajo su responsabilidad. Sale de su casa de habitación a las 5:30 am, abre su negocio a las 6:00 am y finalizando sus labores a las 4:00 pm. Su negocio lo inicio con un  capital  producto de su ahorro.

El  crédito que solicito a CEPRODEL lo utilizo para comprar bloque, cemento y hierro para mejorar su vivienda y así darle una mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermina Mercedes has had a food business located in one of the markets in Leon for 22 years.   She does this to support her family and is the mother of four children, but only one still depends on her.  She leaves her home at 5:30 am, opens her business at 6:00 am, and closes at 4:00 pm.  She started her business with her own savings.

She used the money from the loan, through CEPRODEL, to buy cinder blocks, cement, and iron bars to make improvements to her house so that her family would be more comfortable.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: M. Tariq

texts.en:
M. Tariq, age 37 years, is a responsible father of four children. He has been running his business for many years. In fact, he owns a small garment-making business. He takes contracts from wholesalers and sews jeans pants and jackets on order. 

His business is situated near his house in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. One of his brothers and many hired tailors help him with sewing the garments. M. Tariq belongs to the middle standard family income level. He is unable to provide better education to his children due to low earnings, because a major portion of the business income is divided among the tailors. He has been facing a tough time due to his low income. He cannot do any other business, so he decided to expand his current enterprise. 

He does not want to sew the garments on order because the contractors criticize and find drawbacks in his completed shipments. He wants to buy his own raw material in the form of denim fabric for sewing jeans pants, so he could directly sell them to the retailers.
   
Therefore, M. Tariq has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan so he can buy fabric for sewing jeans pants. He seems happy after receiving the loan.

loans.use: to buy denim fabric for sewing garments to sell to the retailers.

loans.name: Mairamkan

texts.ru: Майрамкан 72 года, пенсионерка, вдова, после смерти мужа одна воспитала 5 детей. У Майрамкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Майрамкан занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Майрамкан, на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 4 кобылы, также имеется 2,80 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает ячмень, пшеницу и сено для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майрамкан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Майрамкан планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Mairamkan is a 72-year-old retiree and widow who raised 5 children on her own following her husband's death.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and is a crop-and-cattle farmer by trade, first starting 12 years ago with 20,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistence, her monthly income is now around 10,000 som, and she currently has 4 dairy cows, 4 mares and 2.8-hectare plot of land for growing barley, wheat and hay both for use on her own farm as well as to sell for a profit.  To further develop her farm, she's seeking a loan from Bai Tushum & Partners to buy cattle for fattening and resale at a high price.  She plans on using any extra income due to the loan to continue to buy more livestock, as well as to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 40-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past two years. He is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Rukhsana's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose, but due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Rukhsana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and will also be helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags and milk for her husband's business.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She is 51 years old. She lives with one daughter, one son, and her husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running a mobile shop for the past three years. He sells new mobile phones and mobile phone accessories (such as chargers, batteries, hand-free accessories, bluetooth devices, etc.) in his shop. He speaks with an impressive, monotonous tone and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. 

Tahira's husband requested a loan, so that he will be able to buy more mobile phones as well as accessories, such as batteries, chargers, hand-free accessories, and bluetooth devices to increase his business. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, Tahira has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband will be able to purchase relevant items for his business so that he can earn a more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Tahira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new mobile phones and mobile phone accessories such as batteries, chargers, hand-free accessories, bluetooth devices, etc.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is the age of 49. She is the mother of one son and two daughters and is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, and some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others.

Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Kalsoom requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc.

Kalsoom thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy general store items such as flour, sugar, rice, salt, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Ella es nancy y quiere solicitar el  apoyo de kiva para terminar de realizar esta meta que se ha propuesto, pues la situación no es nada fácil, ya que es madre soltera, cabeza de hogar con dos hijos a cargo de seis y cinco años y el único sustento es cuidar dos niños en la tardes, no tiene apoyo de nadie y el anhelo mas grande es terminar la carrera, por tanto le agradece que la tengan en cuenta.
texts.en: This is Nancy and she is asking for Kiva support so she can complete her goal.  The situation is nothing simple as she is a single mother, head of household with two children, ages six and five to support, and her only income comes from taking care of two children in the evenings.  She doesn’t get support from anyone and her greatest goal is to finish school.  Therefore she is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs and supplies to cultivate and protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma, age 40, is a housewife. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband is a scrap dealer. He deals in scrap items in his own shop. This business is the only source of income for the family. 

Salma is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. Her husband will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, scrap aluminum, scrap plastic bottles, etc., for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Salma hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap iron, scrap aluminum, scrap plastic bottles, etc., for the scrap shop.

loans.name: Rizwan

texts.en: Mr. Rizwan is a 46-year-old man who lives with his family in Karachi, Pakistan. He is a scrap dealer, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is currently in need of purchasing some products for his shop. But, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him grow his business, but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Francisca

texts.es:
la Joven Gloria Francisca,  es  casada y se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace once años, ofreciendo sus productos en uno de los  mercados de la ciudad de León. Inicia sus labores desde las 5:00 de la mañana y finalizándo las a las 6:00 de la tarde de lunes a sábado. 

 Gloria  utilizo el crédito  para Compra de bloque, Arena y piedrín los que utilizo para mejor su vivienda para brindarle mejor condiciones  de vida a su familia. 

Los sueños de la Joven Gloria  es que sus hijos logren a coronar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Gloria Francisca is married and sells fruits and has been selling fruits and vegetables for eleven years, offering her products in one of the Leon city markets.  She begins working at 5:00 am and finishes at 6:00 pm, Monday through Saturday.

Gloria used the money from her previous loan to buy cinder blocks, sand, and pebbles to make improvements to her home and provide better living conditions to her family.

Young Golria’s dreams are for her children to achieve professional careers.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Irum is a 22 year-old young woman. She lives with her one daughter and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running a mobile shop for the past five years. He sells new mobiles and mobile accessories such as chargers, batteries, hands free devices, blue tooth devices, etc in his shop. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone he has built up very good relations with his customers. Therefore Irum's husband requested a loan, so that he would be able to buy more stock of new mobiles as well as accessories such as batteries, chargers, hands free devices, and blue tooth devices to increase his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Irum has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband will be able to purchase relevant items for his business so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Irum is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of new mobiles and accessories such as batteries, chargers, hands free devices, blue tooth devices etc.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is thirty and lives with her husband.

Her husband is a catering services provider for ceremonies: he provides the decoration lights and tents for weddings, birthday and engagement ceremonies. His does not consider it a profitable business because this is a seasonal business. Now the marriage season is at its peak but most of his tents have become clumsy as they haven't been used for a long time. He wants to buy new wedding tents to provide a better service to his customers. 

Therefore, Nazia has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new tents and decoration lights to provide the decoration services. Nazia thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tents and decoration lights for catering services.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a thirty-year old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides whitewash and oil paint services to his customers in the community. Sometimes, he also works out of the city.
 
Nazia's husband has got a new contract to whitewash and oil paint a newly constructed house but he has no paint brushes or rollers for providing these services. Nazia has requested a loan so her husband can buy new paint brushes, rollers and kerosene oil.

Her husband’s savings are very poor, so he is unable to buy new tools for providing whitewash services. She wants to her family's condition and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new paint brushes, rollers and kerosene oil for whitewash services.

loans.name: Farah Naz's Group

texts.en:
Farah Naz is a thirty-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of one son. Her husband is an electrician by profession. 

For the last twelve years, her husband has been providing his services as a good electrician to his community. He also has some basic electricity tools like cables,  switches, fan regulators and lights at home for resale. He also requires some tools for his own work, and that is why Farah Naz made contact with BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan for purchasing electricity maintenance tools such as lights, cables and switches. Farah Naz is so thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools for electrician work such as lights, cables and switches

loans.name: M. Sadiq

texts.en:
M. Sadiq is 34 years old and is living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a very hardworking and gentle person. He is responsible for his spouse, a daughter and old parents. 

He is a milkman by profession and sells milk in his community from his motorbike. He has been selling milk since 1997, so he is very expert and experienced in his profession. He is expert in producing milk from a buffalo. He gets milk from all his buffaloes in no time. He has many buffaloes, and this is the reason he has to do very hard work to feed them. Every day he takes his buffaloes to the pasture for grazing and gives them a bath in the stream. He has to stay the whole day with his buffaloes due to fear of theft.

He wants to appoint an assistant to look after his herd but he does not earn enough profit to afford an assistant's salary. M. Sadiq is taking a 2nd loan. He invested his previous loan in the same business. With the help of his last loan he purchased a buffalo and has been getting benefits from that buffalo. He wants to continue to establish his business and wants to buy an additional buffalo so that he could increase his herd and his monthly income. Then he could appoint an assistant so that he could spend some time with his family. 

M. Sadiq is very happy after taking this loan. He thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo for increasing his herd and milk production.

loans.name: Aleya

texts.en:
Aleya is married to Sahajahan. She is only 25 years old and blessed with one daughter. Her husband is a 25-year-old farmer. Aleya received education up to grade 8, whereas her husband studied up to grade 7. Their only daughter is a child and below the school-going age. They live in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo).

Aleya's husband is an experienced farmer. He has been doing agricultural activities for a long time. He grows different seasonal vegetables which he sells in the local market. He is the only earning member for the family. Aleya helps her husband in his work, after managing her household work. But his income is so low that he can not afford a living based on that alone.

To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, they have decided to cultivate potatoes on their farmland. But they need capital, which they do not have. Aleya wants to help her husband. She heard that BJS gives loans to rural women to start off business. So she has applied for a loan from them to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation. The product has got good demand in the market, so they think it will be a profitable business.

Aleya hopes that that additional income will help to give a decent lifestyle to the family, give good education to her daughter and upgrade their house to one made of concrete.

Aleya and her husband will be thankful to all the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for helping them to maintain the agribusiness.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Sehrish

texts.en:
Sehrish is a 27-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns an auto workshop. He is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. Sehrish has been running her own beauty salon for the past four years. She also contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household. 

Sehrish needs to buy different types of cosmetics (i.e creams, hair brush, and other accessories) for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Sehrish has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family. For this financial assistance, Sehrish is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics and other items for her business

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en: Mariyam is 33 years old. She is a responsible mother of one son and two daughters. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of five persons. Mariyam is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to the people, at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Mariyam is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Mariyam is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stitching related items like cloth, thread, cotton, a sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Yemalin Marie's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Yemalin Marie(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), âgée de 47 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Yemalin Marie est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Euphrem. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Yemalin Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Yemalin Marie et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges familiales. C'est pour cette raison Yemalin Marie vend divers produits(savon, tissus et du charbon de bois) dans sa région depuis vingt cinq ans. Ce qui lui permet de d'assumer pleinement son rôle dans sa famille. Yemalin Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Yemalin Marie ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent pour la quatrième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: This group is made up of three people who live in the same neighbourhood. The leader of the group, Yemalin Marie (who has her hand raised in the photo) is 47 years old and did not go to school. Yemalin Marie is married to a chauffeur called Euphrem. They have four children who all attend school at their expense. Yemalin Marie and her husband share the various family expenses. This is why Yemalin Marie has been selling various products (soap, fabrics, and charcoal) in her region for 25 years. This activity enables her to assume fully her role in the family. Yemalin Marie buys her stock at a market in Benin. In order to reinforce her activity and satisfy the demands of her customers, Yemalin Marie and the other members of her group request the financial support of ALIDé for a fourth time. The previous loans were repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy various products (soap, fabric and charcoal)

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz is a 49-year-old active borrower with Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband is the guardian of her entire family and is responsible for fulfilling all of their needs. Imtiaz has been providing bookbinding services for the past three years and her husband also helps her in this profession. Both husband and wife contribute their income to manage the household. 

Imtiaz needs bookbinding materials, such as glue, tape, paper, blades, etc. for her business. But, due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy all of these things for her business. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase all of these relevant items for her business and will be able to provide better bookbinding services, which will help her earn the maximum profit and contribute to her savings to fulfill the needs of her family.

Imtiaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some book-binding materials for her business

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra is a thirty-five-year-old married woman.

Her financial condition is not good, so she has to think many times before starting any task. Now her husband has been driving a Moto Rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw using a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its engine is not powerful enough to bear the excess load needed to carry passengers. Since it is the only source of income for this family, Zohra's husband now must fix the engine. 

Without a loan, Zohra's husband cannot afford this, so she has requested a loan to allow him to fix the Moto Rickshaw and drive it smoothly. Zohra thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix a Moto Rickshaw's engine.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Nazia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Nazia is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To make repairs to her husband's rickshaw to provide transport facilities

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia aged twenty-three. She is a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles and waste papers. He has been running his business for many years. Nowadays due to household expenses, he does not have enough money to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell to earn money.

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. She is very impressed by this honorable support and would like to take more loans after she pays back this one. She thanks Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods for resale to the recycling factory.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 38 years old. She is the mother of three sons and two dauhgters. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of seven people. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to her customers, at her own house. 

She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for this work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her in order to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to a lack of resources, she finds it difficult to purchase these items. So, Nusrat is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stitching-related items such as cloths, thread, cotton, sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a 36-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. He has been running his own food stall business for the past twelve years. He sells cold drinks and spicy chaat (a highly popular Indian snack made mainly of crisp fried Indian bread pieces in combination with vegetables and a variety of sweet and sour spicy Indian sauces).

Naheed's husband wants to purchase ingredients of spicy chaat, e.g., potatoes, onions, chaat masala powder and yogurt, etc. However, due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these items. Therefore Naheed has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband can easily purchase these items for his business, and he can earn the maximum profitable income. Naheed is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy the Ingredients of Chaat for her husband's business.

loans.name: Flor De Reseda Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ella es Heissell mujer de 32 años de edad, casada, su negocio es la de una fábrica de zapatos de cuero desde hace 9 años, de ser cliente de la institución tiene varios   año, tiene cinco empleados, de los cuales cuatros son remunerados con salario, los productos los comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la capital así también en los mercados de su localidad, el crédito lo solicita para invertir en  materia prima como  cueros, fibra de cartón, pega amarilla, pega blanca, suela, taloneras, forros etc. Teresa es otra socia emprendedora su negocio es venta de comida y refrescos naturales su edad es 65 años, Yaritza tiene 36 años y su negocio es la de una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial members.  One of them, Heissell, is 32 years old and married.  She has been a client of the institution for several years.

Heissell has run a leather shoe factory business for nine years.  She has five employees, four of whom receive a salary.  She sells her products in the different markets in the capital as well as in her town markets.

She's requesting the loan in invest in leather, insoles, yellow glue, white glue, soles, heels, lining, and other materials.

Another enterprising member, Teresa, is 65 years old and sells food and natural soft drinks.  Yaritza, 35, runs a grocery store in her house.

loans.use: to buy materials to make shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk to supply to his customers.

loans.name: Qamar

texts.en: Mr. Qamar is a 34-year-old man who lives with his family in Karachi, Pakistan. Since 2005, Qamar has been running his own general store business near his house, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is currently in need of purchasing some products for his store including powdered milk, flour, rice, chips, oil, soap, candies, etc. But, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him grow his business, but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to sell

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is from Pakistan! She is married and has three children. She has requested a loan for her husband, who operates a food stall for offering barbecue to the common people of his area in the evening. He has been changing his menus from time to time according to the weather, climate and taste. 

Nowadays he wants to offer barbecue. For this, he is in need of chicken, grills, coal, spices, etc. Earlier he was selling Alu Chat (highly spiced fried potatoes...a common Pakistani food), which is cheaper than barbecue. He does not have enough cash in hand to buy ingredients for offering barbecue.

Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan her husband can buy chicken, grills, coal and spices for offering barbecue. 

Bushra is 45 years old and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy chicken, grills, coal and spices for offering barbecue.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en: Shazia is 38 years old. She is a responsible mother of one son and three daughters. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of six people. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to her customers, at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, cloth, etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to a lack of money, she finds it difficult. Therefore, Shazia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Shazia is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sewing-related items such as cloths, thread, cotton, sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is thirty-five, married and the mother of a daughter. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a livestock trading business and does most of his trading out of the city. He purchases goats from rural areas and sells them into the city. He has to feed and look after the herd which is very tough for him in his old age. He is making an effort and earning money for the survival of his family.
 
He wants to buy goats to sell at Eid-ul-Azha festival. Many people like to buy goats to immolate on Eid-Ul-Azha. This is very profitable but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy the goats.

Therefore, Kalsoom has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy goats to sell. This way, he can earn more of a profit, which will improve their quality of live. Kalsoom is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena, is a forty-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is providing transportation services to passengers in his auto rickshaw. Her husband has been doing this work for about eight years. To carry out his work, he gets up very early because he has to look for passengers on the streets of his city. As he drives the rickshaw continuously, it requires proper maintenance. He does not have cash in hand to pay for this.

Zareena has requested a loan, so that her husband is able to maintain his auto rickshaw. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan, for this honor. Now her husband feels tranquil and comfortable because he has a regular income. This will be her first loan with Kiva and she hopes that with your cooperation her husband will be able to carry out his plans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of an Auto Rickshaw.

loans.name: Firdus

texts.en:
Firdus is a 47-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three sons, and her husband is a plumber by profession. He is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Firdus has also been doing her business of clothes selling for past the two years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Firdus needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purpose. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she can buy more clothes of seasonal design and new variety for reselling to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

She is thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes of seasonal design and new variety for resale

loans.name: Gouri

texts.en:
Gouri is a 48-year-old housewife from a small remote village, Madhabdanga, in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married to Nirmal, age 54, who is engaged in a small business. Together they are raising one daughter. Gouri attended school up to grade 9 but her husband passed grade 12.

Gouri's husband earns very little from his business, and it is spent on the family expenses. Their daughter, Jayashree, is a student in grade 10. She will appear for the board examination next year. She is a very intelligent and studious girl. She tries heart and soul to score good marks for the examination. But with their poor financial condition, her father cannot provide her with the necessary educational equipment. Her father is not able to pay her school fees on time. Because of this, sometimes she feels uncomfortable going to school.

Thus, Gouri has decided to take out a loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS), who give education loans to meritorious and needy students. Gouri plans to use the loan to purchase necessary educational materials (books, notebooks, pens, uniform, etc.), to pay school fees and to engage a private tutor for her daughter so that her daughter will not face any difficulties in her education and can get ahead.

Gouri and her daughter (in the picture) are very much grateful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase essential materials for education and to pay school fees for her daughter’s schooling.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a thirty-eight-year-old lady. She is a housewife and the mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a scrap dealer. He deals in scrap items in his own shop. This business is the only source of income for the family. Shazia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. Her husband will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, scrap aluminum and scrap plastic bottles for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Shazia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To increase the size of her husband's scrap business.

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Jamuna is very much concerned about her children's education. She is a rural housewife aged 35 years. She is married to Amal who is 39 years old.  They are blessed with three sons. Jamuna is illiterate and her husband has a primary education. They live in the small village of Khagrabari in the district Jalpaiguri. Two of Jamuna's sons are school-going and are in grade 6 and grade 5. The third one is below the school-going age.

Jamuna's husband is associated with agricultural business, but his income is too low to cover the household expenses. Whatever he earns is spent on family expenses, so he finds it difficult to cover the cost of their children's education. Jamuna is not able to pay their fees. Because of this, her children sometimes feel quite uncomfortable going to school.

Jamuna always tries to promote the well-being of her children and their education.  Her son Milon is in grade 6.  He is not only meritorious but studious too.  But he needs guidance in his studies.  So Jamuna is accessing this loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).  With the help of the education loan she will pay for her son's school fees, textbooks, and stationery, private tuition fees and other necessary expenses.

She and her son (in the picture) are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva and give their hearty thanks for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase essential educational materials for her son.

loans.name: Niamat

texts.en: Niamat lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband owns a jewellery shop where he sells artificial bangles and bracelets to his customers. This is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase variety of jewellery for the shop that includes bangles and bracelets. Therefore Niamat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase artificial jewellery for her husband's shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy newly-designed artificial jewellery like bangles and bracelets

loans.name: Amirjon

texts.en: Amirjon was born in 1991. He is a fourth-year student at the Polytechnic Tajikistan University. He is very kind and hardworking man and is one of the best students. His friends and classmates like him very much. Amirjon is going to work in any organization after graduating university and will be an economist. He is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 48-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is thirty-six years old. She is a responsible mother of three sons and three daughters. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of eight people. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to the people in her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to a lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Shamim is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Shamim is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stitching-related items like clothes, thread, cotton and a sewing machine

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi lives with her husband and two daughters in the remote village of Khagrabari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is 36 years old, passed grade 10, and is a housewife.  Her husband Anil, aged 43 years, is associated with a tailoring business. He studied up to grade 12.  They are providing education to both their daughters who are in grade 5 and grade 12.  They have a kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo-made).

Laxmi believes that education is an important part of a person's life. People can't work properly and efficiently, if they don't have an education. But the income of her husband is so scanty that she can't afford much for her daughter's education.  Her daughter Arpita is 10 years old and studies in grade 5. She is a responsible student and studies well, but if she could get the help of a private tutor, she could have much better results.

In order to help her daughter's uninterrupted education, Laxmi has taken a loan from BJS to purchase necessary educational items and to pay school fees and private tuition fees for her daughter. She is planning for her daughter to graduate well. She aspires that her daughter will have a job in future and look after her parents.

Laxmi and her daughter Arpita (in the picture) highly appreciate their lenders' (BJS and Kiva's) support for giving them the loan which will make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase necessary educational items and pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Qaisara's Group

texts.en:
Qaisara, aged twenty-seven, is a mother of three children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market and this is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase new varieties of embroidery material to resell but due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult. This loan will help him to offer more variety to his customers and continue his work efficiently and professionally. His wife, Qaisara, is requesting a group loan with another member from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.

He will purchase an embroidery machine and new varieties of embroidery materials. Qaisara is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and new varieties of embroidery materials

loans.name: Mallika

texts.en:
Mallika is a 29-year-old woman.  She is married and a housewife.  She lives with her husband and three children in the small village of Khagrabari in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Their children (one son and one daughter) are receiving education and study in grade 9 and grade 6. Both Mallika and her husband have primary education.

Mallika's husband Kuldeb is associated with a small business. Whatever he earns is spent for household expenses. He finds it difficult to maintain the family and at the same time cover their children's education expenses. He is neither able to pay their fees, nor give them necessary educational articles.  Their daughter Ruma, in grade 6, is very attentive to her studies and tries hard to score good marks in examinations. Mallika feels that her daughter can study better with complete books, other necessary articles, and if all fees are paid on time.

So she has taken out a loan from BJS. She wants to utilize the loan to pay school fees, private tuition fees and purchase all necessary educational materials, so that her daughter can go ahead with her studies without any interruption.

Mallika and her daughter (in the picture) are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for their loan.

loans.use: to purchase essential educational materials and pay fees for her child.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is twenty-seven and she lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a shop where he sells a variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturing companies and sells them in his shop. In the past, he has sold only gentlemen's shoes but now he wants to offer ladies shoes as well, since there is customer demand for them. The major problem now is a lack of money to pay for these.
 
Therefore, Shahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy ladies shoes to resell. Shahida is very happy after receiving this loan and thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale from shoe shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, dairy items and meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cinder blocks, cement, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Sofiyaa

texts.en:
Sofiyaa is a thirty-six-year-old woman and the mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a fruit shop, where he sells different types of fruit including bananas, apples, grapes and guava. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Sofiyaa's husband needs to purchase fruit so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn a greater profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in a position to purchase these items for his business.

Therefore Sofiyaa has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase the above items for his buisness. Sofiyaa is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to resell

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is forty-five years old and married. Many years ago, she started a business of selling milk with the support of her husband.
 
Due to her efforts and her work, she is respected in her family. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She keeps the cow's milk for her family to use and then produces milk from buffaloes, which her husband sells in the market. What he does not sell in the market, she sells in her neighborhood. In this way, both are earning a healthy income to support their family. She shares a feeling of achievement from sending her children to school for a better education. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle with the BRAC Pakistan. She has some past savings and has applied for a loan to purchase an additional cow for producing more milk to sell. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for producing milk.

loans.name: Misba

texts.en:
Misba is a thirty-eight-year-old hard-working housewife. She is the mother of three children.
 
She has requested a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business. Her husband sells seasonal fruit from a cart: he purchases seasonal fruit in bulk and resells them. He has previously sold seasonal fruit but now he wants to buy oranges in large quantities to sell because it is the season for oranges and the prices are very low.

Therefore, Misba has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy the oranges in large quantities. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon. She is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fresh oranges to sell from a cart.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is 25 years old. She is a responsible mother of two daughters. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of four persons. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to the people, at her own house. 

She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Kiran is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Kiran is very thankful to Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy items like cloth, thread, cotton, a sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, red oil, rice, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Zaib.ul.nisa

texts.en:
Zaib.ul.Nisa is forty-eight years old and an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of five children and her husband is a plumber by profession. Zaib.ul.Nisa has also been working on her business of selling clothes for the past few years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the household. 

Zaib.ul.Nisa needs to buy different types of clothes to resell but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in a position to buy them. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can buy more clothes of seasonal designs and new varieties, so that she can earn greater profits to support her family and business. Zaib.ul.Nisa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy clothes of seasonal designs and new varieties for resale

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Sushila lives in Maynaguri with her husband and three children. She is illiterate but can sign her name. Her children are all students in different classes. Amongst them, her daughter Sushama is a good student and also very sincere about her studies. She is in Class 7 (grade 7). Both of her parents are struggling to run the family smoothly but they have failed because her father, being a farmer, has an inconsistent income. Her father is unable to cover all of their educational expenses.

Now Sushila heard about BJS (Kiva’s Partner) and applied for a loan to cover educational expenses such as school fees, books, pens, uniform, private tuition fees, etc., of her daughter Sushama. Sushila knows that if she gives some support to Sushama then she will progress to a further board exam. Sushila dreams of her daughter’s higher education in future so that she can take on the responsibility one day for household matters. She feels fully sure  that with this loan she can give total support to her dedicated daughter Sushama in her school education.

Sushila and Sushama (as in the photo) are very much obliged to Kiva and BJS for this financial support.

loans.use: To fund the education of her daughter Sushama in grade 7.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a housewife who lives with her husband and one daughter in the small town of Maynaguri. Her husband is a farmer by trade. Both she and her husband are illiterate, only able to sign their names, but their only daughter is studying in class X (grade 10) now. Though Purnima is illiterate she knows the utility of education and so she was not to be reluctant to give education to her daughter.

At present the problem arises when her husband, being a farmer, is unable to cover her daughter’s educational expenses. As her daughter Tapashi is a meritorious student, she did not take any outside help for her studies before, but now she needs some private tuition, reference books, notes, etc., for her coming examinations. Purnima is helpless to manage the household expenses, yet she is unable to handle the educational expenses also. This creates a great pressure on her mind. For that reason she took a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy her daughter’s school uniform, study materials, and for school fees school as well as private tuition fees. She hopes this loan will help her daughter to proceed smoothly in attaining her education and will pay transportation charges also.  She dreams that one day her daughter will succeed in life with the help of this education.

Purnima and her daughter Tapashi (seen in the photo) are very much thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase a school uniform and educational materials for her daughter.

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Virgen de Lourdes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Juana vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y donde realiza todas sus actividades personales y económicas. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de zapatos, ella distribuye y vende en diferentes ciudades como Sicuani y Anta.

Juana es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar zapatos para caballeros, damas y niños. 

Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de venta de zapatos, comida, abarrotes, cereales y otros brindan servicios profesionales. 

Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank Virgen de Lourdes, part of the group called Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. Juana lives in the city of Cusco in the south of Peru and this is where she undertakes her personal and economic activities. Her main source of income is selling shoes. She distributes and sells in different cities including Sicuani and Anta.
Juana is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is raising her family and needs the loan to buy shoes for men, women, and children.
The other members work selling shoes, food, groceries, or grain and others offer professional services.
The members are grateful to the people who are part of their dream through this loan and promise to make the repayments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy shoes for men, women, and children

loans.name: Arpine

texts.en:
Arpine is from Yerevan. She lives together with her mother and sister. Together with her mother, Arpine trades in children's clothing in a rented store in the center of the town. Despite her young age, Arpine is very careful and nice with her customers, so she provides them high quality service. 

Now, she has applied for this loan to be able to purchase new stock of clothing and resell it to her customers. She will be very grateful to lenders for their support, as the loan will give her an opportunity to provide a wide range of clothing for her customers.

As this is Arpine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of children's clothing for selling to customers

loans.name: Om Maa Dakhinakali Shg Group

texts.en:
This group is named "OM Maa Dakhinakali SHG" and is in a small village of Angul district of Odisha, India. This small village is very far from the capital, and is in its growth stage. All of the members of the group want to help their families and also their community. All the group members are women.

All of the members work in rural activities, such as raising farmyard animals, vegetable cultivation, etc. Sabita, the lady standing with her hand raised, is one of the members. She is requesting this loan to buy balanced feed to continue raising her animals. She hopes to continue fighting for her family and to improve their lifestyle.

All the group members are very excited, and they are very grateful to Kiva's lenders for this kind of help and support.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her farmyard animals.

loans.name: Angie Shirley

texts.es:
La señorita Angie Shirley  es una joven estudiante de Campo Alto, del área de auxiliar de administración de salud. 
Ella al igual que muchas chicas de la edad es una madre adolescente y cabeza de familia, con muchas metas y sueños por cumplir, ella es una persona aguerrida que hace todo lo posible por sacar adelante al pequeño hijo y brindarle un mejor futuro y para esto se esfuerza cada día laborando de sol a sol.
Ella tuvo una niñez muy difícil por los conflictos familiares que se presentaban dentro del hogar y todo esto la hecho más madura y con ganas de salir adelante junto con el pequeño hijo.
Por la situación económica a ella se le dificulta continuar el programa académico al que asiste a la  institución y por eso ella agradecería y le seria de mucha ayuda ser beneficiaria del apoyo económico que kiva ofrece en estos momentos.
texts.en:
Srta. Angie Shirley is a young student with Campo Alto who is studying to be a health management assistant. She, in common with many young girls of her age, is a teen age mother and head of household. She has many goals and dreams to fulfill. She is a brave person who is doing everything possible to help her little boy get ahead and provide him with a better future. Consequently she works hard every day from sun-up to sun-down.

She had a very difficult childhood due to conflicts in the family that broke out inside the home. However, all of this has made her more mature and eager to get ahead, together with her young son.

Due to her economic situation, it is difficult for her to continue her academic program. Therefore she would be grateful for support and it would help her grateful to be a recipient of the economic support that Kiva offers in moments such as these.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Maa Chanchala Group

texts.en:
The name of this Self Help Group is Maa Chanchala. This group was formed in Jan 2014 by thirteen active women entrepreneurs of Baldha village of Balangir district in Odisha; India. Baldha is located 70 miles away from the district headquarters Balangir. All the thirteen members of this group have different types of micro-enterprises like general store, tailoring, procuring seasonal argil products, tea stall, Tiffin center, etc.  Purnima is one of the members of this group who is sitting on the extreme right with raised hand in the first row of the photo. She is a very confident young lady.  She is 28 years old, living with her husband, two sons of eight and two years, one daughter of six years and her mother-in-law in a small house. 

Purnima has been running a tailoring unit with one sewing machine in her house for the last five years. Apart from this she also manages a small general store simultaneously. Her husband does private medical practice along with a screen printing unit in the village. Purnima earns a monthly income of 4000 INR from the above businesses which is very little to manage her family expenses with the educational expenses of her two children. To overcome this financial trouble, Purnima wants to earn some more income by expanding her tailoring and grocery shop businesses. So from a part of this loan she wants to buy a pico (sewing) machine and from another part buy grocery items like sugar, soap, tea, biscuits, shampoo, etc. She hopes this investment will help her to increase their income. Purnima hopes to save enough to give better education to her children and repair her house.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a pico machine for tailoring center and sugar, soap, tea, biscuits, shampoo, etc. for grocery store to generate more income to educate her children.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a thirty-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan along with her family. She is the mother of two children; one of whom goes to school. Her husband is a cattle trader and does most of his trading within his home area. He breeds cattle in his yard at home and sells them at a local market or to butchers. He has to feed the calves for one or two years until they have grown up and are healthy. This is a very lengthy and expensive procedure.

A few days ago, his one healthy cow died. Asma's husband had been growing the herd through breeding from that cow but now the breeding procedure has been interrupted. He wants to buy another cow to continue breeding but has already invested all his savings into his current cattle farm, so he does not have enough to buy a cow. 

Asma has requested a Kiva loan so her husband can buy a healthy cow with the contribution of her savings. Fetal diseases are the major challenge for him. With the profit amount her husband will buy fodder for cattle and cure diseases. She is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to BRAC Pakistan. She has agreed with our repayment schedule and happily signed all the necessary documents, including a client waiver.

loans.use: To buy a healthy cow for breeding.

loans.name: Babra

texts.en: Babra is a twenty-five-year-old housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. Presently he would like to offer greater variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Babra, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable prices. With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Babra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit from the field such as bananas, apples and oranges

loans.name: Real Atahuallpa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “REAL ATAHUALLPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
El socio Juan continua dedicándose a brindar el servicio de taxi, él socio trabaja durante el día por las diferentes calles de la ciudad del Cusco transportando a sus clientes que solicitan sus servicios, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su carro como en el cambio de aceite.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, venta de salchipapas, restaurante, agricultura, venta de leña, venta de emoliente, venta de comida, venta de verduras.
El socio que sale en la  foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.
La foto se tomo en dos grupos por motivos de trabajo y salud.
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “REAL ATAHUALLPA” communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco in the Province and Department of the same name.

Juan continues to provided his taxi service. During the day he works the various streets of the city of Cusco transporting the clients who request his services. He has done this for a long time which fulfills his personal and economic needs. He is a responsible and diligent person and in this way he gets his family ahead. 

Juan is requesting a loan for the maintenance of his car like an oil change. The other members sell vegetables, sell salchipapas (local fast food), run a restaurant, farm, sell wood, sell emollient, the sale of meals and selling vegetables. The member who appears in the inserted photo ask permission to arrive late due to work commitments. The photo was taken in two group for work and health reasons. The members thank everyone who forms part of this dream through this loan and promise to pay their installments on time..

loans.use: to maintain his car and change the oil.

loans.name: Cristhell Briggith

texts.es: Cristhell es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de un niño. Tiene 22 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada. Inicio su negocio con la venta de productos a sus amigas y poco a poco vio que el negocio crecía rápidamente y hasta el día de hoy lo ha mantenido. Su meta próxima es incrementar su inventario. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Blusas, Pantalones, Faldas entre otros productos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá surtir su negocio con variedad de artículos. Su plan futuro es establecer una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Cristhell is from the city of Estelí. She is 22 years old, and she is married with one child. She works selling various kinds of merchandise; a business that she began by selling products to her friends.
