She came to realize that the business was growing fast, and she has maintained it right up to the present day. 

Her next goal is to increase her inventory, and she is requesting a loan in order to purchase blouses, pants, skirts, and other products. She believes that the loan will help her very much, as it will enable her to stock her business with a variety of articles. Her future plan is to establish her own store.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, skirts, and other products.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is forty-five and the mother of six children. Her husband owns an electrician's shop in which he sells electric tube rods, bulb and electric accessories. He also provides services to his clients for troubleshooting electric goods. For the growth of his business and to satisfy his desire for earning a great profit for his family, he wants to buy more electrical goods.

Therefore, Abida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can be empowered to buy electrical goods for resale from his shop. This is her third loan with BRAC. She hopes that her husband will be able to grow his business soon.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For the last twenty-five years, her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to carry out maintenance on his taxi because the taxi's current condition is not good. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to pay for this. Therefore Fouzia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Fouzia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Fouzia  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's future needs. Fouzia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her husband's taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise, display windows and counters, etc.

loans.name: Las Costeñas Group

texts.es:
Ana es una señora soltera de 26 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el Departamento de Suchitepequez. Ella  se encuentra en el centro de la fotografía con una blusa rosada.
Ella es una mujer emprendedora. Actualmente se dedica a la compraventa de ropa típica y lo realiza en su comunidad. Comenta que eligió esta actividad porque no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pero ella se siente feliz con  el trabajo que tiene, ya que es donde obtiene un ingreso que le permite cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
Ahora se ha dado cuenta que la labor que realiza es bastante rentable, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de formar un grupo, en la cual puedan realizar diversas actividades con el fin de mejorar la economía de sus familias. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de ropa típica, para poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Entre sus sueños esta,  tener un local en donde pueda exhibir su negocio y así mejorar la economía de su familia y poder brindarles una educación de calidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is a single woman 26 years of age who lives with her 2 children in the Department of Suchitepequez. She appears in the center of the photograph wearing a pink blouse.

Ana is an enterprising woman. At present, she buys and sells typical local clothing in her community. Ana comments that she chose this activity because she never had the opportunity to study. But Ana feels happy with her present work because this is where she gets the income that permits her to cover the necessities of her household.

Now Ana has found that the work she does is sufficiently profitable and for that reason, she has decided to form a group that can carry out diverse activities to improve their families' economy. 

The loan will be used to purchase typical clothing, thus offering better service to their customers.

Among Ana's dreams is having a store where she can exhibit her goods and thereby improve her family economy and offer a quality education to her children.

loans.use: buy typical local clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves vive en la ciudad del Cusco y su actividad económica es la venta de zapatos, ella vende los zapatos por medio de catálogos y ofrece a sus amigos, ella trabaja en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m. Su sueño es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar zapato de caballeros, damas y niños.
 
Nieves se siente contenta por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas de forma responsable.
texts.en:
Nieves lives in the city of Cusco and her economic activity is selling shoes. She sells shoes from catalogs, taking orders from friends. Nieves works independently from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. 

Her dream is to have a store where she can sell shoes. 

On this occasion, Nieves needs a loan to purchase shoes for men, women, and children.

Nieves is content with the loan and she promises to make her payments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: to buy shoes for men, women, and children to be sold.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Ella  es Rosa Lidia tiene 20 años, vive hace un año en Bogotá  en la casa de una prima y le trabajo a ella en un almacén de muebles que ella tiene.
Es  la tercera  de seis hijos, siempre ayudo   laboral mente a la mamá para  que nunca les hiciera falta nada ya que ella trabajaba y ella tenía dos niños pequeños los cuales debía cuidar para que ella pudiera trabajar y no nos hiciera falta nada en casa, ella trabajaba mucho para  poder estudiar, ya que el papá nunca les ayudó económicamente, desde muy  pequeña con la hermana debió trabajar para lo que necesitaban en el colegio y colaborar con los  gastos de ella  y desde entonces debió trabajar para poder ayudar con los gastos de la casa y del colegio.
Es  la única en la  casa que ha querido estudiar para ser alguien mejor, alcanzar metas propuestas  y que la mamá se sienta feliz al ver que las cosas que ha deseado se hagan realidad. 
Por eso solicita el convenio de KIVA,  ya que este contribuirá con la ayuda para la continuación de los estudios, debido a esta ayuda económica puede  ayudar económicamente a la mamá  y seguir costeando lo demás para poder continuar con los estudios y fortalecer los conocimientos. 
El poder alcanzar y lograr este crédito le ayudara económicamente para poder sustentar los demás gastos como son:  arriendo, comida y transporte.
texts.en:
Rosa Lidia is 20 years old and has lived at her cousin's house in Bogotá for a year and works in the cousin's furniture store. She is the third of six children and always helped her mother so that they never lacked for anything as she had to work and and had two small children who had to be looked after so that she could work and they never lacked for anything at home. She worked hard so that she could study because her father never helped financially. Since she was very little, she and her sister had to work for what they needed for school and to help with the cost and, since then, she had to work to help with the household expenses and her school fees. 
She is the only one in the family who has wanted to study and better herself and reach her goals. Her mother is happy to see that she is making her wishes reality. 
For this reason, she is requesting  loan from Kiva that will help her continue her studies. Thanks to this financial assistance, she will be able to help her mother economically and continue paying the rest to be able to study and increase her knowledge.
Being able to get this loan will help her to cover other expenses such as: rent, food, and transportation.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Gulru

texts.ru: Гулру молодая незамужняя девушка в возрасте 27 лет. У нее высшее финансовое образование и в данный момент работает бухгалтером. Гулру живет в районе Джиликуль с матерью, невесткой, братом и племянницей. У нее есть талант шитья. Одновременно она занимается швейным делом и совмещает его со своей работой. Гулру предоставляет услуги швеи уже 7 лет. Она влюблена в это дело с детства. Гулру шьет на очень старой машинке. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку и расширить свое дело.
texts.en: Gulru is a young, unmarried woman at 27 years old.  Gulru lives in Jilikul with her mother, sister-in-law, brother, and niece.  She has a higher education in finance and she currently works as an accountant.   Gulru also has a talent for sewing.  She is in the sewing business, too, and combines it with her accounting work.  Gulru has been offering sewing services for 7 years.  She has loved this kind of work since her childhood.  Gulru uses a very old sewing machine so she is requesting a loan to buy a new, modern sewing machine in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él se dedica a la venta de zapatos ortopédicos, él es un joven responsable y emprendedor que pertenece al banco comunal “Emprendedores de San Cristóbal” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como zapatos ortopédicos para niños. 
Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad y mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Gonzalo lives in the beautiful city of Cusco where he carries out his economic activities. He sells orthopedic shoes. He is a responsible and enterprising youth who belongs to the “Emprendedores de San Cristóbal” communal bank. At this time he needs a loan to buy merchandise like children's orthopedic shoes. He thanks all the lenders and promises to pay his installments in a responsible and timely manner.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like orthopedic shoes for children.

loans.name: Ablawa Cécile's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est un composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Ablawa Cécile (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), âgée de 44 ans a très peu fréquenté l’école. Ablawa Cécile ne vit plus avec son mari. Ablawa Cécile a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à sa charge. Ablawa Cécile vit avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par dame Ablawa Cécile. Pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille, Ablawa Cécile vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs plus riz accompagnés de sauce) depuis vingt ans dans sa région. Ablawa Cécile s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Ablawa Cécile ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent pour la première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three people, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s leader, Ablawa Cécile (with her hand raised in the picture), is 44 years old; she did not go to school much. Ablawa Cécile no longer lives with her husband. She has three dependent children, some of which go to school. Ablawa Cécile lives with her children.

Mrs. Ablawa Cécile takes care of the household’s varied expenses. To support her family, she has been selling food (corn paste with rice in sauce) in her region for twenty years. Ablawa Cécile gets her supplies from a market in Benin. To strengthen her business and meet her clientele’s demand, Ablawa Cécile—together with her group—is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, and condiments

loans.name: Gino Rafael

texts.es:
Gino vive en la ciudad de Ica, trabaja con mucho empeño en el área de encomiendas en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Gino está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar electrodomésticos para su hogar, y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y poder seguir esforzando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su propia empresa”.
texts.en: Gino lives in the city of Ica. He works with a lot of dedication in the shipping department of a transport company in the city where he makes the money he needs to get ahead. Gino is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support he can buy appliances for his home and in this way improve his quality of living. He can continue to strive towards his big dream which is to have his own business.

loans.use: to buy appliances.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  SABALY sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à  HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme SANATA fait le commerce  des tasses dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  10 cartons de 6 pièces de tasses. Elle s’approvisionne à SIKASSO. Elle vend en détail à la maison et au marché à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Group Sabaly’s four members are married women, who are on average 30 years old with five children. Most of them live in traditional families in Hamdallaye, one of the popular neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.

To meet their customers’ demand, they are on their fifth loan with microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. In this group of women, Mrs. Sanata retails cups. She is in the second position from the right to the left in the photo.

With her loan, she is planning on purchasing ten boxes of six individual cups. She stocks up in Sikasso. She retails from home and at the market, to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and grants credits.

She expects an average monthly profit of 20,000 XOF; part of it will be used to pay back her loan, with the rest going to her savings.

loans.use: to buy cups.

loans.name: Kulumkan

texts.ru: Кулумкан 67 лет, вдова, воспитала 6 детей. После смерти супруга, Кулумкан очень долго не могла пережить утрату близкого человека. Нужно было воспитывать и ставить на ноги детей и Кулумкан решила взять хозяйство и материальную ответственность в свои руки. У Кулумкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кулумкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кулумкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 теленка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулумкан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита Кулумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en:
Kulumkan is a 67 year old widow who raised six children.  For a long time after her husband's death, Kulumkan couldn't cope with the loss of someone so dear to her.  But she had to raise her children and get them standing on their own feet, so she took the responsibility for her household and material well-being into her own hands.   Kulumkan has a secondary level education and her family's main source of income is the animal husbandry business she started 22 years ago with the purchase of 8,000 som (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Kulumkan has three milk cows and two calves.  Her monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).  

With an aim to further development of her business, Kulumkan applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to buy calves.  Kulumkan plans to invest the profits from the loan in further increasing the size of her her and to save money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Leonardo Flaudio

texts.es:
Leonardo es un joven de 19 años, el cual vive en el distrito de la venta baja, Leonardo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza mucho en su empleo como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ya que ello depende el tener ingresos para salir adelante.

Leonardo está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar muebles para su vivienda, ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, de esta manear podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder ahcer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una casa propia y mejorar su calidad de Vida”.
texts.en: Leonardo is a 19 year old young man who lives in the district of Venta Baja. Leonardo has a lot of desire to get ahead. It is for this reason that he puts a lot of effort in his work as a worker on a farm in his city as he depends on this to make the money he needs to progress. Leonardo is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support he can buy furniture for his house which is in poor condition right now. Thus he can improve his quality of living and continue to strive to achieve his big dream, which is to own his own house and enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Jaime Reynaldo

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Pucara una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y gandería , ubicada en la Provincia de Jaen que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y comercio de cuyes desde hace 02 año, comprándolo en los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos en el mercado de su distrito a un mayor precio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 5 00 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde sus animales.
texts.en:
Jaime is 27 years old. he lives with his wife and child in the district of Pucara, located in the Province of Jaen part of the Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. It is a community with a hot climate and it's residents work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Jaime, together with his wife, have raised and sold guinea pigs for the last two years buying them in the villages close to his community. Then they fatten them and sell them in the local market at a higher price. Jaime is requesting a loan of 500 PEN to buy balanced feed to fatten the animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is the age of 32. She is the mother of one son and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a General Store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, and other items. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his General Store. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, which is the reason his business is running well. 

Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Mumtaz requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, and other items. 

Mumtaz thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy general store items such as flour, sugar, rice, salt, groceries, and other items.

loans.name: Erika Alida

texts.es:
Erika Alida tiene 49 años de edad, vive en su propia casa, junto a su hijo en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comundad que se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de frutales, arroz y café, también se dedican al comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza, las compras lo realiza al por mayor en para posteriormente ofrecerlos sus clientes, cuenta con clientela considerable, se dedica a este rubro desde hace 20 años, es emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 800 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de ropa y de esta manera seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes..
texts.en:
Erika Alida is 49 years old and lives in her own house along with her son. They live in the district of Pomahuaca, located in the Province of Jaen, part of the Cajamarca Region in the North Andes of Peru. It is an agricultural community, especially growing fruit, rice and coffee and also involved in commerce and raising livestock.

Erika sells clothing and beauty products. She buys them wholesale and then offers them to her clients. She has done this for 20 years and has a considerable clientele. Erika has requested a loan of 1,800 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a variety of clothing that she can continue to offer to her clients.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to offer to her clients.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 43-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband is a motor mechanic by profession. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Suriya is also providing sewing services and earning income to contribute, with her husband, to managing the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods like needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and will also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy products for her business use like cloth, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика 59 летная уроженка района Рудаки. Она мама двоих детей. Ее сыновьям по 23 и 21 года. Они заняты учебой. Малика большое внимание уделяет образованию детей. Муж Малики работает в Российской Федерации. Он не забывает своих близких и поддерживает их. Малика преподавательница в местной школе. Она уже 18 лет учит детей, работает с ними и ведет их на правильный путь. Параллельно с работой в школе она около 23 лет занимается животноводством. Малика в коровнике выращивает скотин. У нее не много скотов, потому что у нее не было много времени и теперь, когда ее сыновья стали активно ей помогать она хочет расширить поголовья скота. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Malika is a 59-year-old resident of the Rudaki district. She is the mother of two sons, ages 23 and 21, who are busy studying. She cares a great deal about her children's education. Malika's husband works in Russia. He does not forget about his loved ones and continues to support them. Malika is a teacher at the local school and has taught kids for 18 years, working with them and leading them down the right path. She has also raised livestock for 23 years and keeps cattle in a small barn. She does not have many cattle because she does not have a lot of time, but now that her sons are helping her, she wants to expand her livestock business. It is for this reason that she applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Chanchala

texts.en:
Chanchala is married to Chintahoron. She is a housewife of 41 years and studied up to grade 8. Her husband completed secondary education.  They live in the small village of Khagrabari in Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  They have only one son who is a student in grade 9.

Chanchala's husband is associated with a small business.  The income from his business is not sufficient to cover all the household expenses, so they face difficulties covering the educational expenses of their son. Their son Utpal, who is in grade 9, is a very meritorious student.  He stands first in every class.  But Chanchala and her husband are not able to give him enough educational support due to their poor economic resources.

Chanchala heard about BJS and learned that they give educational loans to poor and meritorious students, so she has applied for a loan from them.  She seeks this loan to support her son's education, so that their son does not face any difficulty in receiving education. This loan will help her to pay the tuition fees, to purchase education materials like books, notebooks, pens, pencils and to pay private tuition fees for her son's education.

Chanchala and Utpal (in the photo) are very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for this educational loan.

loans.use: To provide her son with all necessary educational materials.

loans.name: Aanti

texts.en:
Aanti is a rural housewife of 42 years.  She lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter) in the small town of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She attended school up to grade 10.  Her husband, Motilal, aged 44 years, is engaged in a very small business. All the three children are receiving education and are in grades 6, 5 and 4.

Aanti could not continue her education due to her parents' poor economic resources. She is a courageous and optimistic lady. She wants to give their children higher education but her husband's poor income is the main hindrance to fulfilling her dream.  Their daughter Dipti is in grade 6. She possesses an outstanding merit. She might score high marks in her annual examination.

Aanti heard about BJS and has taken a loan from them. Her goal is to give her daughter proper tutorial help to improve her educational skills. This loan will help her to pay school fees, purchase educational materials, and to engage private tutors for her daughter, so that she can receive education without any obstacle.

Aanti wants to see her daughter graduate and engage her in their family business. She and her daughter (in the photo) are thankful to their lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to pay school fees and purchase necessary materials for their daughter's education.

loans.name: Gayatri Group

texts.en:
Umadei, aged about 47 years, is the leader of a group that hails from Larkipali of Bolangir district of Odisha, India. She lives with her husband and son. The member seating first from right in the first row, raising her hand, is Umadei. 

Umadei has been managing a tailoring shop in her locality for the last 20 years.  To add to her income, she is also doing a milk business, rearing two cows. She came together to form a Self-Help Group along with the other 12 members from her village and wishes to get a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing businesses. This is their first cycle loan.  

 Using their small income Umadei maintains her family in a low profile. Now she is very much confident in running her business and has developed her shop significantly. At present her monthly income is about Rs.5,000. With the present loan, she wants to purchase a cow and a sewing machine. She has a dream to construct a pacca (concrete-walled) house for herself.

The other 12 members of her group are Snigdhanjali, Surusuta, Rupa, Gahala, Gouri, Rukuni, Soudamini, Supana, Malli, Banalata, Pushpa, and Gurubari. They also want loan for different purposes like dairy, raising goats, electrical shop, vegetable vending, grocery shop, tailoring and betel shop.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and also a cow

loans.name: Deysar Delso

texts.es:
Deysar tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que tiene gran cantidad de ripio y arena que la población utiliza para construir sus viviendas, también se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público mediante su mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a las zonas aledañas a su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando un servicio seguro.
texts.en:
Deysar is 24 years old and lives with his mother in the Cayalti district.  The community has a large quantity of rubble and sand that people use to build their homes.  They also work in farming, commerce, and raising livestock.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Deysar working providing transportation to the public on his mototaxi.  He transports passengers to nearby areas of his community.  He has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase parts for his vehicle so that he can continue providing safe service to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  BADEYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, et ont en moyenne 01 enfant. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à  FAMA  un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs quinzièmes prêts avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  AMINATA  fait le commerce d’habits dans ce groupe. Elle se tient à l’extrême droite sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 30 mètres de bazin moyen riche à SIKASSO et effectue à détail en espèce et à crédit au  marché  et à la maison à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
Group Badeya’s four members are married women, who are on average 42 years old with one child. Most live in traditional families in Fama, one of the popular neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali. To meet customer demand, this is their fifteenth loan with microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso.

In this group of women, Mrs. Aminata retails clothing. She is standing all the way to the right in the photo. With her loan, she is planning on purchasing thirty meters of mid-range brocade in Sikasso. She retails from home and at the market, to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and grants credits.
She is expecting an average monthly profit of 22,000 XOF; part of it will be used to pay back her loan with its interest, with the rest going to her savings.

loans.use: to buy cloth.

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad hospitalaria, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la compra y venta de panca desde hace 5 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra mayor panca para ofrecerlo a los moradores aledaños y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Robert is 44 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún, a hospitable community.  The people work in farming, commerce, and raising livestock.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.

He has worked buying and selling dried maize leaves for five years.  His business is located in his home.  

He has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase better dried maize leaves to offer to his neighbors so that he can grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize leaves.

loans.name: Gayatree Group

texts.en:
Banita is a 30-year-old lady who lives in Salepali in Bolangir Town in the Bolangir District, Odisha, India. She is the group leader of an 18-member group. Her family is comprised of four members: her husband and two sons aged 11 & 8 years old. The member standing third from the right in the first row with her hand raised is Banita. 

At present, she is running a small poultry business in her locality. Her husband also supports her in running the business. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her own efforts. At present, her family income is about Rs 7,000 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. 

This is the first time the group will take a loan from Mahashakti. With the loan, she will purchase a bigger quantity of hens in a lump sum and some chicks to raise and sell after they grow. 
 
The other 17 members of her groups are Sabita, Basanti, Kure, Sanju, Kamala, Buee, Babita, Saraswiti, Hema, Madhuri, Sapura, Kunti, Sila, Mira, Satyabhama, Hina & Kuni. They want loans for different purposes like vegetable vending, selling groundnuts, a hotel, an electrical shop, a betel shop, a rice business, an auto rickshaw transport business and a grocery shop.

loans.use: to purchase more hens and chicks

loans.name: Om Siridi Sai Group

texts.en:
Nandita is the leader of a group that hails from Palace Line, Bolangir Town of Bolangir district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 32 years. She has a small family comprised of three members: her husband, one son of 4 years, and herself. The member standing with raised hand, first from right  in the back row, is Nandita. 

Nandita has been managing a Ladies' Beauty Parlor and also a Fancy Store in her locality for the last 10 years. She looks after the beauty parlor. In the morning her husband helps to run the Fancy shop. After completion of her housework, Nandita spends the rest of her time in the business. To improve her business a step further she wants to access a loan along with 12 members from her locality by forming a Self-Help Group.

At present her monthly income is about Rs.7,000, but this is not sufficient to lead a better life. So, she wants to take a loan to purchase cosmetic items for the Fancy store as well as beauty creams for her beauty parlor.  Her future plan is to give higher education to her child.

The other 12 members of her group are Pravasini, Bhamisuta, Anandini, Puspanjali, Sushila, Kausalya, Jangyaseni, Bilasini, Sujata, Santoshini, Bilasa and Sakhi. They also want a loan for different purposes like vegetable vending, betel shop, hotel, tea stall, grocery shop, paddy rice and tailoring business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic items like face cream, foundation cream, Mahendi, etc., for the Fancy store as well as beauty creams for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Luz Stella

texts.es:
Ella es luz stella una persona muy dedicada  a las cosas y los planes que emprende, es una buena mamá, tiene 3 hijos por los cuales ha luchado mucho , es madre soltera, el hijo mayor tiene 19 años, el nombre es Jefferson Alexander, el segundo hijo tiene 11 años,  el nombre es Diego Andrés  y el tercer hijo tiene 9 años se llama Kevin Santiago,  ellos son el motor,  el orgullo y el  motivo para querer hacer lo que había dejado en el olvido, quiere que los sueños se hagan realidad, es muy perseverante, es una persona  que consigue lo que quiere, ella siempre dice que nunca es tarde para hacer  lo que se propone, la prioridad entre otras muchas que tiene en la vida, es poder seguir estudiando, el año pasado con mucho esfuerzo logro sacar los estudios secundarios adelante, la meta a seguir es poder graduarse de Enfermera que es algo que siempre le ha gustado, trabaja cuidando a una persona de tercera edad desde hace ya casi 5 años  y eso ha despertado aun mas las ganas por escoger esta profesión tan bonita, siente que lo que quiere  es poder ayudar a las personas que lo necesiten.
Como ya lo menciono antes es madre soltera y los recursos no le alcanzan para mantener el hogar con todo lo que requiere y pagar en valor de las cuotas, ella agradecería si kiva le puede otorgar el subsidio ya que los recursos económicos son bastante limitados.
texts.en:
This is Luz Stella, a person who is very dedicated to the tasks and projects that she undertakes. She is a single mother and she is a good mother. Her oldest son is 19 years old, and his name is Jefferson Alexander; her second son, Diego Andrés, is 11 years old, and her third son, Kevin Santiago, is 9. They are her driving force and her motive for wanting to do that which she had allowed to fall into oblivion—make her dreams a reality. She is a very persevering person who achieves her goals; and she always says that it is never too late to do what you intend to do.

One priority, among the many that she has in her life, is to continue studying. Last year, with great effort, she was able to move forward with her secondary studies. Her goal is to graduate as a nurse, which is something that has always attracted her; her work for the past five years has been caring for an elderly person, which has increased her desire to pursue such a beautiful career. She feels that what she wants is to be able to give help to the people who need it. 

As she mentioned earlier, she is a single mother; and her resources don’t stretch far enough to pay for all the household expenses, in addition to the fees.  She is thankful that Kiva can provide her with a loan, as her economic resources are fairly limited.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à  HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs sixièmes prêts avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  AOUA fait le commerce de pomme de terre dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 10 sacs de 50 kg de pomme de terre, elle s’approvisionne  marché. Elle vend au détail à la maison et à HAMDALLAYE à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Group Danaya’s four members are married women, who are on average 43 years old with three children. Most live in traditional families in Hamdallaye, one of the popular neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali. To meet customer demand, this is their sixth loan with microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso.

In this group of women, Mrs. Aoua trades in potatoes. She is standing in first position from the left to the right in the photo. With her loan, she is planning on purchasing ten 50-kilo bags of potatoes; she gets her supplies from the market. She retails from home and in Hamdallaye, to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and grants credits.

She is expecting an average monthly profit of 40,000 XOF, part of which will be used to pay back her loan with interest, with the rest going to her savings.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Tusisumbuane Group

texts.en:
Musa, who is a father of two kids, is aged in his late twenties. Musa's kids, a boy and a girl are still young. For two years now Musa has been managing a shop selling cooking oil, rice, sugar, match boxes and many more things. He opens his business from 07am to 03pm per working day and is able to make a small monthly profit. 
This is Musa's fourth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, to buy business products like rice, maize flour, beans, cooking oil etc. Musa is really doing good with his business. He manages well his business and earned an extra income which he used to plow back to his business and to cover household expenses. Musa is requesting another loan which he will use to buy stock products for the shop. In the coming days, Musa would like to build a house. 

He will share this loan with his loan group" TUSISUMBUANE GROUP" which consist of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock products for his shop.

loans.name: Maa Bimala Group

texts.en:
Debaki, age 33, is a very active lady from a rural village named Baldha in Balangir district in Odisha, India. Baldha village is located at a distance of 110 kilometers from the district Head Quarters of Balangir. Debaki lives with her husband. She has one son who is 16 years old and one daughter who is 14 years old and both are continuing their studies. Debaki has been running a bicycle repair center for the last 10 years with the help of her husband. Her husband repairs bicycles and sells bicycle spare parts to the customers at a reasonable rate. He has very good technical skills in his occupation and his customers from the nearby villages trust him very much. He brings cycle spare parts thrice a month from the nearby town of Khariar, which is 6 km. from the village. From the present business, Debaki earns 200 INR per day, which is hand-to-mouth for her. Due to this situation, until now she has not been able to construct a good house for her family.  So these poor situations compel Debaki to search for a credit source for the expansion of her business. To fulfill her dream, in January 2014 Debaki, along with 13 other women in her village formed a Self Help Group named Maa Bimala and applied for a loan from KIVA partner Mahashakti Foundation for further expansion of her husband’s business. She will use the loan to buy bicycle repair tools and spare parts in larger quantities, which will help her to provide better services to her clients and increase her profits. Debaki hopes to build a permanent cycle repair cabin in her village.

The other 13 members of the group are also involved in small enterprises and service work like a milk business, bakery, fabrication work, vegetable cultivation, cloth vending, sweet item making and selling, leaf plate making and selling, auto repairing,  bore well digging etc.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle repair tools and spare parts

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de arroz, dedicándose a este rubro desde hace 14 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevo soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo de arroz y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 57 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in the Pomahuaca district, a community with a hot climate.  The people there work in farming, commerce, and raising livestock.  It is located in the province of Jaen in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works as a farmer, especially planting rice.  He has done this work for 14 years, so he has experience. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase fertilizer for his rice crop.  This will allow him to have good production to offer his customers and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es:
Héctor es un campesino humilde y trabajador, que lucha constantemente para sacar adelante a su familia conformada por su esposa y sus 4 hijos.
Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar como pescador independiente, los pescados que obtiene del río Magdalena los comercializa en la plaza de mercado del municipio para generar recursos y llevar el sustento a su hogar; sin embargo, debido a la cantidad de pescadores que hay en la zona, en algunas ocasiones no logra generar ganancias por su labor, esto lo impulsó a buscar otras alternativas para complementar sus ingresos, fue entonces cuando decidió aprender a cultivar plátano y desde hace 4 años viene alternando ambas actividades, logrando buenos resultados.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, larvicidas), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando sus cultivos para obtener una cosecha más productiva y aumentar el margen de utilidades por venta.
Héctor, a sus 55 años de edad, se proyecta hacia un futuro cercano, ampliando sus cultivos para que le garantice una estabilidad económica con la que le pueda brindar mejor calidad de vida y bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor is a humble and hardworking farmer who constantly fights to move his family forward.  He has a wife and four children.  During his life, he has worked as an independent fisherman.  The fish he catches in the Magdalena river are sold in the plaza of the town market to generate income and support his household.  However, due to the quantity of fishermen in the area, he is sometimes not able to earn money from his work.  This caused him to look for other alternatives to add to his income, so he decided to learn to grow bananas.  For four years, he has alternated both activities and is getting good results.

He is requesting this loan to purchase farming supplies at wholesale (fertilizer, pesticide, and larvicide), which will allow him to continue caring for his crops to obtain a more productive harvest and increase the margin of utility for sale.  

Héctor, at his 55 years old, is looking to the near future, to increase his crops to guaranty a stable financial situation so that he can provide a better quality of life and well-being for his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies at wholesale (fertilizer, pesticide, larvicide).

loans.name: Haijar

texts.en:
Haijar was born in 1953. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat with her retired husband. Haijar has been running her mini market for four year. She started her project after she noticed the financial crisis her husband has been facing. So she decided to support him in improving their living conditions. 

Now she needs to merchandise her mini market with new food products as it is now out of products, and to do some repairs to it. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to merchandise her mini market with new food products

loans.name: Maa Bastaren-A Group

texts.en:
In January 2014, 11 women entrepreneurs from a remotely located rural village called Jurabandh in the Balangir district of Odisha, India formed a Self Help Group (SHG) named Maa Bastren-A with the objective of expanding their existing businesses by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Mamata, a most active and energetic lady of 30 years who is standing in front with her hand raised in the photo is one of them. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband, one son age six and two daughters who are twelve and ten years old.

For the last 10 years, Mamata has been running a clothing vending business with the help and support of her husband. She and her husband purchase ready-made garments from a wholesale market 100 kilometers away from her village. Her husband moves to different villages and weekly markets on a bike to sell the garments. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR from her existing business. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So Mamata wants to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business. With the present loan of 16,000 INR, she is planning to purchase some quality fancy garments for selling. Mamata hopes that this will definitely generate a handsome amount of extra income. She has a dream of saving enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house. 

The other 10 members of the group are doing small businesses like a goatery, vegetable vending, onion cultivation, milk selling, a general store etc.

loans.use: To purchase ready-made fancy garments to sell

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru: Нуриле 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Нурилы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нурила занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нурилы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 1 кобыла, 5 коз а также имеет земельный надел размером 3,50 ГА, на которой выращивает ячмень, пшеницу, картофель и сено. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурила обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Нурила планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на образование дочери.
texts.en: Nurila is a 59-year-old native of the Rudaki district, married, and has three children. Nurila has a high school education and earns her family's main income through animal husbandry. She started in the livestock business 6 years ago when she purchased cattle for 10,000 som. Thanks to her hard work, Nurila now has 4 dairy cows, 1 mare, 5 goats, and a 3.5 hectare plot of land for planting barley, wheat, potatoes and hay. She earns 10,000 som per month. In order to expand her farm, Nurila asked Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy cows to fatten and sell at the market for a profit. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and to save money for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more caustic and red oil to produce more local soap.

loans.name: Maa Bastaren-B Group

texts.en:
Maa Bastaren-B is a Joint Liability Group (JLG) formed in January 2014 by 11 active women entrepreneurs from Juarbandh village in Bolangir district in Odisha, India to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing businesses. Nirupama is one of them. The lady standing in front with her hand raised in the photograph is Nirupama. She is a very active lady of 29 years who lives with her husband, one son who is seven years old and one daughter who is four years old. Both are studying in school.
 
Nirupama has been running a screen printing unit in her house with the help of her husband for the last eight years. She takes orders for printing of invitation cards and supplies ready made invitation cards to the customers. Her husband purchases the materials like chemicals, paper, color etc. from the nearest wholesale market, which is 40 kilometers away. Her screen printing center has name and fame in the locality for its timely delivery and quality work. Her daily net income in the marriage season (December-June) is 500 INR and in the normal season is 200 INR. But in the present market context, this income is not sufficient for her to manage the household and other expenses. Nirupama is a hard working woman and she wants to expand her business. So with the present loan, she wants to purchase cards, colors and chemicals in bulk to reduce the purchasing cost as she replenishes her stock frequently. Nirupama hopes to educate her children and construct a good house. Like Nirupama, the other 10 members of the group are doing cotton cultivation, vegetable cultivation, a fancy store, a general grocery shop, a Tiffin stall, a tailoring center etc.

loans.use: To purchase cards, colors and chemicals in bulk for screen printing

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar was born in 1991. She is a widow living in a sector in Jordan called Marka. Anwar has been trying her best to support herself financially by selling Russian golden accessories for the past year. She started with a small amount of accessories and found it profitable. 

Now she wants to purchase a larger quantity of Russian golden accessories and add a variety of them. This will help her cover her needs. But she doesn't have enough money to purchase more accessories. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more Russian golden accessories for her business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 30 years old from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with with three children, ages one to four. Amelia is engaged in fishing together with her husband. She helps him everyday in ensuring that the tools for fishing are ready and available.

She is asking for a loan to buy a fish net and an engine for her fishing boat. She hopes that someday they can have other business opportunities that will enable them to live a good life.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and an engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is a 38-year-old experienced farmer, from the village of Ratevani. She lives with her husband, parents-in-law, and two school-aged children. To take care of her family’s everyday needs, Maka is engaged in milking cows, breeding pigs, and cultivating of potatoes, maize, and beans. They also cultivate vineyard and sell wine for a good price. Maka's husband trades with the agricultural products at the local market, which is the main source of the family income.
 
Maka wants to be involved in another parallel activity, to ensure that she will be able to cover the monthly payments freely. A loan of 3,000 GEL will be a huge support to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling them to purchase stocks of clothing and start trading.

So she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, which gives a chance for people to start or re-start businesses. Maka and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their trading business.

loans.use: to start a trading business with clothing.

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Group

texts.en:
Gitanjali is 29 years old and married with one son and one daughter of 8 years and 2 years old. She hails from a rural village named Rigdol of Balangir district in Odisha, India. The lady sitting with raised hand in the photograph is Gitanjali. She is a very active and strong-minded lady. She earns a living by farming vegetables and supplying them to traders. The income of 4000 INR per month that she gets from her existing business is not sufficient for maintaining her family, so she was in search of a credit source for the expansion of her business.

When Mahashakti Foundation started an intervention in her village in January 2014, Gitanjali organised other 12 women members of her village with similar backgrounds and formed a Self Help Group (SHG) to access a loan. From this loan of 12,000 INR she wants to purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticide and farm inputs for the extension of her farming. She hopes that this will help her achieve more income generation to fulfill her dream of construction of a house. 

The other 12 members, Padei, Manju, Hira, Kia, Sumati, SubHasini, KShirabue, Basanti, Sabita, Janata, Labanga and Rita, are also doing different types of business like milk selling, vegetable cultivation and vending, bamboo crafts, chicken selling, rice vending, etc.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing seeds, fertilizer, pesticide and farm inputs for the extension of her farming.

loans.name: M. Javaid Ahmed

texts.en:
M. Javaid Ahmed is a 45-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of two daughters and two sons. 

His daughters have reached the age of marriage, but he does not have enough savings to arrange a dowry for them. He is growing old with the passage of time and always worries about the future of his daughters. One son has a job in an industry, and one son attends college. 

He has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy rexine, leather, shoe polish, buckles, nails, and thread for making shoes.  He is a shoemaker and wholesaler by profession and has been making shoes for many years. Now, he is one of the finest professional shoemakers in the market. He makes shoes by hand for both genders with the help of cobblers, and his handmade shoes are very famous in his hometown. 

M. Javaid Ahmed wants to grow his business so that he can increase his savings for his daughters' dowries. He has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he can make his ambitions come true. He will use the full amount for increasing business so that he can eliminate his worries. 

He is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rexine, leather, shoe polish, buckles, nails, and thread for making shoes.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is a married man. He has 10 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a farm where he grows tea to sell. His business is located in a rural area. He describes his family challenge to be poor toilet facility.

He will use the KES 28,000 loan to buy cement, sand, iron sheets, and other materials to construct a toilet which will benefit 10 family members. He hopes that in the future, he will have a healthy family. This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron sheets, and other materials to construct a toilet.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha was born in 1977. She is a widowed lady living in an area of Jordan called Wihdat. Maha has been trying her best to support herself financially by running her own beauty salon in her house for the past four years. She started it at home, then she opened a special room for it. 

Now she needs to buy more cosmetic products with added variety in order to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Soatposho

texts.ru: Соатпошо работает учительницей в средней школе района Рудаки. Там же она живет с двумя сыновьями и невестками. Ее сыновья работают в сфере торговой деятельности. Их жены домохозяйки, они следят за порядком дома и помогают Соатпошо. Из-за того что зарплата учительницы маленькая Соатпошо дополнительно дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев на заказ. Для многих женщин в Таджикистане повседневная и парадная одежда является национальной. По этой причине многие девушки и женщины учатся шить, чтобы предоставлять услуги шитья национальной одежды. Соатпошо не стала исключением. Соатпошо хочет взять кредит и купить швейную машинку, потому что ее старая машинка совсем устарела и часто ломается. Она надеется, что ее поддержат, и она сможет купить швейную машинку и продолжит деятельность.
texts.en: Soatposho is a teacher at a high school in the Rudaki district. She lives there with her two sons and daughters-in-law. Her sons are engaged in trade activities and their wives help Soatposho at home. Because teacher salaries are small, she also works as a seamstress and sews traditional dresses to order. Many women in Tajikistan wear both casual and dressy traditional clothing, so many girls and women also learn to sew in order to offer their services sewing traditional clothing. Soatposho is no exception. She wants to take out a loan to buy a new sewing machine because hers is completely outdated and often breaks. She hopes for support so that she will be able to buy a sewing machine and continue working.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 37 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. Her husband is a plumber by profession and is mainly responsible for providing for the family's needs. 

Shabana has had a business selling clothing for past six years and contributes her income to help manage the household. She needs to buy different types of clothes to resell, but due to insufficient funds, she is not in the position to buy additional clothes. 

She has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she can easily purchase the clothes and fulfill her business needs. She can earn more income to support her family and business.

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sajadi

texts.en:
Sajadi is a 55-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling cloths for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Sajadi requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a 40-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has six children, ages two to twenty two years old. For 22 years now, she and her husband have been engaged in fishing. This gave her an average income of 5,000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy an engine for her fishing boat.

In the future, she hopes to send all her children and live in comfort and abundance.

loans.use: to buy an engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario lives at Alcala. He is 59 years old and married. He is very proud to be a farmer. 

He plants and harvests rice to sell. He had been in this business for 20 years and has a large crop production. 

Mario is asking for loan because he still wants to continue gaining a fruitful harvest. He is asking for 25,000 PHP to pay laborers to cultivate the land and to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. 

He hopes to have more patience for managing his farm and for future crop development for his family's welfare.

loans.use: to pay laborers and to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Fehmeeda

texts.en:
Fehmeeda is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her daughter. 

Her husband has been running his own garment business for 15 years. He is mainly responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Fehmeeda's husband needs to purchase different types of ready-made clothes in bulk for reselling, but due to insufficient funds, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Fehmeeda is applying for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. She can assist her husband and purchase the ready-made clothes in bulk for his business. He will be able to increase the size of his business and earn more profit. 

Fehmeeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of ready-made clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gruhalaxmi Group

texts.en:
Sargiguda, Ward No-01 is a slum area of Titilagarh town in the Balangir district of Odisha, India. In this ward most of the residents are from the poor community. The people of Mahar community (weavers of bamboo crafts) are among them. They reside in small huts and their children rarely get good education. The main business of this community is making hand fans of bamboo and selling them in the market and supplying them to traders. The income they get from this is hand-to-mouth for them. Rama, aged about 51, is a woman from this community. She is sitting in the middle in the photo with raised hand.  She is married and lives with her husband, one daughter of 11 and two sons of 15 and 13 years 

Rama is doing her traditional work of bamboo hand fan making and marketing. Rama and her husband together do the processing work and make hand fans. They procure the raw bamboo from a distance of 100 kms. Her husband goes by train to bring back the material. Both the wife and husband sell the finished products in the town market. Apart from making hand fans, Rama also procures finished products from the neighbors and sells them in bulk to the traders from other places.

Rama earns a monthly income of Rs.4,000 from this business. According to Rama, this small income is not at all sufficient to meet the requirements of her family. In this situation she was in search of a credit source, and Mahashakti came to work in the same area. Along with the other 12 members, Rama formed a Self Help Group named Gruhalaxmi and accessed a loan of 12,000 INR. From this loan she is planning to purchase more raw bamboo for working for a longer period to raise her production and earn more income and also purchase finished products to supply. 

Rama hopes to construct a house and provide better education to her children and lead a prestigious life. The other twelve members of this group are Lalita, Kunti, Kandari, Teja, Rajkumari, Dripadi, Prabhasini, Sarita, Nilendri, Sibani, Santi and Lakshmi and they are doing different types of micro enterprises like general store, vegetable vending, fast food centre, home shopping, cycle store, etc.

loans.use: to buy more raw bamboo and finished products for added income to construct a better house and educate her children.

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban is 49 years old and from Nyahururu. He is married to Jane, and they are blessed with four children, ages 15,13,10, and 8 years.

Laban has operated a butcher shop in Nyahururu town for the past 20 years. His monthly income is KES 15,000. He has applied for his first loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya. The funds will help him in the purchase of goats for slaughter. 

He will use the proceeds to buy livestock so as to sustain his business with minimal expenditure, as well as pay back his loan. Laban hopes to open several butcher shops in the town.

loans.use: To buy goats for slaughter.

loans.name: Nice

texts.en:
Nice is a new client who comes from Rushenyi, Ntungamo. She is separated from her husband, and she looks after a family of six children. 

She applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX to buy manure and to hire labor to work on the banana plantation. She also wants to plant tomatoes since it's planting season. 

Nice wants to increase production which will increase her earnings. She needs to pay school fees for the children who are in school.

loans.use: to buy manure

loans.name: Yhimi Honan

texts.es:
Yhimi tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad ubicada en la carretera Olmos – Corral Quemado, su población en la mayoría se dedica al comercio y agricultura especialmente de frutales, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El tiene un taller de carpintería metálica, ubicado en su domicilio en la cual elabora diferentes productos de metales como son puertas, ventanas, escaleras, con una experiencia de más de 06 años en el negocio, por su buen servicio y su experiencia cuenta con bastante cliente de su zona, además se desempeña como maestro de construcción, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales y herramientas y de esta manera seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Yhimi is 37 years old, and he lives with his wife and children in the district of San Felipe, a community located along the Olmos-Corral Quemado Highway.  Most of the people here work in commerce and agriculture, especially fruit farming.  It is located within the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region in Peru’s Northern Sierra. 

He has a metalworking shop in his home, where he fabricates various metal products such as doors, windows, and stairs. He has more than six years’ experience in this business. Because of his good service and experience, he has a lot of customers in his zone, and he is also a master builder. He has requested a loan of 4,000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to purchase materials and tools, and in this way, continue working.

loans.use: to purchase materials and tools.

loans.name: Jay Nanuman Group

texts.en:
Bisakha, aged 27, is the leader of a group that hails from Sargada village of Balangir district of Odisha, India. She lives with her husband and two children aged 6 and 2 years. The member sitting in the middle with raised hand in the front row in the photograph is Bisakha. 

Bisakha has a piece of land in her village which she is using for vegetable cultivation with the active support of her husband. Her husband helps her in vegetable cultivation and in selling the produce in the nearby market. Bisakha, along with other 15 members of her village, formed a group and took out a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses.  This is their first loan from Mahashakti Foundation.  Before accessing the loan, Bisakha's sales were not sufficient to meet her daily requirements. Out of their small income they were maintaining their family in a very pitiable condition. 

Now she is very much confident in vegetable cultivation and has acquainted herself with the market situation. At present her monthly income is about 6,000 INR. She wanted to take the loan to expand her vegetable cultivation and marketing.  She planned to purchase seeds, fertilizer and a pump set from the present loan to improve her cultivation and make it a continuous process.

The other 15 members of her group are Rebati, Bhumisuta, Sanju, Padma,Sujata, Atabi, Bachani, Munu, Bimala, Alladini, Elabati, Jayashri, Rasmi, Bhagyabati and Hemangini who are doing grocery shop, vegetable cultivation, milk business, mixture shop, chicken stall, rice trading, laundry, etc.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing seeds, fertilizer and a pump set  to improve her cultivation and make it a continuous process.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies including fabric, thread and buttons, and to pay off the semi-industrial cutting machine he purchased.

loans.name: Ebtisam

texts.en:
Ebtisam, who was born in 1984, is widowed and lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. For the past year, she has been supporting herself by running a business selling blankets. 

Ebtisam started her enterprise with a small quantity of blankets but now wants to expand. She is therefore requesting this loan to purchase a large quantity of blankets to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business

loans.name: Qnqush

texts.en:
Qnqush lives in the Ani Kayaran village of Shirak region. She lives there with her husband and their 23-year-old son. 

The family has been involved in husbandry keeping for many years. They currently own cows, calves, and chickens. Near the house where they live, Qnqush also cultivates barley. They gather milk and meat that Qnqush's husband sells locally, so he can earn income for the family. 

Because of hard financial times, the family hasn't been able to save money and expand the farm. Therefore Qnqush has applied for this loan.

She will be very grateful to lenders if they support her to purchase piglets, an ox, and forage for feeding the livestock. This will enable her to enlarge the farm that they run, and the whole family will be very grateful to lenders.

As this is Qnqush's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for piglets, an ox, and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores que posteriormente los engorda y ofrecer en el mercado de su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevo soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlo a un mejor precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Araceli is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Buenos Aires district. Her community works in agriculture, trade, and ranching. It is located in the Morropon province which belongs to the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru. 

She works in raising young animals that she latter fattens and sells at the community market. She has applied for a loan of 1,000 Nuevo Soles to buy nutritious food to fatten her animals. This way she can offer a good price to her customers.

loans.use: to buy nutritious food to fatten the animals.

loans.name: Naveeda

texts.en: Naveeda is a 31 year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years with her husband.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stock of grains, oil, and flour. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of grains, oil and flour.

loans.name: Casse Auto 1 Group

texts.fr: CASSE AUTO 1 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Éléonore Abla (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), âgée de 35 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. C’est la deuxième fois que  dame Éléonore Abla sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé. Éléonore Abla ne vit plus avec son mari. Éléonore Abla a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Éléonore Abla vit seule. Les diverses charges familiales sont assumées par Éléonore Abla et son mari. Pour ce faire, Éléonore Abla vend des boissons et des cartes de recharge depuis dix ans. Éléonore Abla s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Éléonore Abla ensemble avec les membres du groupe CASSE AUTO 1 sollicitent pour la première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Casse Auto 1 group is composed of three people living in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Eleonore Abla (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 35 years old. She did not attend school. This is the first time that Eleonore Abla is seeking financial support from ALIDé. She is separated from her husband. She has three children, all in school and in her care. She lives by herself. Eleonore Abla and her husband provide for various family needs. In order to so, Eleonore Abla has been selling beverages and cellular phone refill cards for 10 years. She stocks up locally. In order to strengthen her business and meet customer demand, Eleonore Abla, together with the other members of the Casse Auto 1 group is seeking  the first group loan from ALIDe.

loans.use: to buy cellular phone refill cars and beverages.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Santo Tomás una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura , especialmente de café, la población también se dedica al comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado vacuno, junto a su esposo tienen cultivos de cafeto, son una familia emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 500 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra del mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y una segunda parte para la compra de abonos y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Reina is 58 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Santo Tomás district. This community works in agriculture - particularly coffee. The population also works in trade and ranching. It is located in the Cutervo province which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. 

She works in the business of raising and selling cattle. She and her husband also have coffee tree plants. They are an entrepreneurial family. 

She has requested a loan of 4,500 Nuevos Soles with Edpyme Alternativa to buy manual labor to maintain her coffee crops. The second part will be used to buy fertilizers in order to have a timely production to offer their customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and caustic for her business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is 34 years old. She lives in a section of Jordan called Salt with her five children and her parents. Yasmeen is studying for a Masters’ degree with a major in Programming Engineering. She is in her first year. She is planning to find a better job after her graduation and to earn a better income in order to support her family. But because of the financial crisis that her family has been facing, she was not able to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Davronjon

texts.ru: Давронджону 20 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями и братьями. Давронджон отлично учился в школе и после окончания средней школы он поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет в факультет Геоэкологии. Его мать работает учительницей в средней школе. Его отец трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Они не имеет возможности оплатить за его учебный договор. Давронджон должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Davronjon is 20 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and brothers. Davronjon was an excellent student in high school, and after graduating from high school, he was admitted to the Khudjand State University, where he majors in geoecology. His mother is a high school teacher. His father is currently a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. They are unable to pay for Davronjon's tuition. Davronjon has to settle his tuition bill but lacks the necessary funds. He is requesting a loan to pay for his university tuition. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition at the university.

loans.name: Authur

texts.en: Authur is a Kiva borrower. He operates a restaurant where he cooks food for sale. His primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of a good restaurant kitchen. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy tiles, sinks, and other materials to upgrade his restaurant kitchen.
